results.description:
New members are always welcomed - After you join, please make sure you RSVP early so we can reserve a seat for you.

We discuss current business methods at the meetings . If you want to share an method with the group, so they have "time to think about it." Please email me and I'll include your issue/concern with my weekly email address to the entire meetup group, not just this weeks attendees.

The basic agenda is...

09:30 to 09:50 Networking

09:50 to 10:10 Introductions

10:10 to 11:00 Current Business Methods

11:00 and on.... Open and Individual Networking

Be ready to discuss your business and be open to hear some new ideas/criticism that will require you to look at yourself/your business differently.

Most people take a few notes, so some paper would be good.

Best Regards,
Steve Navazio
results.name: Explore your opportunities and threats

results.description:
For coworking space, it's first come first served. You'll want to get there early to find a desk before it fills up. The space is available from 10am to 6pm. If you are planning on attending, you'll need to do the following things:

• Register at the AWS Pop-up Loft Space - https://aws.amazon.com/start-ups/loft/ny-loft/

• Once you are registered you can pick up a badge and attend any of the co-working meetups.

• Let us know you are going by signing up for the event on meetup. This also lets other people in the group know who is going to be there too.

• Remember to check the Pop-up Loft website to make sure it is open. We'll do out best to cancel meetups on holidays and days the space won't be available but you should also double check before coming out.

• While there are snacks and drinks at the space, lunch is not provided. There are a number of restaurants, delis and other places to get food in the area so plan accordingly

• These daily coworking events are self run. A co-organizer will not always be at the event. These events are designed to give game developers a free space to work so you'll basically be left alone at the space to do you own thing. We suggest reaching out to other attending through the comments to sit together or meet up at a specific time in the space.

Last thing, two times a month we'll have a dedicated space for you to come out and work as well as listen to talks and get help from myself and others in the community. Those will be different events you'll need to register for which are separate from the daily co-working space.
results.name: Indie Coworking Space

results.description:
We're still working our way through Kit Eason's F# Functional Data Structures class. We have 1.5 hours scheduled and will be able to make it through the final modules -- Trees and Choosing a Data Structure, listed below -- plus have some discussion afterwards! This week we're also choosing the next course that we'll watch! Don't miss out. :) 

Description

F# is a .NET (CLI) language. It combines functional and OO (Object Oriented) concepts to you let you solve complex problems with simple code. F# is surprisingly easy to learn. This course covers the fundamentals, and is suitable for anyone with basic software development experience.

About Kit

Kit is a senior software developer for an energy trading systems provider. He has also developed software for automotive engineering companies, universities, energy suppliers, banks, and financial services companies. Kit has run many educational and training courses, including evening classes, women's electronics classes and CNC training for engineers. Kit is a regular speaker at SkillsMatter in London, and at various conferences and meetups. He works mainly in F# and C# and normally speaks on F# and related matters.

Trees 15m 42s

Introduction 1m 9s

Trees Using Recursive OO Types 3m 12s

Discriminated Unions 1m 7s

Trees and Discriminated Unions 7m 41s

Choosing a Tree Representation 1m 32s

Summary 59s

Choosing a Data Structure 33m 10s

Introduction 1m 34s

Choosing a Data Structure for Productivity 3m 18s

Type Providers 6m 42s

Choosing a Data Structure for Reliability 2m 41s

Making Illegal States Unrepresentable 7m 38s

Choosing a Data Structure for Maintainability 3m 46s

Choosing a Data Structure for Performance 1m 53s

The Array.parallel Module 2m 43s

Principles of Performance 54s

Summary 1m 56s
results.how_to_find_us: Enter from the River St. entrance, and security will send you up. We're on the 8th floor. Once you get in the office, reception will guide you to the room.
results.name: Kit Eason's F# Data Structures class, part 4

results.description:
Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

"Thank you Tracy for a wonderful start to the day. Amazing calmness capturing everyone's energy on the class. Look forward to attending the next on-line class. Thank you." - B.J

"Very enlightening and a positive way for those that can't make it physically to do so remotely.""Thank you, the second section moved me the most. I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

"Truly inspirational, loved it, thank you ." - Anonymous

"Really loved being able to just switch on and meditate." - L.M.

"So relaxing and cleansing." - T.H.

"Awesome meditation Tracy! One of the most powerful sessions I have ever had. Wow." - G.R.

"I absolutely loved the meditation. The music was one that I truly enjoyed. Thank you so much for this. Many blessings to you." - S.

FOR DETAILS OF ALL UPCOMING 'MEDITATION 101 LIVE' SESSIONS PLEASE CLICK HERE.

Follow Meditation 101 Live on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn.

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
The amazing thing about Zhineng Qigong is that it places us in a position to heal ourselves. All of the intricate movements carefully studied and designed by Dr. Pang Ming along with the perceptions of Qi allow us to discipline the mind and body to create healing within ourselves. This harnessing of Qi energy also has external positive healing effects on other human beings, plants, animals, things. Qi seems to interact with the spectrum of all things in creation.

Please join me throughout the year of 2016 as we continue to build our practice and discover the scientific studies on the Qi of Zhineng Qigong.

This Friday January 8th 4-6pm we will perform Level 1 at least 2 times. It is a great opportunity for beginners to join in and learn the movements. Experienced practitioners are also welcomed to join in and share their experiences. All are welcome to experience the benefits of the built up Qi field.


The major process: As this group is focused on building the practice of Zhineng Qigong through the act of practicing, we will focus on the perceptions that go along with the movements. We will gradually learn and include the Three Centers Merge into our practice routine. After our Qi field is built up we will sometimes practice LaQi and FaQi.


The minor process: Beginning this Friday January 8, we will discuss Dr. Pang's definition of Qi. Throughout the year we will look at the achievements of physicists in describing the structure of the universe and attempt to discover if there is a relationship between their knowledge and the definition of Qi. We will also attempt to discover the relationship of the human mind to Qi. Discussions on these theories will be kept simple and after our repetitions of Level 1 is complete.

Later in the year as the weather warms we will organize some 'Qigong walk and talk' in nature trails of Bear Mountain and practice Qigong in nature as well! See you soon!

Cost $5
results.name: Zhineng Qigong Practice Group

results.description:
Hi there,

We find ourselves challenged to maintain an environment that would encourage our kids to learn the German language and culture. Like many in the area, we live far from family that could provide more frequent interactions in German. Since our partners are English speaking, we'd like to create opportunities for our kids to experience German not only through interacting with us parents but also with others. Hence, we would love to build supporting networks with other parents and their babies & children that would like to interact and have fun(!) in German on a regular basis.


Since the summer is winding down we have to find a good place for the fall and those cold winter days : ) Any suggestions for good places for us to play or things to do are very welcome.

See you soon!

Maria & Renate

results.description:
Hey New York/New Jersey Outdoor Afros!

 *Are you an outdoor enthusiast who wants to lead creative and accessible outdoor events?

*Are you invested in leveraging the outdoors to improve Black family health?

*Are you inspired by the Buffalo Soldiers, Benjamin Banneker, Harriet Tubman,George Washington Carver and Wangari Maathai?

*Do you want to connect to a nationally recognized network of Black Americans who share your love for the outdoors?

If these questions resonate with you, APPLY TODAY to join the 2016 Outdoor Afro Leadership Team (OALT).

Here is what we require:

*Facilitate a minimum 1 Outdoor Afro sponsored event every month

*Participate in regular conference calls with other OA Leaders

*Develop two new Outdoor Afro Leadership Team ambassadors in your region

*Live within 50 miles of an REI store (preferred)

Leader perks include:

-Select FREE premium gear and supplies from sponsors KEEN Shoes, REI, Klean Kanteen, and more!

-Three day intensive training and unforgettable bonding with fellow Outdoor Afro Leaders in beautiful Yosemite National Park

-Professional support, coaching, and outdoor skills development training

-The ability to make a tangible and positive difference for your local community and the natural world

For more information and to download our application, please: visit http://www.outdoorafro.com/2015/11/2016-outdoor-afro-leadership-team-now-recruiting/

Deadline to submit applications is January 8, 2016.

***This posting is a call for applications, NOT AN EVENT!
results.name: APPLY to Join the Outdoor Afro Leadership Team!

results.description:
This is the first of a three-session workshop designed to introduce beginning photographers to the art and craft of producing high-end headshot photos.


In this first session attendees will be introduced to the elements of what makes a headshot picture stands out.
They will learn the factors each of the following elements has on the design and production of exceptional headshots:


• Head shape

• Hairstyle and makeup elements that have major impact on headshot productions
     o Updos Vs. Curls, etc.
     o Makeup colors and contouring tips that complement and enhance the client’s looks
     o Hair and Makeup relations to eye and outfit colors worn by the subject being photographed


• Simple posing positions

• Basic outdoors and indoors headshot lighting conditions and setups

• Optimum camera setting for headshop photography

• The ideal lens for headshot photography.

I intend to bring a model to this workshop for demonstration and for the attendee to practice what they have been learned in the class.


This session worth $250 per person taking somewhere else. I will offered for free. Refreshments will be provided.

I will need a minimum of 7 persons to attend in order to hold this workshop.

Prerequisite: 

Introduction to Essential Camera Settings and Composition Techniques workshop.
results.name: Glamour & Headshot Photography – Free Beginner Workshop

You are going to be actively participating in creating fabulous masterpieces of Turkish cuisine during the class. Our experienced instructors will teach and help you improve your cooking skills. results.description:
I am  launching a " Year of Change- 30 min-30 days to falling in love with your life."This is a project in which I invite you on monthly challenges that we will do together. I will keep you updated on my progress each week via blog and Youtube.~ This month's challenge is to spend 30 minutes everyday in Meditation. This will overlap slightly with February's Challenge. 

We will meet in person two times a month. Once to set the stage and once to keep the motivation going!! You can join in any or all of my adventures. I think this is going to be an awesome adventure!

To join me: Subscribe to both my

Youtube Channel (There is a Meditation playlist with 5 meditations that are 30 minutes or over)

and My Blog: The first blog is already up!

https://theindigopapillon.wordpress.com

Please take the time to fill out this short survey, so that I can best know how to help you on this journey!

results.description:
This will be our very first meetup as a group and I hope to meet as many of you as possible! Looking at our own calendars Diasha and I decided to wait to schedule a meetup until after the holidays as schedules are likely to be hectic for a lot of people. 

The plan will be to meet at 6:00pm in Manhattan for this meetup. Feel free to come after 6:00pm. There is no formal end time, however, we usually do introductions towards the beginning of a meetup to get to know one another.

Bar location will be announced closer to the date of the event. We try to find a place that is good for groups, reasonably priced and is accessible as many of us will be coming from different parts of the city. 

If you RSVP Yes to the event you will be informed of any event changes, including when we add a specific location. 

If you have any questions/concerns feel free to reach out to either of us by sending the group a message. 

Hope to see everyone there and enjoy the holidays! 

-Jen
results.how_to_find_us: We will send out a message with where to meet and contact information the day of the event to help ensure you find our group!
results.name: Post- Holiday Happy Hour- Meet and Greet

venue.name: The Yoga Collective

results.description:
A stress relieving practice dedicated to all.

ALL LEVELS WELCOME.

The purpose of this group is to get people interested in yoga together - the ones that have already found the joy of yoga, the ones that are interested and want to try it, the ones that would like to practice together or to discuss yoga related topics, to learn something new, to practice a little more, to have some fun and meet people of a common interest.

We know that yoga classes can be expensive so here it is FREE.

The class focuses on the balance between strength and flexibility, breathing and correct alignment. Every week we will have a dynamic playlist of music to practice, we take request:)

We have yoga mats and props, just bring yourself!

Cost: FREE
results.name: Yoga in a non judgmental environment with like minded individuals at no cost

results.description:
The New York Historical Society has a number of really fun sounding exhibits right now.  And admission is "Pay as you Wish" on Friday evenings from 6 to 8 p.m.  We can pick and choose what we want to check out, because it will be too much to see in one visit (although, we can try!).  Here's a list of the exhibits that will be on display on the date of the meetup ...

Silicon City: Computer History Made in New York
http://www.nyhistory.org/exhibitions/silicon-city-computer-history-made-new-york


Superheroes in Gotham
http://www.nyhistory.org/exhibitions/superheroes-gotham


Holiday Express: Toys and Trains from the Jerni Collection
http://www.nyhistory.org/exhibitions/holiday-express-toys-and-trains-jerni-collection-0


Maestà": Gaddi's Triptych Reunited
http://www.nyhistory.org/exhibitions/maest%C3%A0-gaddis-triptych-reunited


Picasso's "Le Tricorne"
http://www.nyhistory.org/exhibitions/picassos-le-tricorne


New York & The Nation in The Robert H. and Clarice Smith New York Gallery of American History
http://www.nyhistory.org/exhibitions/smith-gallery

results.description:
Let's get prepared to RUMBLE! 

What's going on tonite? It's too early to tell! 

One thing is for sure, there will be socializing, purchasing, consuming of food and drink, and MINIATURE WARGAMING going on!

That's right, we're wargamers. We come to NBG on Fridays to show off our paint-jobs, talk about strategy, tell lies, laugh, crush our friends, and see their armies driven before us. If you are interested in wargaming, are looking for people to play with,  or are searching for a gaming community here in the Big Apple, this is the place for you. Come join us Friday night!
results.name: Fight Fight Fridays! 40k? Saga? Infinity?

results.description:
Let's go for Authentic Chinese

RSVP Only if you are 100% sure

We are going to eat Family Style, No exception! please read details below. 

CASH Only No exception ( make organizer Job easier! Do not show up with credit card please!) 

• Serious RSVP only. Do not RSVP if you're not certain. 

• "NO-SHOW" or Last day RSVP change Will NOT be tolerated.

• There will be a $3.00 meetup fee and will be added to your bill.

• We are going to eat Family Style, each person orders one dish to share. We will split the final bill of food. Every individual is responsible to pay their own drinks.

• Cash Only. Very important.Makes everyone's life easier...

•  Most restaurant only keep reservation for 15 minutes, so if you are late for more than 15 minutes,The restaurant might take the seat away ( I will do my best to keep it for you , but if restaurant insist there is nothing I can do about it )  so try to be on time please. Thank You. 

• Do not RSVP if you do not agree to all points above.

• Do not rsvp if you have special diet, vegetarian , pescatarian or can only eat chicken , can only eat pork , can't not eat pork etc etc etc .sign up for our individual eating event for that. is extremely hard for event organizer to accommodate everyone's special diet for family style event   ,Thank you for your understanding . 

The Cost of Food without Drink should be around $25-$39 per person (could be more or less ) , No including Drinks

results.description:
Join us as we visit New York's famous Tibetan Museum. Located in the Chelsea area this museum is known for bringing the most trendiest arts from the east.

We will enjoy Tibetan fine art, historical and religious and enjoy the music and happy hour drinks.

We will meet at the bar and do a quick tour of the museum. When competed touring we enjoy the remaining of the night in the RMA bar area for music and film. We end our night with a free movie when you purchase a drink form their bar.


Rubin Exhibitions

Gateway to Himalayan Art

Honoring Nepal

Becoming Another

Masterworks


The movie of the night is not free with a drink. There is a fee for entrance regarding the classic move selection for the night.

Music:

Rubin DJ David Ellenbogen Music
David Ellenbogen is a musician, producer, educator and a New York City radio host. He has performed in The Kingdom of Tonga, Ghana, Australia, Thailand, India, and at home in New York. As David began to build relationships with musicians who had come from every corner of the world, he began to realize that you do not necessarily need a plane ticket to study African, Indian or South American music. Many of the best musicians now live in New York.


K2 Lounge
Every Friday night the Café @ RMA becomes the K2 Lounge, offering a special Pan Asian Tapas menu to accompany the evening's DJ and unique thematic gallery tours and programs.

Film of the Night: Sunset Boulevard

Films
At 9:30 p.m. be sure to catch Cabaret Cinema, where movies and martinis mix. Each film is introduced by a notable guest to provide context.

*****************************************

The Night's Event - Itinerary

• Please note that we will be meeting in the lobby lounge area.

• Located on the ground level to the left of entry.

• We have a reserved area will be near the DJ & Bar.

• Our meet up time is 6 pm Friday.

• We will spend the first hour as a "meet and greet".

• At this time Happy Hour should be taking place, Two for one on selected wines and beverages.

• I will introduce members and at 7:15-30 after finishing our drinks we will make our way to the top floor and experience the museum.


Olisa

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jo0QZDuu-Vw

[masked]

results.description:
Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Studies indicate that practicing LKM positively impacts our emotions, our physical health, and our sense of connection. Our weekly Metta Meditation Group meets for practice and discussion every week with IDP's Executive Director, Kimberly Brown. 

This offering is open to both beginners and experienced meditators. Cushions and chairs will be provided. We request a $10-$20 donation to support our organization, though no one will be turned away for lack of funds.

Note we are located on the 2nd floor of a walk-up building. There is no elevator.


The Interdependence Project
302 Bowery 3rd Floor, Middle Buzzer
Between Houston and 1st Street
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation Group

results.description:
Love art, hate art or just don't understand art? It doesn't matter, because this event is more about socializing and having fun!  It is a great way to spend a Friday evening with dozens of other fun members and friends!

You'll have a chance to team up with others and set out through the halls of the museum looking for clues to answer questions, take picture challenges and be a bit silly.  Along the way you will see artworks from Van Gogh, Monet, Dali, Matisse, Warhol, Pollack and more!

The group will meet at The Old Castle Tavern for cocktails.  Upon check-in we'll group people together into teams (and have a drink).  At least One person in your group will need to have a camera.

Can I come alone?  YES! 95% of those attending will come on their own.  If you come alone we will randomly set you up on a team.

What to wear: Most people will be coming from work so business casual.  Following the tour we will gather back at The Old Castle tavern for food and drinks. Nothing too fancy!

Her is how it works:  Arrive at Old Castle Tavern between 6pm-6:30pm, enjoy a cocktail and get set up on a team (if you already don't have one)  Once you have a complete team we will send you out to the museum to find all the clues.

What am I looking for at the museum?  All the clues are things that are already at the museum.  It is in the paintings, sculptures, gift shops, hallways, signs and the people that are there! Each team will have 75 minutes to find as many clues as possible.  The teams with the most points will win prizes.  Don't worry if you didn't answer all the items because there are bonus points.

Level: First timers to I do this all the time


Cost $15 general admission: Please bring exact change

What's included?
- Admission to MOMA
-Private reception with drink Specials at the bar
- A fun way to visit the museum
- A unique way to make friends

Hey Dave, get the conversation started!
results.name: MoMA Multi Group Scavenger Hunt

venue.name: American Museum of Natural History, Kaufmann Theater

results.description:
The Amateur Astronomers Association is proud to present an astronomy lecture series from October through May each year for our members and the public. Everyone is welcome to attend. Admission to the lecture is free, and no reservations or tickets are required.

The lectures are held at the Kaufmann Theater of the American Museum of Natural History, on Central Park West between 77th and 81st streets. Please use the 77th Street entrance. Lectures begin at 6:15 p.m. and run to 8:00 p.m. 

More information at:

http://www.aaa.org/lectures/

Friday, January 8, 2016


Robert Nemiroff
Michigan Technological University

“2015 Astronomy Picture of the Day”

results.description:
This event is sponsored by The New York Social Network and a dozen of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those registered. There will be over 50 people participating.  If you have any questions please contact the event host Dave Cervini at [masked].

You must pre-pay for this event so we know how many museum passes to get.

Love art? Hate art? Just don't understand art? It doesn't matter, because you're sure to have fun with our MOMA Scavenger Hunt. 

There is no better way to go see this  artwork than with dozens of new friends!  You'll have a chance to team up with others and set out through the halls of the museum looking for clues to answer questions, have picture challenges and be a bit silly.  Along the way you will see artworks from Van Gogh, Monet, Dali, Matisse, Warhol, Pollack and more!

The group will meet at Old Castle Pub for cocktails.  Upon check-in we'll group people together into teams (and have a drink).

What to wear: Most people will be coming from work so business casual.  Following the tour we will gather back at The Old Castle Pub for food and drinks. Nothing too fancy!

The teams with the most points will win prizes.

Time: Registration: 6:pm-6:30pm Each team will have one hour to complete the hunt.

Level: First timers to I do this all the time

Can I come alone?  Yes 95% of those attending will be coming on their own.  We'll team you up with other fun people. 

Cost $15: Please pay when you arrive at Old Castle tavern.  Meeting place 2nd floor bar area

 
What's included? 
- Admission to MOMA 
- A fun way to visit the museum

- A unique way to make friends

results.description:
Take A Whole Health Journey with Author and Filmmaker Michael Bedar

Overcoming type 2 diabetes and chronic metabolic syndrome, while enjoying life more fully, are possibilities for you, holistically, naturally, and compassionately to self and others. You can reach your health goals and fall in love with wellness…if you can stand the suspense!

Come:

• Learn how Sweet Healing: A Whole Health Journey, a page-turner of a thrilling mystery novel packed with 15 years of expertise and research in healing and nutrition, can teach you and inspire you to sustain yourself on the path like no other book! 

• Find out why the author of Sweet Healing: A Whole Health Journey writes about the natural healing process in character fiction, where personal growth, plant-sourced unrefined food, and sacred lifestyle practices are parts of our shift from dis-ease to thriving!

• Discover the impact Sweet Healing: A Whole Health Journey can make for your healthy enjoyment of life, and for the people you gift Sweet Healing to this winter.

• Bring your questions!

People who have come to previous book readings on Sweet Healing with its author, Michael Bedar, MA, said they enjoyed experiencing the creativity storytelling style, while delving into important realities in health and life, as well as the positive uplifting energy.

6:30 Talk and Q&A followed by Book Signing. Total program goes until 8:00pm

Contact:
Nadisa

results.description:
A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. Greg the founder of Dharma Drink: "I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelugpa - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, and the curious - just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other." We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist and like minded hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more,             the merrier.

Time:  7-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

Please see the following Meetups too!

Buddhist Events New York     and

Zen / Chan Buddhist Activities

www.dharmadrink.com
results.why: Because Buddhists and like minded people are great to hang-out with.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink, the high table overlooking the lower level and closest to the elevators - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.

Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: María Angélica García

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
We'll have two groups running at the same time: Middle Beginners and Lower Intermediates.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and María Angélica García from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. María Angélica is a dynamic instructor from Venzuela with a good sense of humor, very patient and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues from the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

All levels are welcomed.

Our sessions are 2.5 hours with a long break in the middle. Attendees will draw from still lives with a break every half hour. 

During our session I will break off with each attendee individually to talk about the work they are creating and their individual drawing challenges. 

This is the fastest way to improve your drawing skills. It is a combination of practice and theory in the same class. 

Since each attendee comes to the session at a different level and with different challenges it is my goal to work with each person individually. 

• Space is limited and the setting is ideal. 

• Refreshments are served at the long break in the middle of the session. 

• Please bring a pad up to 16x20, a 2H, HB and 4B pencil and an eraser. 

• The price is $25 paid at the time of the class. 

• All levels are welcomed.

• Please RSVP through this meetup so I know you are coming. 

I look forward to seeing you there!

Simon

Simon Levenson is the drawing instructor at The National Arts Club and teaches drawing at The Morgan Library & Museum and The Museum of The City of New York.  Please read reviews by other students of his teaching here.

NYSC Open Circle

At:  208 W 29th St Rm 201, New York, NY
(between Seventh & Eighth Avenues)

Come and join our shamanic community in a sacred celebration of Spirit. Learn the basic techniques of core shamanism as you journey to meet your Spirit Guides and Power Animals. Deepen your shamanic practice through drumming, chanting, and movement at our monthly Shamanic Circle.

Please bring a drum or a rattle, a pen & notepad, and a bandanna. You may want to bring a pillow, blanket to use when we journey.

Suggested donation $20


By subway take: N, R, Q, to 34th Street station or #6, & #1 to 28th Street station.

*****************************************************************


The core NYSC group has been practicing healing and journeying work every week since 1997. We work and study with a wide range of powerful indigenous and Western shamans from around the world.

NYSC MISSION

NYSC promotes and supports a shamanic community in New York City. Through our regular gatherings and workshops with shamans from around the world, NYSC seeks to promote earth-honoring living in ways that foster environmental, social and spiritual balance.

Looking ahead, our vision is to establish the New York Shamanic Center, the home for all of NYSC's events, activities and gatherings, including an Annual New York Shamanic Film Festival.

Gurney deftly deploys the all-but-lost art of letter-writing to follow the relationship between Andrew Makepeace Ladd III and Melissa Gardner as they move from childhood confidences through adolescent posturing to mature revelations of passion and regret.?Our cast features Patricia Bruder Debrovner and John Gurney.

Come at 6:30 pm for a reception and after the reading participate in a discussion of the ethical issues of the play led by Betsy Ungar.

results.description:
Once inside, feel free to go through the exhibition at your own pace, either on your own or with your fellow MEETUP members. 


We'll be seeing - - - 


Ernest Hemingway: Between Two Wars

Above: Ernest Hemingway, "The Sun Also Rises", New York: Charles Scribner’s Sons, 1926, The Carter Burden Collection of American Literature, The Morgan Library & Museum.

Above: Ernest Hemingway’s Certificate of Identity. The Ernest Hemingway Photograph Collection. John F. Kennedy Presidential Library and Museum.  

                                                                                                                          This is the first ever major museum exhibition devoted to the work of Ernest Hemingway (1899–1961), one of the most celebrated American authors of the 20th century. Organized in partnership with the John F. Kennedy Presidential Library and Museum, it includes multiple drafts of Hemingway's earliest short stories, notebooks, heavily revised manuscripts and typescripts of his major novels—The Sun Also Rises, A Farewell to Arms and For Whom the Bell Tolls. The show also presents correspondence between Hemingway and his legendary circle of expatriate writers in 1920s Paris, including Gertrude Stein, F. Scott Fitzgerald, and Sylvia Beach. Focusing on the years between World Wars 1 and 2, the exhibition explores the most consistently creative phase of Hemingway's career and includes inscribed copies of his books, a rarely-seen 1929 oil portrait, photographs, and personal items.

If there's interest, we can get something to eat after we leave.

results.name: See Ernest Hemingway: Between Two Wars on The Morgan Library's Free Friday

results.description:
Many churches provide holy water to worshipers. The Bible mentions Christ turning water into wine. For many centuries Qigong Masters have provided Qi water for healing and more recently, at the Omega Institute, John of God has used water as medicine. Masaru Emoto showed the effect of certain words on the crystallization of water via snow flake pictures. In this class we learn experientially how to change the taste of brandy and juice for the better. Then we discuss and practice energizing one’s own medication for improved results and less side-effects.

NOTE: Following a one hour presentation, the Edgar Cayce Healer’s Group practitioners will offer Bioenergy Healing to all who attend the evening and request it. Occasionally Anton’s events will have guest speakers as part of a course and announced changes as karma dictates. One can attend separate classes as each presentation stands on its own and some recapitulation always occurs. Handouts or electronic material will be distributed as a part of a course.

$30, Members save 15%

results.description:
Bodhisattvas (Buddhists and like/opened minded compassionate friends) are now everywhere yet still hard to find.  So come join us and get connected with other bodhisattvas from the New York Metro area.  Every Friday we meet other compassionate friends at the Rubin Museum Cafe in a relaxed and easy going atmosphere.

Bodhi Lounge is a social/entrepreneurial meetup for Buddhists, or anyone interested in meeting Buddhists and learning about Buddhism. That said, people of any faith or practice—or no spiritual practice—are all welcome!  Let's all get along and learn from each other. So let's meet and have a cheerful time making new friends and/or helping each other grow our friendships or businesses!

So why are we always at the Rubin Museum Cafe and not check out other locations?  Rubin Museum is a Himalayan museum, which means mostly Buddhist art.  Thus we like this museum!  Also, by being at one location all the time, people now can just show up if their schedule opens up.  There, that easy!

This is a joint social between Bodhi Lounge and Dharma Drink.  We are always at one location; ask the museum staff for the Dharma Drink group.  If the first staff does not know, ask another. 

See you soon!
results.how_to_find_us: Ask the museum staff for the Buddhist social group!
results.name: Weekly Social with Like Minded Friends @ Rubin Museum Cafe

results.description:
How signing up works: There are 4 spots besides myself for this meetup. 

Please sign up on the waitlist. After 24 hours, if there are less than or equal to 4 people (excluding myself) signed up I will move everyone to the going list and afterwards signing up will be like normal. If there are more than 4 people, I will give priority to those who have previously been on the waitlist and were not able to attend a prior meetup. 

The Place:

As NYmag states: This Upper East Side eatery named after Persia's ancient capital may be humble by New York standards—there is nary a Persia-tini or leather swathed banquette in sight—but it gets the important things right. Gratifying foods include homemade yogurt with diced cucumbers, smoky lamb kebab on a bed of cherry-dotted Persian rice, and baba, a rough potage of eggplant and garlic, all of which taste great on their own but even better slapped onto a pita. Fine hospitality sweetens the deal—waiters are gracious, and the owner can be found cracking jokes with customers or pulling out a chair for a lady (an appreciated gesture that nowadays takes place only in high-end restaurants or nursing homes). End your meal with Persian tea, deliciously scented with cardamom, a homemade dessert of fresh baklava or saffron ice cream, and contemplate the restaurant’s greatest design element—an oversized painting of the 1973 Persepolis soccer team. 

http://www.persepolisnewyork.com/


RSVPs:


Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event.

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.
results.name: Persepolis - Persian

results.description:
It's been 3 years since the old gang fought the Five Animals, The Time Beast, and rescued Hermel's sister and Yellow Clay Village from Black Patch's Brigands.   They've spent their time happily farming and raising families, selling umbrellas, starting the Rockafella Sulfur mine outside of town, and enjoying the growing prosperity of Yellow Clay.

But as always, things change.  The growing prosperity has come at a cost.  The peaceful rural life that Hermel so loved has been increasingly disrupted by strangers bringing brawls, theft, and now perhaps even murder.  The town council has been unable to stem the tide of troubles, even as the Treasury's coffers have been filling up with gold.   The Rockafella Sulfur Mine seems to have become both a blessing and a curse to the town.

Furthermore recently rumors have it that strange sounds (howlings?) are being heard at night from across the Wild Moors to the west.  Worse yet, several children have vanished in the dead of night ... whisked away from their beds while their hard working parents slept.  A crowd gathers at the Emergency Meeting of Town Council eager to hear what is to be done!

A harrowing adventure was begun that night when Hermel's young daughter was kidnapped during a terrible storm and taken away into the Red Hills by creatures of the night.  Without a second's thought the old gang leaped to action in hot pursuit, taking them into the unknown... down the crooked highway they trod through the stormy night, past the the ancient Scorpion Cave, past the Seven Dead Lake where one died, and another turned aside to pursue his own quest, and Hermel's daughter was rescued from the magical Kobolds.  Finally they came to the mysterious McFearson Farmstead,on the far side of the Red Hills.  They could have turned back.  But there were still three other children to be rescued.  Down the well shaft they descended into the maze of dungeons and caverns, battling the mysterious forces found therein... until finally they came to the haunted cavern-town of Whitewode...

You will go on about 10 dates with someone of the opposite sex, each date will be 5 minutes long/short. We will provide you with materials to tell us who you liked. results.description:
Overcoming The Failure Of Desperate Solutions With Dr. Jay Kantor

Sometimes we face challenges in our life that are very difficult to meet. These challenges bring with them emotional reactions that can be more than we can bear.

It is natural to try to protect ourselves from such reactions. We instinctively want to remove or reduce the discomfort we are experiencing. There are many ways to do so.

One way is to drink alcohol. That will shift our mood. That will make us feel better (Or is that feel different?) relatively quickly. However, if we feel bad a lot and we use alcohol to feel better each time, we will quickly find that we have an even bigger problem to overcome….alcoholism.

So, quick, easy, immature solutions to real problems may not be such a good idea. Something we will eventually learn if we try to solve our own problems when we, in fact, lack the maturity and wisdom to enact a truly effective, comprehensive, long-term solution.

Now, let’s face it – many of us are still using strategies that we came up with when we were children to address certain problems we had – AND STILL HAVE. Those strategies make us feel better in the short run, but never have done anything substantial to improve our life for real.

This sad, painful situation does not have to be allowed to continue, BUT IT WILL IF YOU DO NOTHING TO ADDRESS THIS PROBLEM.

Tonight, we will have the courage to examine the bad strategies we have blindly and sadly accepted as the best we can do to get what we want. Instead, we will learn about and consider an approach that can go to the core of your being to discover and implement a solution that can take you the whole distance to solving your real problem for good.

Program starts at 7:30PM. Check website if weather is a problem.

Information about the facilitator: http://DrJayKantor.Com .
Another great website: http://EFTNJ.Com .
results.name: Overcoming The Failure Of Desperate Solutions With Dr. Jay Kantor

We invite you to join us for an ECKANKAR Worship Service on spirituality in everyday life.  Every 2nd Friday, 7:30 - 8:30 pm

Sample Topics

• Discover the Secret of God’s Love
• Accepting Spiritual Guidance
• Past Lives–Have You Lived Before?
• The Amazing Toolbox of Life
• Dreams—A Doorway to Heaven
• What is the Spiritual Purpose of Life?

Everyone Welcome!

The ECK Worship Service is for people of all faiths who love God. Led by a member of the ECK clergy, each service focuses on an aspect of Eckankar and features a reading from the ECK works, singing HU, and an open discussion of spiritual principles at work in daily life.

Robbins Room, Administration Building at St. Luke's Church  
17 Oak Avenue, Metuchen, NJ 08840

For more information on the service or other events being held throughout the state, visit www.eckankar-nj.org.

Presented by the Satsang Society of New Jersey, Inc.,
a Chartered Affiliate of ECKANKAR, Religion of the Light and Sound of God.

The terms ECKANKAR, ECK, EK, MAHANTA, SOUL TRAVEL and VAIRAGI, among others are trademarks of ECKANKAR.    Copyright ©2015 ECKANKAR. All rights reserved. ECKANKAR P.O. Box 2000 Chanhassen, MN[masked] USA

results.description:
Gene Murrow will call a lovely program of English country dance with live musical accompaniment!

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance!

English country dance is choreographed community dancing, with repertoire ranging from court dances of the 1650s through dances composed this year. If you’ve seen any of the Jane Austen movies, you’ve glimpsed some kinds of ECD.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up.

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost for this special event is $22. 

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!
results.name: TWELFTH NIGHT ASSEMBLY!!   A FESTIVE OCCASION WITH GENE MURROW!!!

results.description:
Friday nights under the lights! Teams are 7v7 coed, it's a  60min+ game.


Pls aim to arrive early and be ready to start on time. All players must bring a white and black t-shirt. Pass the ball & have fun!


***********************************************************

Details:

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes or molded cleats. Proper Soccer attire only.

3) Played in a fun & chill environment. Rough play, tackles, or sliding are not tolerated. Emphasis is on passing over dribbling.


4) If no dedicated goalkeepers, players rotate in goal. Goals are 6' x 18'.


5) If you arrive late wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow- it's not fair to those that arrive on time.

All players must RSVP, payment goes toward light rentals, field permits, equipment and fees.

CANCELLATIONS/REFUNDS:

If plans change and you cannot attend, you'll need to update your RSVP 24 hours before the match, to receive a credit for the next game. This is so other members have a chance to take your place.

See you at the pitch!

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.
results.name: Friday Soccer 7v7 COED @7:30pm | W. Village 60min+

results.description: Saul Bellow once said, “Oppressed people tend to be witty.” But not just about the oppressors. Also about themselves. Our humor takes on the high and mighty – community leaders and pompous rabbis – as well as the lowly and wretched, the schlemiel and the shlimazel. No subject is safe. Everything is grist for our mill. Bring a favorite joke or two to share with others. We’ll also have a vast assortment to learn on the spot. And then we’ll try to figure out what makes them funny, or not, and why laughing is so vital to our survival. Facilitated by Rabbi Peter Schweitzer. This program will be repeated Sunday, January 24.
results.name: Shabbat Service & Cultural Program - Oy! The Art of Jewish Humor

results.description:
We look squarely into the heart of gratitude during the Holiday season. 

We slow the hectic pace of life . We prepare ritualistic meals. We gather at the harvest table. We connect with loved ones. 

And yet, how many of us are consciously practicing the art of gratitude on a daily basis? How many of us are actively seeking to find the light and joy of gratitude in every person, every relationship, every sharp edge that we meet?

In an attempt to cultivate gratitude beyond the obligatory, once a year position, I would like to encourage us all to conduct "The Gratitude Experiment". 

Starting today, until we meet on January 8th, you will be asked to hand-write a thank you note. Every. Single. Day. 

You will tap into gratitude every time you make the conscious choice to stop, reflect, and choose to honor those people and opportunities that are present in your current life. Your ability to benefit from this exercise is directly contingent upon your level of sacred commitment to it's practice.

This is a tangible practice. This is an art-form. Putting pen to paper is cathartic. It is an extension and an expression of your heart's energy center. So write freely and let the gratitude flow. We will share and discuss the spiritual lessons and personal transformations we experienced during our month-long trial.

The experiment aims to shift our perception from one of "I am lacking. I am unlucky. I am down," to "I am blessed. I am grateful. I am enough." 

As I love to quote Marianne Williamson, "A miracle is simply a shift in perception from fear to love." So from my heart to yours, I sincerely hope you will join me in The Gratitude Experiment. Just imagine what miracles may occur when you say "yes"!

With love,

Brianne
results.name: The Gratitude Experiment- Part 2

results.description:
Open level class. Any level student can practice, taking the postures to a more challenging experience. Beginners are welcome, postures can always be modified to suit the individual. As always, listen to your body, take the postures to were it feels right for you and have fun! This class builds upon Basic  yoga postures, continuing our growth. Students always have the option to take this class where they desire... from a basic level and build foundation or to more challenging postures and flow techniques. It all depends on the individual and what their body needs ! Its an open field  for exploration and discovery.

 Breathing techniques focused upon during practice to connect the body and mind with the breath. Power Yoga builds muscle strength from the core outward, tones the body, creates endurance and stamina. Great for over all health. Breathing techniques calm the mind and ground the self.

There is a 15 minute optional deep relaxation and  guided meditation after class going deeper into chakra balancing.
results.name: Yoga - Open Class

We suggest that you wear loose comfortable clothing such as t-shirt and sweat pants. 

This class is open to men and women over 18 years.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Can't tell the difference between the Yankees and the Red Sox(and don't care to)? Do you miss the multiple references to Sesame Street and Twilight (and don't miss missing them)? Then this group is for you!

We are a bunch of global transplants to New York, who want to form meaningful friendships with other international folks new to New York. This is not a business networking group, nor a singles meet-market nor any kind of "take a cut on your drinks" broker, just a fun, informal place for internationals new to New York--and those who love them--to connect.

If you are up for a glass of beer and a good conversation on books, travel, the life you've left behind and the one you are about to embark on or anything under the sun (or the roof of a bar), come by and make a few good friends.
results.name: The International Happy Hour: For NY's global citizens--and those who love them!

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. Every week we meet at someone's apartment, a park, or a bar. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us
results.name: TurnON Brooklyn

The Rebel Alliance has recruited a team of rogues, misfits and ne'er do wells to infiltrate the criminal underworld of Nar Shadaa! Join the notorious Black Crows gang and assist the Rebels in undermining the influence of the Galactic Empire in the underworld of Nar Shadaa, the smuggler's moon.

This is a Star Wars: Age of Rebellion game that takes place on Nar Shadaa in Hutt Space. PCs are agents of the Rebel Alliance who pose as smugglers, bounty hunters and other scum while carrying out the agenda to free the galaxy of the Empire. Force Users are also welcome, as the ancient practices of the Jedi and other Force sects are the highest crimes that the Empire have decreed.

Character types from all three of the Fantasy Flight Star Wars games (Edge of the Empire, Age of Rebellion, Force and Destiny) are allowed, and the special FFG dice are provided. New players will be shown how to play this great game, so beginners are welcome.

results.description:
New to Blues dancing? Check out our FAQ. 

****************************************************************************

SCHEDULE:

8:30pm-9:30pm - Fundamentals Lesson w/ Laura & Olivia
8:30pm-9:30pm - Intermediate Lesson w/ Flouer
9:30pm-1:00am - DJ’d Dance w/ Mark & Odysseus

****************************************************************************

The Extended Topics series for January is called "That's My Jam!"
Everyone has something they just love. That move, that song, that style that they just can’t stop doing! Come join us for a month of classes - each taught by a different instructor - to learn what inspires them. Use their inspiration to help fuel yours!


This week's series topic is "Synesthesia: Scat the Blues"
Every movement we make has rhythm to it. Let's explore how musical our bodies can be on the dance floor when we really tune in to the way we are moving.


Stepping Out Studios is located at 37 West 26th St, 9th Floor. To get buzzed in, dial 9 and the green call button on the keypad to the right of the building entrance.

****************************************************************************

DETAILS:

No need to bring a partner! Friday Night Blues is a social dance; we dance with strangers, we dance with our friends... we want to dance with you! Our crowd can typically bring in anywhere from 30 to 60 dancers on any given evening.

The lesson costs $10, and the dance is $12 (sorry, cash only). But if you pay for both at the same time, it's just $20 for the night!
Volunteers get in for FREE for the night! Email [masked] to inquire about volunteer opportunities.

Stay informed: join our mailing list!

If you see or experience anything that would be considered harmful activity or a breach of etiquette, please speak with our Manager. The Manager on Duty this week is Melissa S Cohen.

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E

Join us at "The Balcony Lounge" In Carlstadt NJ On Friday January 8th for there Latin Elite Night With Some Top 40 Mixed In.

The Balcony Caters To A Sophisticated & Mature Crowd! The Music Tends To Start Up At About 10pm Or So.

If you haven't been to the Balcony yet, you will no doubt love the ambiance and decor of the place. Beautiful chandeliers overlook the main room. The food here is good and there are 2 bars available for ordering drinks.


Meet & Greet At 8:30pm.

There Is No Cover Charge Before 9pm. So Come Early If You Want To Save A Little Money.

At 9pm, The Balcony Charges A Cover Of $10. This Does Include Access To A Light Buffet At Midnight.

Free Dance Lesson Provided By The Venue At 9pm.

No Dress Code, but people usually dress nicely.

DJ Frankie Vazquez Starts At About 10pm With A Latin/Top 40 Mix.


We'll have a few tables or section in the main balcony room. When you walk in, you'll pass the first bar & enter to the left to go into the main room.


Looking forward to a fun night of socializing & dancing!

This Place Is Located In A Residential Area Of Carlstadt NJ. Close To The Meadowlands Area By Giants Stadium. www.thebalconylounge.com

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Your Holidays were a bust! Your broke from Christmas, hungover from New Years, and you already broke your resolutions! Why sit around and feel down, when you can come share some laughs for FREE!

Back by popular demand the "Let Me Speak To Your Manager" show is bringing you the best up and coming comics in NYC, all of whom have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc..!

It all goes down at Stone Creek Bar and Grill in the back room. Come down, enjoy some of the drinks from the fully stocked bar or some food off the awesome menu!

Seating in the backroom starts at 9 and the show starts shortly after.
Come early and hang out in the front room of the bar!

The show is free and has a 1 item minimum. Come out and celebrate the weekends with some laughs!

This is open to players of all skill levels, but please message me before signing up if you've never played organized volleyball before. Athletic attire is required.

You MUST RSVP to play. Message me on Meetup or text/call me (Dan) at[masked] if you have any questions or RSVP issues.

PAY LESS: $9.50 if you pay via Google Wallet or Venmo. Details HERE. 
Cash: $11 (must let me know in advance, I'll add your RSVP manually).
results.how_to_find_us: The building is all the way back on the right. Ask at the desk where the volleyball courts are.
results.name: Volleyball Open Gym

results.description:
This is for strong intermediate/advanced players only (league/tournament-ready, mostly B/BB-level). If you don't have a * (asterisk) above your name on your SoCom Meetup profile, please message me before signing up if you want to play.

You MUST RSVP to play. Message me on Meetup or text/call me (Dan) at[masked] if you have any questions or RSVP issues.

Please note: If you sign up, we're expecting you to stay and play, not leave halfway through. We only do 12 players per court, so leaving early will leave a team with only 5 players. If you're not sure if you can stay the whole time, send me a message before signing up.

PAY LESS: $9.50 if you pay via Google Wallet or Venmo. Details HERE.
Cash: $11 
(Slightly higher price now because we're paying a little more for this gym, sorry)
results.how_to_find_us: The building is all the way back on the right. Ask at the desk where the volleyball courts are.

results.description:
Last Friday's party was our biggest ever. We had about 60 people in the Studio and a very fun class. Thank you guys for making it a success. We hesitated about opening on New years but it was the right decision. We are at it again this Friday. Let's do it!!

Class: The class is free with admission. It begins at 9:30pm and teaches you the basic steps, how to hold your partner, how to be on time with the music, and so on. You do not need to bring a dance partner since we rotate students so you get to practice with everyone else. But do bring your friends and have a blast. After the class, dance all night with all the people you met during the class. The instructor will usually be Silvio Neris.

Admission: $10. Note that this will be your only expense for the entire Friday night unless you buy a beverage. But you can also bring your own beverages if you want.

Time: The event starts at 9:30pm and ends at 2:30am or until the last dancers leave. Come at any time.

Location: Times Square 151 West 46th Street, 11th Floor, New York, NY 10036 (between 7av and 6av)

Dress code: Casual/comfortable. Bring shoes that don't slip out of your feet and do not have too much grip on the floor.
results.name: La Fama Salsa Social

results.description:
https://scontent-lga3-1.xx.fbcdn.net/hphotos-xtp1/v/t1.0-9/11401142_1720823001478478_3682666258495805787_n.jpg?oh=6d3a52147bbb4787f69b1b492b283ec2&oe=56D0E6E4

Every Friday Night!
Salsa Dancing in Times Square is Back!
LA FAMA (151 W 46th St, 11th Floor) is a Latin Party that specializes in playing and dancing to Salsa Music. The event takes place where the bright lights are. That's right, Times Square. We have a nice floor, great ventilation, fun willing dancers, and your total expense for a Friday Night is 12.00

Mention Salsa New York at the door and it will be $10


You do not know how to Dance Salsa? No problem. We offer a Free Salsa class at 9:30pm every Friday. So come alone or bring your friends,. Either way, you are guaranteed to learn and have a blast.
You know what else is back? The music. LA FAMA is bringing the music back to the forefront. That's Right, DJ Mustachio will be in th building playing foot stomping flavorful Salsa songs to get those hips moving and grooving.
results.name: Salsa Dancing: La Fama Mention Salsa New York for the discount !

results.description:
Best dang comedy show in the city, baby. 

Come to Chelsea in Manhattan, hang out, have some brews, and enjoy a hilarious show (with pizza after, hey-o!)

There's no door charge and you don't have to buy a drink. Meet new people, or bring your own pals, it's a great time from start to finish. 

Here's what people are saying about standup.NYC:

"I was blown away at the talent." 

"Great time and solid pizza, but be sure to ask for it at the end of the show, Dan and Danny will hook you up." 

"Laid back vibe, perfect for seeing some funny people, hanging out with friends, and only spending as much money as you want to drink"
results.name: Hang With New People, Watch Comedy, Eat Pizza (FREE, No drink minimum)

Rory

results.description:
With so many mediocre vampire films, the few which are truly excellent often get lost in the static.Terence Fisher's 1958 Dracula is easily one of the best, and it proves just how important good writing, acting and directing can be in a time-tested genre. The performances are stellar: Peter Cushing andChristopher Lee make their respective roles of Dr. Van Helsing and the Count uniquely their own. Screenwriter Jimmy Sangster's condenses Bram Stoker's novel, shifting most events to Dracula's castle and sharpening the material's dialogue and pacing. Appropriately atmospheric and dark, the film adds enough touches of humor and sexuality to update the tale's heretofore staid feel. Fisher'sDracula is a must-see not just for devotees of modern horror but also for fans of good storytelling in general.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZTbY0BgIRMk
results.how_to_find_us: we will meet in the lobby call/text my cell 917-388-5838
results.name: Horror of Dracula 35mm film print midnight movie at IFC

results.description:
My 7th year and 5th time organizing (wow!)... the annual first trip of the New Year!

Stowe is the premier resort in the Northeast with the best terrain and consistent snow (located in Northern Vermont and getting moisture from the nearby Lake Champlain).  Last year we had terrific conditions in both early January and early March.  Even when it may be rainy in the area, Mt Mansfield (highest peak in Vermont) is at such a high elevation, snow is sure to be found.

 


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AlBEiAGMJaY

Basic Package & Options

• 2 nights lodging (based on double occupancy) at the Mountaineer Inn.  Most rooms are 2 double beds.  PM me if you want a room with only a queen or king size bed. 


• Add $90 for single room

• Deduct $20 per person for triple.  If paying triple rate, please arrange two others to be your roommates, as someone will be sharing a bed.


• Deduct $30 per person for quad occ.  If paying quad rate, please arrange three others to be your roommates as 2 couples will be sharing a bed each.


• 2-day lift ticket at Stowe (2015 window rate is over $100 per day!)

• Deduct $36 for 1-day ticket

• Deduct $90 for no lift tickets

2 Hot Breakfasts!

The Mountaineer Inn has nice amenities including a sauna, pool and large hot tub.  There is also a free shuttle from the town to the mountain with many stops among the access road.  One of the stops is directly across the street from the Inn making it easy to get around.

 

LESSONS

Imagine group lessons for all levels up to 40% off!  The lessons can be used any time or any day throughout the season, as long as they are bought in advance. 

Mountain Clinics are for intermediate to advanced skiers and riders (levels 3-5).  Click HERE for more detailed information.

• Add $79 for (1) 2.5 hour Mountain Clinic for (levels 3 to 5) at Spruce Peak starting at 10am.

Basic Cost

• Special Early Bird Price (until November 6th): $238 + $7 paypal


• Regular Price (until December 14th): $257 + $8 paypal


• Late Price (after December 14th): $277 + $9 paypal

Payment can be made here (on Meetup) via PayPal where you wind up paying the fee.  Or it can made directly at PayPal.com (to [masked]).  If you use PayPal and select personal payment - other, you will not have to pay the fee.  Once I see payment has been made, I will update your status.  You can also send me a check.  PM me for my address.

Note: If making any adjustments to the basic cost per lifts, lessons, lodging etc. please note the adjustments in a PM or comment to me.  Thank you!


Payment Deadline is January 4th at 11am.  This is also when RSVPs close.  I'll be sending payments to the outfitter at Noon, so please have your payments in!


Additional Details:

Transportation: We will carpool. Stowe is a 6 hour drive from NYC. Passengers pick up all the gas/toll tabs plus other expenses like coffee, drivers (car owners, not literal drivers) go free. We still encourage helping with driving, but it won't relieve you from paying for gas/tolls - car owners are putting up some serious mileage on their cars, so this is the least we could do in return.  And if you're a driver, please don't charge your passengers extra.

Rental Equipment: The Mountaineer Inn is adjacent to Pinnacle Sports which rents everything from skis, snowboards, helmets and pants.  Pinnacle has some online coupons here: www.pinnacleskisports.com/pinn10coupon.pdf

RSVP: Please RSVP only if you are firm on going.  In the comment field state your status, e.g. who you are rooming with, who you are driving with.  I will check paypal to see who has paid.  Also, please answer ALL of the RSVP questions; this will help me to coordinate rides and answer questions for the outfitter. 


--> RIDES & ROOMIES Google Spreadsheet


 Suggested On/Off Mountain Meetups:

• Saturday, 10:30am top of the Mansfield gondola (near the waffle cabin) for a Group Run to the bottom of the Gondola (intermediate and advanced skiers and riders only).   We will go as fast as we can!  By virtue of your speed, you will find riding/skiing partners for the day :)


• Saturday, 1pm at the Octagon (top of the FourRunner Quad) for lunch

• Saturday 4:15 pm at the Matterhorn Bar & Restaurant (4969 Mountain Rd) for Après Ski.  The earlier you go the better! 

• Sunday, 1pm at The Great Grill Room (Spruce Camp base) for lunch

• Sunday 4:45 at Cabot Cheese Annex, 5:15pm at Ben & Jerry's (on the way home)
results.name: Stowe Ski & Snowboard Weekend! (January 8-10, 2016)
