Update: As Dave suggested, lets meet at 7 or shortly after to get settled, explore the first part of the trail and warm up a little. If you are coming, may be good to post your plans (10k/21k/42k/50k) in the comments section below. The race is sold out, but if you bring a donation ($25, cash), you may be (maybe) allowed to run the race.

Update 2: In case there is not possibility to run the race trail (you do have to appreciate that they want to control the amount of damage done to the trail), I will happily lead (or be led) an alternative loop that mostly avoids the purple trail (see https://runkeeper.com/user/multiplex/route/4099777 for an idea of what that could look like).

Update 3: Let's meet up at the trailheads behind the toilets:

This is the expected (purple/pink) loop of approximately 10k.

Join us on January 9, 2016 for a run through beautiful Watchung Reservation in north-central NJ. This low-key, minimal-support, informal trail run will provide an excellent opportunity to test your mid-winter training.

results.description:
Welcome to Early Bird English, the fun and interesting way to improve your conversation skills early in the day -- without cutting into the rest of your weekend!

 Leader Eve will supply plenty to discuss, but feel free to bring along an English-language passage that you have enjoyed or found puzzling. We'll all take a look and discuss what it means.

 Early Bird English is founded on the idea that people learn best when they are enjoying themselves. Each session is quickly paced, friendly, and meant to challenge.

Eve charges a small, non-refundable fee for each session, which helps to cover the cost of the website as well as her preparation.   Please note that the $10 fee DOES NOT cover the cost of coffee!  Please also note that if only one person attends (in addition to Eve), the meeting will last one hour instead of 1.5.

http://thejoyofenglish.org/

When we learn with pleasure, we never forget.

-- Alfred Mercier

"Lenovo is one of a growing number of multinationals from the non-Anglophone world that have made English their official language."

-- The Economist, 2/15/14

"A strong vocabulary may be your ticket to side-stepping dementia," says a new study from researchers in Spain.  "...An ample vocab is an indication of robust cognitive reserves, a surplus of neurons that help the brain compensate for memory lapses..." 

-- Prevention, April 2015

"It might have been easier to learn a language years ago, but still, I'm having fun...I was heartened to see, just a month or so ago, a Penn State study suggesting that learning a new language can improve your brain function.  It can, in the researcher's words, 'lead to more graceful aging.'" 

-- Tina Hay, editor, The Penn Stater, March/April 2015

"The average American speaks one language.  Be more than average."

-- magazine ad for Rosetta Stone
results.name: Let's talk!

results.description:
At some point it will hopefully be winter.  In anticipation of winter arriving, let's go skiing/snowboarding at Hunter mountain.  For those of us going to Stratton this will be a great warmup!

The plan will be to leave NYC by 7:00 AM sharp and meet on the mountain.  We can ski in the morning according to our skills and all meet for lunch together.  After skiing we can have a beer or cocktail on the mountain before heading back to the city.


For this meetup, put yourself on the wait list.  Once cars become available I will release you from the wait list, send an email, and you can sign up for a car. Budget to pay around $20 to the driver for for gas and tolls.   There is also bus service to Hunter as well.  You can check it out by clicking on this link:

http://www.huntermtn.com/plan/getting-here/bus-lines-to-hunter/

If you are interested in lessons, the Hunter website to register for the adult group lessons (Single-Pak for beginners - Snowboard) can be found via the main link:

http://www.huntermtn.com/learning/ski-ride/

As for all Blaze events, by signing up for any event you pledge to agree not to hold anyone responsible if something somehow goes wrong. Please refer to the Pages section of the Blaze meetup website.

results.description:
We will be hosting our 2015/2016 indoor doubles tennis season at Cary Leeds Tennis Center!  (<a>Click here for directions</a>).

Each session will consist of 2 hours of competitive doubles tennis on Saturday mornings from 7am-9am. 


Here's what you need to know:

REQUIRED EXPERIENCE LEVEL [3.0]
The required level for this meetup is 3.0. In other words, you should understand the rules of doubles tennis and be able to serve and hit groundstrokes consistently. 

If you are a beginner that's still learning the basics, unfortunately this meetup isn't for you. For those beginners, I am working on an indoor option for you... stay tuned. 

RSVPing + FEE
The fee for our indoor meetups is $25. This fee needs to be paid upfront to solidify your RSVP.  After you RSVP, you will have 24 hours to make a payment. If the payment is not made, I will remove your RSVP to make room for someone else.

Each meetup will start with a 4-person RSVP limit. I am booking one court at a time this year. Once the first court is booked and paid for. I will open up the RSVP list for the next court. DO NOT BE DETERRED BY A WAITING LIST!

PAYMENT INSTRUCTIONS
While I would prefer to use meetup's option for payment, the fees they charge would make it less cost effective for everyone involved. So, I will contact everyone individually (or through the meetup comments) to request payments via PayPal. 

My PayPal email address is [masked]. 

WHAT SHOULD I BRING?
Bring your racquet + a fresh brand new can of tennis balls. 

WHAT WILL HAPPEN DURING THE MEETUP?
First, you will be assigned to a court.
There will be a 10-minute warmup.
After that, we will begin play.

RULES DURING PLAY
Standard USTA rules will apply with the following provisions:
1 Set Matches
No-AD games (this means there will be no deuce. At 40 all, whoever wins the next point takes the game.)
If the set goes to 6 all, you will play a No-AD tiebreak (first to 7 wins).

WHAT HAPPENS WHEN WE FINISH A SET?
After your set is complete, you will stay on the same court and switch partners with the other team.  I intend to have this planned out beforehand so expect an organized sets of matches for the night.

ANYMORE QUESTIONS?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.
results.how_to_find_us: Ask for the Bronx Tennis meetup at the Front Desk
results.name: Indoor Saturday Morning Doubles Tennis @ Cary Leeds Tennis Center [3.0 & above]

CATSKILL 3500 WINTER BUSHWHACK
Doubletop, Graham, & Balsam Lake

10.5 miles, 3500 feet rise, 6-7 hours - Map 142
Car spotting - BE EARLY!
Winter conditions may exist - be prepared!
Leave no Trace

RSVP Note: All RSVPs are to the waiting list.  I reserve the right to save spots for people I know I can rely on.  Everyone else will be notified about a week before the event.

---

Doubletop canister - followed by some EPIC butt-sliding!

Graham Summit Ruins - Follow these two to the car - IF YOU DARE!

Balsam Lake - All Glory at the Fire Tower!


Track & Profile:


---

The DEC limits group size in this area to 20.

---

WARNING REGARDING BUSHWHACKS: "Bushwhacks" are hikes that go off of maintained trails and through pure wilderness.  Please make sure you are very confident in your ability to navigate through the woods without trails since it is very easy to get lost in these forests, especially in the summer.  Map & Compass REQUIRED. GPS is also recommended, but it is not a substitute for a map & compass and the skills to use them effectively.

---

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. results.description:
Join us at 8am for a run to Hoboken Pier A and back.
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/121375029

Yes, there is a waterfront route to Hoboken. Enjoy the fun of cruising around Hoboken Pier A; around the new park and children playground at Newport where you will feel if you are at the beach. Get inspired by the man made majestic views of Manhattan!

The mapped distance is approx. 5.88 miles. You may run less or more in that time. We turn back after running 30 min to be back at 9 am. Hyatt pier is .31 miles so a double loop gets some runners 6.5 miles on this run.

9 am we run to Liberty State Park, a favorite place to run for most of us. Run on!

When people hear about meditation, they almost always say that they have either never tried it or they were not able to do it. You may have expected that thoughts were supposed to go away, but when you closed your eyes, more thoughts than ever came up.

results.description:
THE URBAN HIKING SERIES CONTINUES INTO 2016!

After debuting with the 36 mile PERIMETER TREK of Manhattan and continuing with 17 BRIDGE TREK that covered parts of Manhattan, The Bronx, Queens and Brooklyn, the URBAN HIKING SERIES will start 2016 in style with 25-30 mile walk between the George Washington Bridge in Manhattan and the Tappan Zee Bridge in Southern Westchester County.

Meet time: 8:15 A. M..  

Start time: 8:30A.M. promptly 

Location: 179th Street and Fort Washington Ave. adjacent to the Port Authority 


We will start on the Manhattan side of the GW and cross back and forth before heading up the Hudson River Greenway to the northern tip of Manhattan. At that point will cross UNDER the Henry Hudson Bridge and head east along northernmost Manhattan through the jewel that is Inwood Park until we reach Broadway. At that point we will turn left and make our way across the Broadway Bridge into The Bronx. 

After making our way through parts of Kingsbridge and Riverdale, we will veer into historic Van Cortland Park and make our way to the Old Croton Aqueduct Trail.This trail, which lies above the aqueduct which supplied water to NYC beginning in the 19th century, will carry us through many of small towns in Westchester County to our final destination, the Tappan Zee Bridge which had no pedestrian crossing. Along the way, we will have some spectacular views of the Hudson River as well as many historic sights, while having easy accessibility to the Metro North. 

We will have one full fledged break to eat as well as some shorter bathroom stops. We'll walk at a brisk pace. For those unsure as to whether you can do this, get your a** out there. The energy and encouragement will enable you to cover distances you didn't think were possible. Just read the comments from the previous two hikes. This is a great chance to test yourself mentally and physically while discovering new parts of NYC and the surrounding area. Look forward to seeing you all.

There will be 2-3 minute water breaks about every hour and a lunch break at about the halfway point. We had a nearly 80% completion rate for the 36 miler, so if you come with your legs, heart, and mental commitment you should be able to finish and be rewarded with a very fulfilling experience.

-----------------------------------

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. 

See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas. 
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. 

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. 

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. 
Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

results.description:
Urbacraft, a producer of simple but scalable building blocks for urban buildings, will host its first “Craft-A-Thon” for designers and makers in New York City.

Unlike other building blocks for kids, Urbacraft’s building blocks are composed of only two essential types of the block - the block for the floor and the one for the wall. This simple but powerful structure has been incorporated in the urban architecture for hundreds of years and gives urban architects lots of scalability in designing cities.

Urbacraft is the first company to present this sophisticated method of building to not only children but those who are enthusiastic to building and making.
Prizes:
1st Place - 3rd Place
TBA ($$ monetary reward TBA and partnership deal with Urbacraft)

Speakers/Judges
- Ayssar Arida, Co-founder of Urbacraft
- Luke Schantz, Professional Creator
- TBA from XRC Labs, a startup accelerator co-founded by Parsons School of Design Six Hour Design Competition

The purpose of this craft-a-thon is to make full use of Urbacraft’s simple but scalable philosophy to build things by connecting to other platforms such as littleBits’. In a make-a-thon in Beirut, Lebanon, some people created extensible furniture on the wall.

The Craft-A-Thon will be started with a conversation (speakers TBA) and Ayssar Arida, Co-founder of Urbacraft, to address the concept of the building block and fun of making.

Participants are able to prepare for this craft-a-thon in advance, but they need to complete crafting their ideas into work and presentation within the six hours, followed by a brief introduction of the work by each participant. Participants can be a group of people.
We will make some resources available during the craft-a-thon, such as 3D printers and cutters, and professionals to help.

Agenda
8:30am Doors open
9:00am - 10:00am Opening Conversation
10:00am - 4:00pm Craft-A-Thon
4:00pm - 4:30pm Break
4:30pm - 5:00pm Presentation by participants
5:00pm - 5:30pm Prizes and Wrap-up
6:00pm Doors closed
results.name: Urbacraft's "Craft-a-thon"

-Please bring a fun and chill attitude. Absolutely no rough playing, slide-tackling or berating others; You’ll be asked to leave.

-Turf, AG cleats, or sneakers - no wet ground monster spikes.

This is a chill game so please bring a chill attitude; no meatheads or a$$holes. Organizers have the final say (i.e. if a ball is out of bounds we call it). 
It’s a small pitch so no corners kicks; just throwins.

Directions:

How to get to Brooklyn Bridge Park PIER 2 Sports Field:

To get past the BQE, you must enter Brooklyn Bridge Park on foot either fromm the south (at Joralemon St. & Furman St.) or the north (at Old Fulton St. & Furman St.)  Pier 2 is roughly halfway between these two entrances.  We play on the artificial grass field at the far end of the pier, behind the basketball courts & roller rink.

Brooklyn Bridge Park is accessible by several subway lines (A/C, 2/3, 4/5, F, R) and bus routes (B25, B63)

New captains, RSVP for more information. 

New captains meet 9:00am at the entrance to Central Park at the southwest corner of Fifth Ave. and 79th St 

From there we walk to our trailer in the Ramble lot just off the East Drive in the Park at 79th St. You can lock your bikes and personal stuff in the trailer.  After orientation and bike safety checks, we ride as a group up to 90th St. where our stokers (our members who ride on the the back) will be waiting. 

Experienced captains can meet at the trailer at 9:30am.


Stokers and non-riding volunteers meet at 10:00am at 90th St. and Fifth Ave, just inside the Park at the benches on the north side of the entrance - adjacent to the two water fountains. 

Helmets will be provided if needed. please dress warmly. 

Please RSVP if you plan to attend and specify if you are a captain or non-riding volunteer.

results.description:
We'll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery for a run on the Old Croton Aqueduct. Afterward, whoever is interested can head to the Red Barn Bakery for breakfast. This is a good run for new runners because it is out and back - no set distance to cover but you will need to wear a watch. Feel free to turnaround at any point or walk/run at your own pace. 

Details about the Saturday run

Route: We’ll meet in front of the Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St.) in Irvington and jog VERY casually together to the Old Croton Aqueduct trail. (If you are unfamiliar with the area and would prefer to walk rather than run to the trail, click here to see the trail on a map.) From there we’ll head south toward Dobbs Ferry. There is no set distance. Everyone will walk or run at their own pace for 25 minutes, and then turn around and come back. Please wear a watch so that you know when to turn around.

Water/Bag Storage: There are very few water fountains along the route, so bring a water bottle if you need one while running. I’ll bring water and cups for after the run. There’s no bag storage, so leave belongings at home or in your car.

Location: In front of Red Barn Bakery (4 S. Astor St, Irvington, NY 10533). Free parking is available on weekends in the MetroNorth lot next door.

</a>  <a href="https://www.facebook.com/groups/1452433901730637/">Join our Facebook group to post pictures or message other members.

General advice & guidelines for our regular meetup runs:

• RSVP if you are going. If your plans change, simply change your RSVP.

• There is no bag storage, so please bring only what you plan to run with.

• All regular runs are rain or shine, unless the weather is actually dangerous.

• If you arrive late, can’t find the start location, miss us for any reason, run anyway!

• If you missed RSVP deadline, and know our starting point, feel free to join us on the day – just this one time :)

Feel free to contact me either via my meetup account or at [masked] if you have any questions.

Then run back along the waterfront with the Statue of Liberty and the awesome view of Manhattan skyline.
Total 6.75+ miles.

We shall be running a loop so you may take shortcuts or longer paths on the way!

results.description:
1st Book Club Reading: Furiously Happy by Jenny Lawson

*Please read this book and know that our space will allow you to brainstorm ideas, express what you liked/didn't like, and share your view of the book.*

Book Description: Jenny Lawson follows up her marvelous debut Let’s Pretend This Never Happened with her determination to be furiously happy: she will seize the strangest and most glorious moments of her life while she stares down her depression, severe anxiety, avoidant personality disorder, and much more—and dares it to stop her. Furiously Happy is not only a battle cry but a delirious seesaw of a memoir. One moment you swoop upward as Lawson relates her attempts to hold a koala in Australia while wearing a koala costume and explains her quirky love for taxidermied animals (who must be dead from natural causes only), and you’re giggling like a three-year-old. Then your stomach drops like an artillery shell when Lawson exposes the dark side of her mental illnesses: trying not to cut herself and holing up in her bedroom for days on end. The ups and downs make this a difficult book to read all in one go. However, Lawson uses both her hilarious and heartbreaking episodes to camouflage so many life lessons and biting observations. (A poignant example: when cancer victims don’t respond to medication, no one blames the cancer victim; people with mental illness don’t get the same respect.) This is a book you’ll want to savor. Whether or not you too suffer from depression, you’ll turn the last page fired up by Lawson’s conviction that you can be furiously happy no matter what life hurls at you.

--Adrian Liang

Join us for an advanced screening of the upcoming Lionsgate animated feature, Norm of the North this Saturday, January 9 at the Regal E-Walk. Show time is 10:30AM, but please arrive at the theater no later than 10:00AM to guarantee admission to the film.


More details here:

* scheduled to have a screening on Sat, Jan 9 at 10:30am.  Get there by 9:45/10:00am to guarantee admission

* we have 50 slots, so this is a NYC Dads Group members only event (Members will be allowed to RSVP with a +3 so a total of 4 tix per member)

* When you RSVP, please include your last name below in comments section so we can use for guest list purposes.  If we don't have your last name, you will NOT be included on the guest list.

* RSVP by this Friday morning at 9am, Jan 8, when we have to provide the final list

*Theater: Regal E-Walk Stadium 13. Theater location is subject to change. 


The screening company, Allied-THA will have a table set up, so members can just go inside to the Allied-THA table inside the theater.  

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

https://us-mg5.mail.yahoo.com/ya/download?mid=2%5f0%5f0%5f1%5f2560962%5fAMi%2bimIAAEzcVowA0QHUwCRCSMU&m=YaDownload&pid=2&fid=Inbox&inline=1&appid=yahoomail

NORM OF THE NORTH Advance Screening

Saturday, January 9th at 10:30am (Arrive by 9:45am)

Regal E-Walk (247 W. 42nd St)

Synopsis: A polar bear of many words, Norm’s greatest gripe is simple: there is no room for tourists in the Arctic.  But when a maniacal developer threatens to build luxury condos in his own backyard, Norm does what all normal polar bears would do…he heads to New York City to stop it.  With a cast of ragtag lemmings at his side, Norm takes on the big apple, big business and a big identity crisis to save the day.

Cast: Rob Schneider, Heather Graham, Ken Jeong, Gabriel Iglesias, Loretta Devine, Michael McElhatton, Colm Meaney, and Bill Nighy

Directed by: Trevor Wall 

Official Site:  www.NormOfTheNorth.Movie

Hashtag: #ShakeYourBearThing #NormOfTheNorth

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Please join us for an open group discussion on how we respond to performance feedback, how to ask for feedback that will actually help you, and gender bias in The Double Bind. (The Double Bind is the idea that if a woman is too "nice" at work she’ll be seen as too soft and won’t be taken seriously but if she is too assertive she’s seen as brusque and bitchy.) Our goal is to identify common experiences, reflect on personal challenges, and support each others career development.


Location: Stephen A. Schwarzman Building, a part of NYPL on 5th Ave and 42nd St. Room 122.

Date/Time: Saturday, January 9 at 10AM.


Suggested readings: 


1. Why Men Hate To Give Women Feedback, Forbes, 2013
(http://www.forbes.com/sites/work-in-progress/2013/05/01/why-men-hate-to-give-women-feedback/)
2. Learning To Love Criticism, NY Times Review, 2014
(http://www.nytimes.com/2014/09/28/opinion/sunday/learning-to-love-criticism.html)
results.name: Women's Group Discussion

results.description:
Bring holiday trees (Hint: It doesn't even have to be yours) to a designated city park to be recycled into mulch that will nourish plantings across the city! 

Chipping Locations in each Borough

You can bring the trees to a chipping location on January 9th and 10th from 10:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. The Parks Dept will chip the trees and, if you wish, give you your very own bag of mulch! http://www.nycgovparks.org/highlights/festivals/mulchfest


Drop Off Locations in each Borough

Or you can bring trees to a drop-off site from Saturday, January 2nd through Sunday, January 10th (before 2PM). Leave the trees and Parks will recycle it later! The NYC Department of Sanitation will also be conducting special curbside collections for mulching and recycling of Christmas trees from Monday, January 4th, 2016 through Friday, January 15th, 2016. http://www.nycgovparks.org/highlights/festivals/mulchfest


Pick up mulch for your tree pits even if you don't have a holiday tree to recycle!

Just go to one of the many chipping locations during hours of 10AM-2PM on Sat or Sunday Jan 9th or 10th. We can give our street tree pits and our gardens a little love by spreading fresh mulch in them. http://www.nycgovparks.org/highlights/festivals/mulchfest


Benefits of Mulch:

*Holds in soil moisture, protecting your plants from drying out quickly

*Moderates soil-temperature fluctuations (This benefit is especially valuable during that turbulent-weather period in spring when you don't want your plants to be stressed.)

*Protects plant roots from winter cold and helps prevent frost-heaving, in which plants are literally pushed out of the ground by the natural expansion and contraction of the soil as it cools off and heats up

*Adds a bit of welcome nutrition as it breaks down


http://www.dummies.com/how-to/content/understanding-the-benefits-of-garden-mulch.html


Let's do our part as Green New Yorkers :-)
results.how_to_find_us: See http://www.nycgovparks.org/highlights/festivals/mulchfest for details
results.name: Recycle Holiday Trees at NYC Park Dept's MULCHFEST

results.description:
CALLING ALL FANS OF FOUNDING FATHER ALEXANDER HAMILTON...

HOLD THE DATE!!  RSVP'S BEGIN MONDAY, DECEMBER 28TH AT 9PM.

Tentative Plan is to Meet at the Museum of American Finance around 10am. There will be a $4 charge to visit. The remainder of the day's activities are free of charge. Firm Details to follow... reserving your space is recommended.  


Following a visit to the site of his Wall Street office, home and actual gravesite, we'll head uptown to The Grange in Harlem, a National Monument and hsitoric site -- the only home Hamilton owned where there will a number of activities. 

Optional - group brunch and a brief walking tour of the beautiful Hamilton Heights Neighborhood.

Any cost?  The Grange birthday activities and guided walk/tour are free. There will likely be a charge for the Museum in the morning -- trying to negotiate a good deal :)

Why such a big deal about Hamilton?  Check out this link with 10 of his significant accomplishments:

</a>http://allthingshamilton.com/index.php/alexander-hamilton/hamilten-top-10

For more activities - also on Hamilton's actual birthday - January 11th, check out the Alexander Hamilton Awareness Society: <a href="http://www.the-aha-society.com/">http://www.the-aha-society.com/

Another option to visit the activities at The Grange on your own: <a href="http://www.nps.gov/hagr/index.htm"></a>http://www.nps.gov/hagr/index.htm

Cheers from Hank!


[masked]

Celebrate New Year's 2016! Bring your own ipod & earbuds--everybody listens to their own music as we dance walk around the park loop. What is dance walking? It's an improvised form of walking, with music, doing whatever movement comes naturally. It's walking and moving your arms. Or skipping, skitching, low-stepping, sideways running. It's responding to the rhythm, attitude, or story of the music you're hearing. In short, it's having a dance party in your living room, while walking through the park--hilarious and exhilarating. For inspiration, check out:

results.description:
Hello Everyone:

I would like to thank many of you for your participation, support and energy! Raising a bilingual child is not easy but along with a committed community it makes it fun and enjoyable. It has been a pleasure to organizing this group and planning fun community events and educational playdates where our little ones and families have great chances to interact and have an awesome time together.

Right now, the meetup.com membership fee for this group is due. It's $86 for 6 months. It would be nice and very helpful if we could all pitch in to help pay it- since I already organize and run the group and post the events....It would be wonderful if everyone can help pay the fee by making a small, fractional, suggested donation. I have covered the fee for an entire year and it would really help to have members contribute and participate in the activities

Suggested Membership Fee: $10 per family bi-annually ... If you would like to pay by paypal, I would recommend that you send me a personal gift payment on paypal.com- this way you won't be charged any fees and the total money will go to the group instead of paypal. (I will send you my paypal account through private message) You may also just click on the link on the left side bar where it says chip in, (but you will be charged a small fee).

Any money that is left over after I make the payment to meetup.com will go towards a party for our group! Doesn't that sound like fun? I would like this group to grow and for us all and our kids to make lasting connections and get lot's of information about our neighborhoods and resources to make our lives easier. ALL MEMBERS WHO PAY THEIR MEMBERSHIP DUES ON TIME WILL BE ENTERED IN A RAFFLE TO WIN A couple of Spanish Books from Scholastic. Prize will have to be picked up from Organizer's home. Details will be provided. So if you have not paid your membership as yet, please do so now.

Thanks for your support,
Cynthia Ribadeneira
Organizer of Amiguitos Jugando y Hablando en Español.

results.description:
12 Saturdays:


Jan 9, Jan 23, Jan 30, February 6 , Feb 20, March 5, April 2, April 9, April 16, April 23, May 14, May 21  in Park Slope, Brooklyn

Permaculture is more than just good gardening. It is a life long approach to analysis, action and social structures that results in better relationships, more functional systems and a clearer understanding of everything necessary for human communities to thrive.

Course fee: Regular tuition fee $1,200
Contact: [masked]

REGISTER now online


Lead Teacher: Claudia Joseph
Nationally recognized guest teachers:
Jude Hobbs, Jono Neiger, Tattfoo Tan


Permaculture - a whole systems design method - offers pathways to strengthen our economic, ecological, and social systems. Spirit and health are in the mix, as we learn the connectedness of all things. This course will teach you to garden with the materials at hand: to raise abundant food, herbs, and craft materials and to improve the dynamic life level of your surrounding environment. 

Become more financially and ecologically balanced - learn to be a smarter consumer and what real economy means. Understand how cooperation is as important as (our cultural bias towards) competition   Permaculture operates on all levels and scales. Don't just learn the right answer, learn what questions we should be asking.

Traditional knowledge and modern culture are combined in this unique whole systems approach that originated in Australia in the 1970's. Climate change and social upheaval are upon us, as predicted by permaculture's co-founder, Bill Mollison. Learn how to move toward positive change in the world we create together - Permaculture can be paired with many livelihoods and practices to increase benefits and create abundance. Even if you apply it solely on the personal level, you will see with new eyes using the skills you learn.

For more information visit Permaculture-Exchange.org

Gift certificates and payment plans available.
results.name: Permaculture Design Certificate

Meet: 10 AM Tulip Springs parking lot to the right and back by the picnic area off Cherry Lane, a continuation of Brookside Ave., Millburn, just north of S. Orange Ave. Various trails, 4+ miles, moderately brisk pace. Boots required. Bring water. Traction devices or poles as needed. Rain or ice cancels. Please watch this site on the morning of January 9 for any last minute changes/cancellations.

SOUTH MOUNTAIN RESERVATION, Milburn, South Orange and West Orange, NJ
From north of the park (either eastbound or westbound) on I-280: Take exit 7. At the bottom of the ramp, Turn south (left) onto Pleasant Valley Way. Proceed 2.2 miles to the corner of Pleasant Valley Way and Northfield Ave. Go straight ahead for Tulip Springs
To Tulip Springs: From Northfield Ave. go south on Cherry Lane (Name changed from Pleasant Valley Way but same road) toward Millburn 0.8 miles to entrance on left. ALTERNATIVE: From South Orange Ave go 0.4 miles north on Cherry Lane. Entrance is on the east side of the road. Make an immediate right hand turn to Tulip Springs parking (straight ahead is the Boy Scout Area).

results.description:
Updated December 18th, 2015


WINTER (Dec-Feb)

As the city gets cold we play two times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd & West End) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd & West End)

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

Damien 


[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

[img src="">

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.
results.why: It's a great way to start your Saturday!
results.name: Saturday Ultimate @ 10AM - Riverside Park

results.description:
Dear friends,

Welcome in little Italy... in the Bronx!!

Atmosphere of the past, what local residents call the "real" Little Italy in New York.
Take a trip to rediscover ancient flavors while food industry experts show and explain the craftsmanship behind their products.
We will meet and start 'at "Gino's Pastry", which is famous for its monumental cakes. You will eat pastries where famous regulars like Joe Pesci, Al Pacino, and Ray Romano like to go.
We'll continue on to one of the best pasta shops in New York "Borgatti." They've been a legend in the Bronx for years. There they will explain the progress of making fresh pasta.
After that, we will make a brief stop at the church of "Our Lady of Mount Carmel." Where they still have mass in Italian.

The tour will continue to the bakery Addeo, another historical place in the Bronx.

You will hear about how they make their bread, and see their machines making their bread.
Then we'll move into the cornerstone of Little Italy: The Arthur Avenue Market. At the entrance of the market you can make a quick stop at "La Casa Grande Cigar," and admire the workmanship of their cigars.
In the middle of the market you'll find "Pete's Meat Market," They've been named the best butcher in New York City. There you will hear his story, and about his work with meat processing.

Last but not least, while in the market, we will stop at Mike's Deli, where chef David Greco, famous for beating Bobby Flay on the food network, and for catering parties for Robert de Niro, NIAF and New Orleans feast, will teach you how to make mozzarella, and let you taste at the same time.

Price: $25 per person.

Tour starts at 10:00am at Gino's Pastry (580 E 187th St Bronx)

For information and reservation please contact us at:

[masked]
results.name: ARTHUR AVENUE TOUR!

results.description:
Join us on Saturday, January 9, 2016 at 10:15 a.m. to hear Mark Stewart (a/k/a Kemler Stewart & f/k/a Mark Greenstein) speak on the topic of Resistance Candidates: Making A Real Difference. The event will take place in the Library of the Queens Pride House located at[masked]th Avenue, Suite 206, Jackson Heights, New York 11372. 


ADMISSION FEE: $3.00 for Queens LP members; $5.00 for Non-Members.

If you are driving, arrive early to look for free street parking. There are also many 2-hour Muni-Meter spots and a nearby parking lot.

If you are coming by subway, use the IRT "7" Flushing Line and exit at 74th Street/Broadway. You can also use the IND "E", "F" or "R" Queens Blvd. Lines and exit at the Jackson Heights/Roosevelt Avenue stop.

If you get lost, call Dr. Tom Stevens on his cell phone at[masked]-7075.

================

Mark Stewart answers a few questions:

What are your thoughts on the Libertarian Party?

I think Resistance members agree with LP's positions with 90% - 100% conviction. But the media don't give LP candidates a chance. That's why we campaign from within. Within the two-party system, every one of our ideas can be adopted. (That's the history of the Progressive movement, incidentally). The system is so stacked against the LP that it's akin to shouting under water. In 2012, you couldn't ask for a better candidate for president than Gary Johnson. But he got 1% of the vote. LP has been around for 40 years and never has won a Congressional seat, Senate seat, or Governorship. The majority of LP members in state legislatures were elected when there was no Republican opponent or no Democrat opponent. Until the two-party "system" is splintered, there is little hope for LP's electoral success. The closeness of the two big parties further dilutes LP prospects, because in any close election, a vote for the LP candidate is perceived as "throwing your vote away", or worse "helping elect the scoundrel". Campaigning within the Republican or Democrat party is a better route to the electoral success of freedom. Campaigning within an established party allows us to shed better light on the how the incumbent leaders of the party disserve us.

If a Resistance Candidate CAN'T be president, who would you choose?

An outsider committed to Jeffersonian principles would be best. Right now (May, 2015) I'd like to see the two who have not held elected office, Ms. Fiorina and Dr. Carson, team up. Let them pledge to one another and to the primary voters that they are running as an inseparable team in primary states that award their delegates proportionately. In those states, the voters will decide who between them will take the VP and who will take the President slot. In winner-take-all primaries, one will stay off the ballot, but voters would know they are voting for the pair. The Outsiders would be for example "Fiorina-Carson" in some winner-take all states, and "Carson-Fiorina" in other winner-take-all states. It keeps them from diluting their campaign expenditures. If Gary Johnson ran as a Republican or a Democrat, he'd have my allegiance. He's the best candidate since Goldwater (Harry Browne, Steve Forbes, Duncan Hunter, and Ronald Reagan round out the top five in my life-time).  Scheindlin-Napolitano would be good, and fun to watch.

Wouldn't a Resistance candidate, if elected as a Democrat or Republican. get co-opted? Doubtful. We are not here passionately putting forth an agenda, sacrificing our time, taking barbs along the way to then abandon our principles. I don't think a single Resistance candidate is driven toward public service by the possible riches. So big industry is going to have a hard time co-opting any of us. And at least some Resistance Candidates are committed to "wearing a wire", that reveals any attempts to suborn the official. But in case a Resistance member isn't serving the principles on which he campaigned, throw him out in 2 years. That Candidate broke through a door; it now makes it easier for the electorate to demand and GET better leaders. 

SHORT MARK STEWART BIO:

Educator - since 1987 with three for-profit firms. 

Businessman - since 2000 with four small firms dedicated to family improvement.

Former Lawyer - 1992 - 1995 

Univ of California School of Law,. Berkeley CA 

Dartmouth College  NH 

Loomis Chaffee School CT
results.name: Mark Stewart on Resistance Candidates: Making A Real Difference

group.name: Libertarian Party Of Queens County (Founded October 6, 1994)

He's the best candidate since Goldwater (Harry Browne, Steve Forbes, Duncan Hunter, and Ronald Reagan round out the top five in my life-time).  Scheindlin-Napolitano would be good, and fun to watch.

Wouldn't a Resistance candidate, if elected as a Democrat or Republican. get co-opted? Doubtful. We are not here passionately putting forth an agenda, sacrificing our time, taking barbs along the way to then abandon our principles. I don't think a single Resistance candidate is driven toward public service by the possible riches. So big industry is going to have a hard time co-opting any of us. And at least some Resistance Candidates are committed to "wearing a wire", that reveals any attempts to suborn the official. But in case a Resistance member isn't serving the principles on which he campaigned, throw him out in 2 years. That Candidate broke through a door; it now makes it easier for the electorate to demand and GET better leaders.  

SHORT MARK STEWART BIO:

Educator - since 1987 with three for-profit firms. 

Businessman - since 2000 with four small firms dedicated to family improvement.

Former Lawyer - 1992 - 1995 

Univ of California School of Law,. Berkeley CA 

Dartmouth College  NH  

Loomis Chaffee School CT
results.name: Mark Stewart on Resistance Candidates: Making A Real Difference

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
The accelerated cosmic expansion, especially when coupled with the holographic principle, leads to some puzzles that I will briefly present. Hopefully to be resolved at the meeting. More for entertainment then educational merit.

The main session will be decoherence, led by Jeff:

Quantum decoherence and the differences between Copenhagen, Everrett, and Bohm;  focusing on Copenhagen and Everrett  (if someone else wants to help with Bohm).  The mathematical part of this would be a discussion of the density matrix and the difference between pure states and mixed states, while the more philosophical part would include a discussion of the quantum suicide thought experiment.


Here's a very accessible article dealing with this topic, written by Max Tegmark and John Wheeler in 2001, which is pretty non-technical and would make for good pre-reading: http://arxiv.org/pdf/quant-ph/0101077.pdf

An excellent presentation of how decoherence works is the second part of this lecture by Nima Arkani-Hamed:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3bqvAIKH2Rg

The relevant part begins at about 39 minutes in, so just skip over the first part of the Youtube video.  This is a lot more technical than the above paper, but he explains the math with concepts as he goes along so even someone not too familiar with the math behind quantum mechanics or the density matrix should be able to get something out of it.

Cheers,

Moshe Rozenblit
results.name: Decoherence + cosmic puzzles

results.description:
The Ten Perfections - Resolve and Determination

"The difference between determination and obstinacy is that one comes from a strong will and the other from a strong won't."  - Henry Ward Beecher


Please note: We will be meeting at a member's home this week.  I'll send you the location information with the RSVP verification. 


We will continue our exploration of the Ten Perfections at Saturday's sitting with a discussion on Resolve and Determination.  

Previously we looked at generosity, virtue, letting go of attachments that keep us bound to ignorance and suffering, wisdom, energy/effort, patience, and truthfulness.  As we’ve considered the perfections in this series, you may have noticed there is an implied commitment or resolve required to cultivate each of these mind and heart qualities. This resolve is the energetic quality of unshakable determination.

There are many examples of commitments we resolve to make.  We resolve to cultivate an open and generous heart as we give to and receive from life. We also resolve to let go of viewpoints, thoughts, beliefs or opinions that create obstacles or distractions for us on our journey and that cause suffering in our lives.

And, as we often discuss, we resolve to remember the interdependent nature of our experiences and the overall goal of being a contributor in the realization of freedom from suffering for all beings. We resolve to support our commitments with compassion and skillful actions.

Please remember to reserve your spot by responding to this email, so that we can have an accurate count of friends attending and can plan accordingly. I will send you location and contact information when I receive your request.


The brief topic discussion will be followed by a guided meditation and time for discussion and Q&A.  Please note that while there is benefit in participating in regular sittings and practice, you do not have to attend every class to find value. I hope you'll join us.


Fee by donation: Suggested starting donation is $10 and your generosity is greatly appreciated.  No one is ever turned away for lack of funds.  The donation box is on the sign-in table.

results.description:
We've sketched at the Historical Society before, and they have a huge collection of beautiful art and artifacts. But there's currently a special exhibit up that I want to see, too: Superheroes in Gotham.

We'll meet in the lobby, buy our own tickets ($15 each), and then head to a gallery together. We'll look at the special exhibit as well as the regular exhibits. 


Any problems on the day of the event, I can be reached at [masked]. 


Looking forward to sketching with you!


---------------------------------------------------------------

What makes our Meetups different from other art groups and classes? There's no instruction, but we like to share our work, and chat and be inspired. Share tips and learn from people in a casual environment where all levels of artists are welcome! Don't be shy to ask anyone anything!

• We sketch for a bit, usually 45 minutes or so, and then get back together and share our drawings, and then sketch again, etc. There's usually time for 3 or 4 sketches.

• Please bring your own supplies - anything you like to work with - pens, pencil, watercolor, pastel, small sketchbook or large paper, iPad, whatever suits you.

• We hand out nametags so everyone can meet one another!

• We take photos to share on the site later. Bring your camera!

• Please take care to make sure we do not leave any trash behind. Please also leave any dogs at home; they tend to knock over the artwork. Thanks. 

• This Meetup is FREE and everyone at all skill levels is welcome!

In case of rain, I will let people know early in the morning if it is canceled, and then reschedule for another day.

How does the Wait List work? If the event is full, rsvp to be added to the Wait List. If someone from the regular list cancels, the first person on the Wait List is automatically bumped up to regular attendee.

Please note that if you add a comment below it will spam everyone with an email, so please use your judgement.

results.description:
Have the holidays left you stressed? Is the weather making you feel blah? Have you been thinking about learning how to meditate?

New year is a perfect time to introduce meditation in your life or meditate with a group. Join us for this free one hour session to get over the winter blues and the holiday stress.


In this one hour class, you will get a taste of the peace and clarity you can achieve through guided meditation & breathing techniques. 

The class also offers a preview of a longer workshop called The Happiness program.

The Happiness Program teaches several practical and powerful tools to help you discover your unlimited happiness and freedom - not as a concept, but as a direct experience. You will discover that you can be happy, whatever the situation, and live a deeply fulfilling life.


Start your new year on a positive note. Join us for meditation!


More @ Behappymc.org

results.description:
This month we'll discuss "the Forever War" by Joe Haldeman.  "The Forever War" is a military science fiction novel by American author Joe Haldeman, telling the contemplative story of soldiers fighting an interstellar war between Man and the Taurans.  The book was written in the 1970's after Haldeman left the Vietnam War.  It won the Nebula Award in 1975, and the Hugo and the Locus awards in 1976.


The meeting will be hosted by Wendy at her house in White Plains. We will provide stuffed burgers. Please bring fruit salad, vegetables, potato salad, macaroni salad, appetizers, drinks or desserts. Let everyone know what you will be bringing by commenting on this meeting. 


Looking forward to seeing everyone on Saturday, 1/09/2015 at 11:30a.

Let's check out a cool spot downtown: Le District!  It is a mix of food stations, restaurants and a celebration of French fare - chocolate, charcuterie, cheese, baked good etc.

We will start first at La Cure Gourmande (have a few samples) and then take a walk around the area.  Everyone can then choose what counter will be their lunch choice and we can plan to - depending on size of group - dine at one of the counter spaces or in atrium area.

Le District is located in Brookfield Place and is easily accessible via various transit options.

results.description:
The tradition in Japan is to welcome in the New Year with a feast of Osechi dishes.  This January, I am going to teach Osechi dishes, that include hearty winter vegetables, legumes, kombu kelp and salmon.  Each dish symbolizes forthcoming happiness, health and wealth in the new year!


Let’s welcome in 2016 by cooking these tasty Osechi dishes together!

The Menu:
Namasu - pickled daikon radish and carrots
Kobumaki - salmon rolled in kombu kelp
Onishime - simmered vegetables and chicken
Ozoni - White miso soup with vegetabels and mochi
Satsumaimo kurikinton - Creamy Japanese Sweet yam with chestnut 

I hope you all have wonderful and joy filled holidays.
results.name: Let's make Osechi, Japanese New Year's dishes!

venue.name: Inside main entrance of museum, in far right corner, near black statues, before entering the big lobby

results.description:
We'll meet inside the museum (because it's indoors), but we'll start our tour at the adjacent Botanical Gardens, especially the indoor exhibits: topics, desert, Northeast, Bonzai (miniature trees), and fossils. We'll have lunch near those exhibits, where there's a cafe in case you don't bring your own lunch. Then we'll head back to the museum, where we'll try to see the American and European painting, African art (with a new exhibition), Egyptian artifacts, connections between cultures, feminist art (with the beautifully erotic Dinner Party), earliest films, and a special exhibition about Coney Island art and history. 


PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING DETAILS SO YOU'RE PROPERLY PREPARED:

DISTANCE: 1-2 miles.

PACE: Moderate, not slow, when we're outside.

ENDING TIME: About 5 PM. But you can leave earlier, of course.

COST: Pay what you wish at the museum, free at the gardens, and $2 for me, in part to cover Meetup's organizer fee.


LUNCH: Bring your own or buy it in the gardens cafe. We'll eat at around 1:15 PM 

TRANSPORTATION: 2 or 3 train to Eastern Parkway/Brooklyn Museum. For more details, consult mta.tripplanner.org, Google Transit (maps.google.com/landing/transit/index.html) and/or a subway map, since those sites do not always list the ideal routes. Also check mta.info/weekender for weekend service changes.
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be wearing a red cap.
results.name: Brooklyn Museum & Botanical Gardens (mostly indoors)

results.description:
CO-ED PICKUP SOCCER GAMES in Sara D. Roosevelt Park!

                                NO CLEATS or PLASTIC STUDS

                           See our page on Facebook!:

       facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CCuNsd9JXVE

Game description:

We'll play two simultaneous games of 7 on 7.
There will be 4 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field!
Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.
No power shots allowed.
If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.
If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.
Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game.
Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board on Friday night or before 12:00 PM on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

Sara D. Roosevelt Park, Nike Field
Take the F train to 2nd Avenue Lower East Side, and walk for about 3 minutes on Chrystie Street to the Nike Field between Stanton St & Rivington St
New York, NY 10002
Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S.

What to bring with you:

A positive attitude, pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee:


You will be asked to pay $9.50 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.50 dollars is used to pay for, permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled.
The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to Slánte for brunch and a Pint or Two:

                                                        Slánte

                                                  304 Bowery

                                           New York, NY 10012

                                               (212)[masked]

                                          www.slaintenyc.com

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

This Season we are playing The Beatles!

We have done Classic Rock, The Rolling Stones, Reggae, Motown, Summer Songs, Fleetwood Mac, Funk and Christmas ensembles, The Beatles is certainly due in our selection!

Acoustic guitars, bass and ukeleles welcome. If electric bring a portable amp:)

• Have an amazing time!

Every Saturday 12-2pm starting January 9th til April 23rd, the day before the performance, 16 practice sessions.

Season Pass

results.description:
Figure Drawing Bootcamp 

Gain more confidence in your figure drawing skills! 

Join New York Academy of Art MFA - Amanda Scuglia for a four-hour Figure Drawing Bootcamp.

This four-hour session will focus on drawing the figure from life. We will work on creating both expression and "likeness" within 20-30 minute poses. 

(This session is for people who have drawn the figure before but who consider themselves advanced beginners or intermediate.)

It is designed to give your drawings a sense of energy while still allowing you to analyze the figure. The result allows more information on the page in a shorter amount of time. 

The session will run as follows: 1. Lesson 2. Demo 3. Exercise (repeating) until the end of the session where we will bring together all the exercises into our final drawings. Amanda will provide guidance throughout. 

We will work from a live model for the entire session in this amazing room!


Material Requirements:

CHARCOAL- a variety of willow and vine- compressed chunky charcoal - charcoal pencils

PAPER- 18 x 24 in sketch pad paper for short poses (please make sure its full to ensure you have enough paper for the entire session)

MATERIALS- Sandpaper stick - kneaded eraser

Amanda Scuglia received her  MFA in Painting- New York Academy of Art, New York, NY. 

She teaches figure drawing at Long Island University of Brooklyn, NY and was visiting professor - Altos De Chavon (Parsons School), Dominican Republic. She also received an Eric Fischl Teaching Residency at West Nottingham Academy, Maryland.
results.name: (Sold Out) Figure Drawing Bootcamp

results.description:
** This class is for anyone who is completely new to improv and have been afraid to try it out. **

** You're welcome to stay and watch the Ensemble class that's happening right after this class ends. **

Public speaking is a powerful skill to have. And there is a powerful way to build upon and enhance your public speaking presence and have a good laugh at the same time: by learning how to improvise!

Improv takes focus, a willingness to embrace the group dynamic and a commitment to fostering your sense of play.

Dewey Chaffee, a professional comedian and improvisor, will lead you through each of these areas with skill, kindness and most importantly, patience, creating an environment that is safe, comfortable, and creatively inspiring.

Improv will make you a better listener, a more open and accepting communicator in life, and a master at slinging bullshit when you need to appear more confident than you feel on the inside!

More details here: www.PlayWithDewey.com

Anyone and everyone is welcome!

Your RSVP and online payment ahead of time is REQUIRED. (This is the only way that we know whether the class will happen or not. RSVP's are also our head count. If you do not RSVP online ahead of time, you are risking showing up to a cancelled event.)

-----------------------------------------------

About Dewey Chaffee

Dewey has more than 20 years of improvisation experience. He spent 23 years perfecting his skills as an improv performer for the Walt Disney Company. He's also appeared on Nickelodeon Television and worked as their audience warm up guy for several seasons of TV production.

Currently, he and his husband perform a live improvised comedy drag show called "The Lady Winifred and Didi Show."
results.name: Basic Improv for Public Speaking

results.description:
Francisco is organizing one more Bar Crawl/Run this weekend! Below are all the details. The first two events were lots of fun! Check it out!


This is a beer run, walk and crawl. We will mostly be running but some people can walk it. 


FAQs

Where are we meeting? We will meet at the Starbucks on 38 Park Row. Get there earlier if you want to get coffee before the start. 

Not a runner? No problem. You can walk the course. 

You don't drink beer? Get some wine or whisky or vodka or start the first few miles sober. 

You don't drink alcohol? You can still join. You can be the designated sober runner.  However you might not enjoy hanging out with a bunch of tipsy runners.

Can I join later? How do I find you if I do? Yes you can join us later. I will post my number in the comments section before the run and you can texts me to find us. The best way though is to download Glympse which is an app that will help you track us. I will also have someone update the comments section on the location as we hit each pub.

How long does this take? Usually about 6 to 7 hours. We stop each bar about 45 minutes to an hour. This way we have time to drink and get some food if the pub has food.

 • Leg 1

Destination: Henry Street Ale House

Address: 62 Henry St.

Distance: 1.4 miles

The course: From the Starbucks we run across to City Hall then cross over to the Brooklyn Bridge to the first pedestrian exit on the Brooklyn Bridge. Make a right on Cadman Plaza and run across the park through the walkway to Henry St. Make a left on Henry St.

The pub: Old school Brooklyn pub

 • Leg 2

Destination: Pedro's

Address: 73 Jay St

Distance: 0.5 miles

The course: Left on Henry St then another left on Old Fulton St and a right on Front St until you hit Jay St. Pedro's in on the corner of Jay and Front.

The pub: Negra modelo on tap and good Mexican food. 

 • Leg 3

Destination: Fools Gold

Address: 145 East Houston St

Distance: 2.2 miles

The course: Run uphill on Jay St to the  pedestrian walkway. It is on the left after you go under the Manhattan Bridge on Jay St. Run over the Manhattan Bridge, make a right towards Bowery, then right on Hester and left on Forsyth. When you reach Houston make a right. The bar will be in the middle of the block. 

The pub: Great tap selection plus good bar food

 • Leg 4

Destination: Whiskey Ward

Address: 121 Essex St

Distance: 0.4 miles

The course: Run on Houston towards Essex then right on Essex. This is the shortest run of the day and a nice break from that killer 2.2 mile run before. :)

The pub: Great whiskey selection. You can do flights of whiskey. 

 • Leg 5

Destination: Barcade

Address: 388 Union Ave

Distance:  2.3 miles

The course: Right on Essex St then left on Delancey St onto the pedestrian walkway of the Williamsburg Bridge to the last exit, left on Havermayer, right on Borinquen Pl until you hit Grand Ave. Left on Union Ave for a block and half until you hit barcade.

The pub: Barcade has a great selection of beer plus tons of old school arcade machines. We might have a PacMan tournament there! 

 • Leg 6

Destination: Reclamation Bar

Address: 817 Metropolitan Ave

Distance: 0.7 miles

The course: Right on Union then right on Metropolitan until you hit 817. 

The pub: Chill pub with a nice backyard. 

Link to the route on Google Maps

Picture of the route:
results.name: Bar Crawl/Run (Part Three)

results.description:
Hi All,  I'm running an Introduction to Meditation workshop at Align (http://www.alignbrooklyn.com/) this Saturday (the 9th) from 12-1pm.  Start the new year afresh! 

New to meditation? Not sure what all the hype is about? Not sure how to start? Join us for an Introduction to Meditation Workshop.

Do you live in a crazy world where deadlines, to-dos and obligations fill your days? Take an hour to learn how to slow down and find some calm in your internal world. Studies have shown that practicing meditation changes the brain-- increasing productivity, bringing about greater physical and mental health, reducing stress/anxiety and modulating pain.

While there are varying meditation techniques, this hour-long workshop will focus on the breath, sound and mantra meditation. The first 15 minutes will be a little about meditation and the brain/getting comfortable to sit, followed by 30 minutes of guided meditation using the breath, sound and mantra meditation techniques with periods of silence to practice the techniques. The remainder of the time will be available for comments and questions. You will walk away with techniques that can be integrated into the busiest of schedules.

Please only sign up if you are attending: http://www.alignbrooklyn.com/workshops/?mobile=false&options%5Bids%5D=336&options%5Bsite_id%5D=179394#!


Fee: Donation-based 

Thanks!
Jess
results.name: Introduction to Meditation Workshop

results.description:
Meet to share and discuss SF and fantasy writing, books, films, TV shows, the writing process, the publishing industry, etc. with other SF and fantasy writers (both published and unpublished).  We usually have a long and lively discussion, followed by critiques of stories or chapters (if any) that members brought along.  We don't always have stories to critique, but we usually enjoy having hours worth of discussion, so let us know near the beginning of the Meetup if you brought something to have critiqued so we don't use up all our time talking -- time flies when you're having fun!

Further details or topics for this Meetup may be announced later.

As usual, you can bring a chapter or short story for the group to critique, but it's by no means necessary.  If you do bring your MS, try to bring enough paper copies for everyone attending to have one, and if you want us to write comments or corrections on it, then please double-space it.  We usually ask the author to read it aloud (unless you're shy), which is very helpful, because you'd be surprised how often you don't catch your own mistakes until you read your manuscript aloud for the first time! 

For the manuscript (MS) critiques, length is not set in stone, but suggested length is 1500 words, maximum length 3000 words. In pages (Times 12 point font), 1500 words is just under five pages double spaced, or about three pages single-spaced (but you should always double-space to allow room for people to write comments or corrections!)  Don't worry if your MS is longer than 1500 words, you can still bring it, but please keep it under 3,000 words.

For more guidelines on critiques, see http://www.meetup.com/The-Woodbridge-Science-Fiction-Fantasy-Writers-Meetup/about/

results.description:
Develop a New Habit in 2016: Meet Attractive Women Smoothly and Easily in Your Everyday Life

RSVP HERE: 

Please follow this link if interested (NOTE: there is a fee to attend this special seminar)


https://www.eventbrite.com/e/meet-women-in-your-daily-life-saturday-seminar-tickets-19650803081

*Learn how you can meet 3 beautiful women every week without totally changing your schedule or routine*Figure out what is really holding you back from saying "hi" to that cute girl*Recognize conversation topics that give you a smooth way to break the ice*Give yourself the best chance possible to catch a woman's attentionduring the day*Transition from being a "passive observer" to an "action taker" when you see people you want to approach*And a lot more...

You will learn how to gradually reduce your nervousness around women, and turn social situations from a nerve-wracking, high-pressure experience into a manageable, relaxed and enjoyable one.

We will explore how to master your mind and emotions to give you a stronger presence in social settings.

Your Host is a Former Super-Shy, Introverted, Awkward Kid

I'm Justin, a dating and lifestyle consultant in New York. I've been working with guys since 2013 to help them build confidence, overcome their limitations and achieve concrete results in their dating and love life.

My clients are smart, successful guys who are looking to become the best version of themselves. They want to become more attractive to women while maximizing their potential in all areas of life, from career and social skills all the way to fitness and health.

Justin, you been a great help! I just wanted to take the chance to thank you for the effort your part to put together such a well-designed, progressive and honest program. –Kaye

As a coach and consultant, my teachings are based on my lived experience as a guy who went from being clueless with girls and weighed down with social anxiety, to getting dates and relationships with awesome women consistently.

I don't brag, but I currently live a life that most men will only dream about.

I'm not a super handsome guy. Nor am I tall, jacked or rich. My results are 100% from hard work on myself, bringing out the best in my personality, and learning how to communicate with the opposite sex.

Everything that I teach revolves around three key concepts: Simplicity, Realism and Results

I prefer to keep things Simple in dating (life is complicated enough as it is).

Realism means we put a limit on theory and esoteric musings, and always bring things back to the reality of what actually happens out there with women and dating.

And Results are what we are ultimately after, so anything that does not deliver results is thrown out.

Justin’s advice makes a lot of sense. He’s interested in pushing you out of your comfort zone but always acknowledges who you are as an individual and who you want to be as a man. He’s down-to-earth and full of practical suggestions to help you attain your goals, but will never tell you your standards are too high or your expectations unrealistic. –Jeff, Brooklyn, NY

What's Included in this Seminar?

1. Simple Techniques: Specific examples of actions and words that give you a guideline on how to approach a woman, carry on a conversation, flirt, ask her out, or exchange contact information.

2. Mindset & Beliefs: Recognizing negative beliefs and assumptions about yourself, your own attractiveness, about social norms, about women and what they want. We'll discuss how to gradually overcome these negative beliefs and grow into a new, empowered mindstate. Ultimately, all growth comes from shifting your mindset and attitude.

3. Lifestyle: Understanding the subtle but important lifestyle shift you will be undertaking as you become a more social and outgoing person, and how to make this shift through consistent action that pushes your comfort zone.

4. Live Demonstrations: I will demonstrate concepts with one of my female assistants, so that you can visualize how a conversation is started, details of body language and eye contact, what signals to look for to continue the conversation and persist vs. when to drop it and move on, and more.

5. Q&A Discussion: In the second half of the program, we will make time for audience Q&A so that you get your specific questions answered.

Schedule:

1:00 PM - 2:30 PM: Talks & Demos

2:30 PM - 2:45 PM: 15 minute break

2:45 PM - 4:00 PM: Talks, Demos & Discussion

If you're ready to get 2016 off to the right start, sign up now and get ready to become a more social, outgoing and confident guy!

================================================================

Location: Manhattan, New York. Final Address & Room Number Will be Emailed to You About a Week Before the Seminar Date.

The way I carry myself, the way I look at me has changed during the course. Thanks to Justin... I started owning my actions and myself... I have never felt manlier in life. –Rithesh

WHEN

Saturday, January 9, 2016 from 1:00 PM to 4:00 PM (EST) 

RSVP HERE: 

Please follow this link if interested (NOTE: there is a fee to attend this great seminar)

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/meet-women-in-your-daily-life-saturday-seminar-tickets-19650803081

Start 2016 off right - by making beautiful drawings! 

The Institute for Architectural Research is offering a basic course on urban sketching at Grand Central Station. 


This workshop is taught by experienced architectural instructors: Michael Sciarrillo, AIA; Scott Aker, AIA; Corey August and Chloe Rice. Students will be taught one-on-one through a series of sequential handcrafted drawings. 


The workshop is open to all levels of experience. There is no requirements for sketchbooks or pencil supplies. Please be prepared with your own material. 

However, if you would like to buy a sketch book, the Institute for Architectural Research offers one. Sketching kit include a uniquely red sketchbook, pencils, erasers, and sketch & wash pencil. Kits will be hand delivered at the beginning of the workshop. 

Institute for Architectural Research, Inc.

Just in time for the New Year! Fulfill your resolution to find your sweetheart!


How romantic would it be to meet “the one” at a library instead of online? Sure would sound more romantic eh? Now it can be a reality. Get out of the cold and enjoy a cup of coffee, tea or hot chocolate with fellow singles at the Mary Spink Free Community Library.

The hot drinks will be provided. You just show up with a smile and open heart. We’ll sip hot drinks, listen to some tunes on a vintage record player and hopefully form some connections.

As promised, no speed dating, loud clubs or bells and whistles—just an organic, laid back way for singles to meet and connect. You can talk about anything: your favorite books, worst online dating horror stories, the weather etc… etc… etc… Let’s just have a good time!

Day: Saturday, January 9th 2016

Time: 1:00 pm

There will be an Online Dating Sucks sign on the Library door. The library does not have a buzzer so please call Jennifer at (1646)[masked] when you arrive and you will be let in the library.

I hope to see you there!
