Every 5 years, MOMA/PS1 has a major show called "Greater New York", focused on the work of artists in the metropolitan area.  Let's go see it together!  I'm hoping we can more or less keep up with each other, sharing comments and opinions as we go through the show.


A link to the show is at:

http://momaps1.org/exhibitions/view/403

This huge exhibit extends over several floors throughout the building.  Wear comfortable shoes!

I recommend that you arrive an hour early (i.e. at noon) and eat lunch at one of the modest restaurants nearby, but that's your choice, separate from the meetup.  There's a diner (Court Square Diner) right under the #7 train tracks, and there's a Thai restaurant (Gaw Gai) across the street.  See the attached Google street view to get the lay of the land.  (You can see MOMA PS1 in the background, behind the diner.  And note that Quiznos is no longer there.)

https://www.google.com/maps/@40.7459907,-73.9453901,3a,75y,225.1h,79.27t/data=!3m6!1e1!3m4!1sz4X3MgUNrd9g9nzAjRLnXA!2e0!7i13312!8i6656!6m1!1e1


MOMA/PS1 admission is free to NYC residents with proof of address (such as driver's license, or utility bill).  If you're not a NYC resident, you can enter for $5 as a guest on my membership pass.

MOMA/PS1 is very close to subway stations for the 7, E, M, and G trains.  It's a short, easy ride from Manhattan.


If something comes up and you can't attend, please change your RSVP status as soon as possible.  Given the small size of this meetup group, no-show's would be a big loss.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet inside the front lobby, by the admission desk.  I'll have a red folder and a meetup sign.
results.name: See the "Greater NY" Exhibit at MOMA/PS1 in Queens

results.description: We play Settlers the second Saturday, and the third Sunday of every month. We play a mix of traditional (3-4 player) or expansion (5-6 player) Settlers as well as Knights & Cities and/or Seafarers. Recently, we have been trying new Settlers games like Starfarers and Fishermen - both of which we like. Newbies are always welcome. We'll teach you the game. And for those of you who have a board, please bring it. We look forward to playing with you! Also, to ensure that we have enough boards for all attendees, please bring your board and mention it in your RSVP. Thanks
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be upstairs.
results.name: Saturday Settlers Meetup

group.name: NYC Settlers of Catan Meetup Group

results.description:
Come join us to speak openly about our faith in our Lord and God Jesus Christ. Let us all be willing to reason and come to an agreement with what is written in the Scriptures. We want to continue in the apostles' doctrine, in fellowship, in breaking of bread, and in prayers.

In 2 Thessalonians 3:1, the apostle Paul exhorted the brethren to pray so that the word of Lord may have free course, and be glorified. Let us also pray so that we can have the same liberty. Let us learn to speak by comparing spiritual things with spiritual, line upon line, precept upon precept. Peace and Grace.
results.name: Church In Manhattan

results.description:
A simple HELLO could lead to million things!!!

2015 was a very busy and eventful year,  and I hope everyone made some amazing memories of it. As we enter into 2016, lets Ring out the old and Ring in the New by meeting for Indian brunch NOT Buffet!


Chote Nawab offers great weekend lunch specials for $10, its a full meal including entrees, breads and rice. I can say from my own experience that their food is one of the best desi food in town.

Hope most of you can make it. It will be great to catch up with some old friends and make some new ones as well.


There is enough free street parking around the restaurant.

www.chotenawabnyc.com/

http://www.yelp.com/biz/chote-nawab-new-york
results.name: 2016 - New Year Indian Brunch @ Chote Nawab

results.description:
Welcome, new beginners!


Please take advantage of this chance to try this unique sport and meet some of the most friendly and encouraging people in New York City to fence with.

If there is no more space in this meetup, you can sign up for the 2pm-3pm hour at http://www.meetup.com/nyc-fencing/events/226973002/


If you've never tried fencing before, we're happy to teach for the love of the sport.


If you're an experienced fencer, this would be a great time to invite some of your friends who have expressed an interest to check out the sport.


Please wear shoes with non marking soles and clothes that allow you to move freely.(There are changing rooms available)

There will be a brief demonstration, followed by some basic lessons and a chance to try your hand

The entrance to Battery Dance is at 380 Broadway near White St. near a sign that says "Empire Apparel"  ( https://www.google.com/maps/place/67+White+St,+New+York,+NY+10013/@40.7180128,-74.0039453,19.21z/data=!4m7!1m4!3m3!1s0x89c25a20812f2881:0x97720602ef7dd76c!2s67+White+St,+New+York,+NY+10013!3b1!3m1!1s0x89c25a20812f2881:0x97720602ef7dd76c?hl=en.. ) Ring the bell for the 5th floor and we'll buzz you up.

- Mike
results.how_to_find_us: Ring the bell for Battery Dance and we'll buzz you up.
results.name: Free Introduction to Fencing

group.name: The New York City Fencing Meetup Group

results.description: Join us as we gather to get to know one another and to discuss the Apostle's Doctrine as recorded in the scriptures and other foundational teachings necessary for salvation and faith in the Lord Jesus Christ.

results.description:
Hello Everyone! The Edgar Cayce Center is having a healing fair and I have the honor of participating with many other psychics, body workers, and Lightworkers.

One of the things I enjoy so much about healing fairs is giving people powerful VortexHealings® without anyone having to worry about busting their wallet. :-)

I will be giving 30 minute healing sessions at the Edgar Cayce-nyc

Admission: $25

When: Saturday Jan 9th - from 1pm - 7pm

Where?: Edgar Cayce Center - 241 West 30th St. 2nd Floor. My Website
http://www.simondeacon.com/ Vortex Healing® is a energy therapy modality that works with divine healing energy and divine consciousness that is channeled through my being into the client. When this happens a form of multi-dimensional healing occurs that becomes literally, spiritually, emotionally, physically, and even karmically transformational. Vortex Healing® works directly from the realm of divine consciousness. When you receive a healing you receive from a multitude of energetic and divine frequencies simultaneously. There are many levels to our consciousness, some containing the deepest and hardest to reach levels of negative conditioning, karma, and trauma. Vortex Healing® reaches all these levels. Vortex Healing® creates powerful and accelerated healing for the deepest of blocks, negative patterns and emotional trauma. It heals and transforms the very fabric of your reality. All negativity, disharmony, struggle, and even negative karma fall away to bring about incredible breakthroughs, freedom from the deepest of trauma, and a great opening to the flow of fulfillment and abundance. The divine frequencies used can reprogram core belief systems and negative emotional patterns that will bring more harmony and fulfillment both in your inner and outer reality. It also releases the illusion of separation consciousness, so each healing session brings you even deeper into your most highest divine expression. Hope to see you there! Blessings Simon ‘® “VortexHealing" is a registered service mark of Ric Weinman. All rights reserved. Used here with permission. For more information on VortexHealing visit www.vortexhealing.org
results.name: The Edgar Cayce Healing Fair - 30 Minute VortexHealing® Sessions

results.description:
What's up guys! My first seminar for 2016 will be on Saturday, January 9th: Meet Women in Your Daily Life.

See the info below and click here to purchase tickets ($41.99)

• Learn how you can meet 3 beautiful women every week without totally changing your schedule or routine

• Figure out what is really holding you back from saying "hi" to that cute girl

• Recognize conversation topics that give you a smooth way to break the ice

• Give yourself the best chance possible to catch a woman's attention during the day

• Transition from being a "passive observer" to an "action taker" when you see people you want to approach

• And a lot more...

You will learn how to gradually reduce your nervousness around women, and turn social situations from a nerve-wracking, high-pressure experience into a manageable, relaxed and enjoyable one.

We will explore how to master your mind and emotions to give you a stronger presence in social settings.

Your Host is a Former Super-Shy, Introverted, Awkward Kid...

(Read More and Sign up Now)
results.name: Meet Women in Your Daily Life - Saturday Seminar

results.description: We are a group of seekers studying the book of Acts to come to know what God's plan is for His church. Anyone is invited! Call if you have any questions (812) 344 4267. Look forward to seeing you soon!
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be in Burger King afternoons at 330pm studying the book of Acts. We'd love for you to join us. Call or text Caleb at 812 344 4267 if you have any trouble finding the group.
results.name: Bronx Saturday Afternoon Bible Study

results.description:
Learn to Salsa New York Style with Yrma Arias at El Taller! This style of Salsa, "On 2", has gained popularity over the last decade in NYC. The classes will focus on the look and feel of the dance - with an emphasis on timing, footwork and partner work. Classes will provide instruction and repetition of the steps ‘Shines’, introduce the importance of the leader/follower connection, and provide practical techniques for the Latin Motion. Particular attention is paid to rhythm and musicality. This is an enjoyable class designed for people of all ages. The most important lesson is to have fun! What to bring: A great attitude and comfortable clothes and shoes that allow you to move!


When you arrive at 215 E. 99th Street, press the El T button on the intercom and we'll buzz you right in!
results.name: Beginner Salsa Dancing

group.name: Spanish, Salsa, and Tango at El Taller!

results.description: Ladies, it was a tie in December for the book between "Maybe in Another Life" and "Let's Pretend This Never Happened."  Happy Holidays and Reading!

results.description: Want to learn how to protect yourself, but not interested in a traditional martial arts class?  Come to the Bronx Combat Sanda Club.  There's no uniforms, kata, bowing, jumping and flying kicks.  Learn common sense self defense for today's urban street

results.description:
Join DM Noah Anderson as he runs the first D&D 5E Module over two parts!

The Sword Coast is siege. In an audacious bid for power, the Cult of the Dragon, along with its dragon allies and the Red Wizards of Thay, seeks to free Tiamat from her prison in the Nine Hells to bring her to the Forgotten Realms. The cult's forces are sweeping from town to town, laying waste to all who oppose them and gathering a hoard of riches for their dread queen. The threat is so dire, factions as disparate as the Harpers and the Zhentarim are banding together to battle the cult. Never before has the need for heroes been as desperate.

This campaign follows the module of the same name, and will be broken into two parts with six sessions each.
results.name: D&D 5E: Hoard of the Dragon Queen, Part 1

results.description:
75+ members once again attended our last Scavenger Hunt! 

Explore what lies beneath the streets of the Big Apple for this warmer, wintertime edition of The Amazing New York Scavenger Hunt. 

This fast-paced three-hour event is a hybrid scavenger hunt-obstacle course where you'll experience the fun and excitement of being part of a team that solves clues and faces mental and (not-so) physical challenges in a race to the finish line. 

Each member of the winning group receives a New York City gift package, and the pictures you'll snap along the way will be priceless.

GET TICKETS HERE ($25 early bird, price will go up to $35) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Jan-09-2016_at_0130PM

What to expect:  

• A fun day with with new friends 

• Knowledge about hidden parts of the city

• Mental and (not-so) physical challenges

• A memorable adventure with photos

• A story to tell

You can come alone and be placed with a partner or you can sign up with a guest. You'll do the scavenger in pairs of two. 

*Prepay Only Event (No tickets sold at door)

*BUY TICKETS HERE ($25, price goes up as date gets closer) - 

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Jan-09-2016_at_0130PM

Who can attend? All are welcome. This is not an age/ethnic/gender specific event. 

What should I wear? Dress for the elements. Be prepared for to walk. Dress comfortable – Most teams wear running shoes. 

What should I bring? A fun attitude, A Smart Phone if you have (either Android or I-Phone - fully charged). The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. Best to download that before you come to the event.

Where do we go? There’s no set course. Find your own way. It’s a ‘choose your own adventure’ race. You will go around the city.

What if it rains? You won’t melt, we promise! The race still goes on. Races can actually be MORE fun in the rain!

Why does your RSVP say +40? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. We usually have at least 40 members attend. 

Where do I get a ticket? You must prepay to attend. Tickets will not be sold at the door. We expect this event to sell out so PREPAY ASAP here - 

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/scavenger/dates/Jan-09-2016_at_0130PM
results.name: The Amazing UNDERGROUND Scavenger Hunt (Prepay Required)

results.description:
The NYSC invites you to join us to our monthly Women’s circle where we honor your feelings, honor your soul and call upon your divine being to help you move through this sacred time. Within the circle, women unite to empower their voices, enhance their courage, reinforce their compassion, and connect with their wisdom. We meditate, play music to access our heart's knowledge, remember our mothers and grandmas, share, and enjoy sisterhood! This circle is open to all traditions and levels, and beginners are especially encouraged to attend.
Please arrive on time and bring water to drink, a drum or rattle (you may borrow one at the event), pen & notepad, a scarf, and feel free to bring objects that are connected to your spiritual power. Suggested donation: $20 For more info visit http://www.nyshamaniccircle.org/womens-circle or email [masked] with questions.

If you need to contact us on Saturday, please feel free to email us.


"When women gather, Pachamama heals!"
results.name: NYSC Women's Circle!

results.description:
A message from John:  I've asked Monica & Maria to model in this event which follows the morning workshop I am hosting. 


Those attending the workshop are welcome to accompany me to grab a bite to eat. There is plenty of time to enjoy a good lunch before this photoshoot begins. 

Maximum photographers attending: 6

Models attending: 1 - 

Models: Monica 


Monica (above)

Maria (below)

Duration: approximately 1.5 - 2.5 hours (depends on attendance) 


Location: Inside the NYC Public Library next to Bryant Park (IMPORTANT: Enter at the 42nd Street entrance)

What to bring: Aside from the obvious bring a monopod if you have one. 

NO TRIPODS OR FLASH ARE PERMITTED

Suggested experience: All Skill levels are invited. On these types of shoots you will be shooting to learn on your own. Feel free to practice, experiment and to learn to direct the model.  All our models are hospitable and are willing to help you learn. They are expecting to be told to move to the left when it was meant to the right; Twist your body when meant to be told to turn.  But this is what it's all about. To help photographers learn and get comfortable working with models.  

How the process works: 

Each photographer will get approximately 30 minutes of actual shooting time.

The photographers shooting time is equally divided to shoot each model. Turns will be taken (3 turns per model) by photographers. It's a process that works well and fair.  

When you arrive, the procedures will be explained before beginning at he same time fees are collected if any are due. 

Enjoy the shoot!

REGISTER NOW!
results.how_to_find_us: IMPORTANT: Enter at the 42nd Street entrance
results.name: The elegance of the NYC Library with Monica & Maria

venue.address_1: Tillary St and Cadman Plaza W
venue.name: Cadman Plaza (Turf Fields)

results.description:
This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe and is free for those who attended both training sessions with him the same day, $4 for all others.


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST 2 HOURS BEFORE THE GAME!

• Update your RSVP by 11:30AM

• RSVPs close by 12 NOON

• No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense, which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Williamsburg Soccer Training activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Williamsburg Soccer Training Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Williamsburg Soccer Training programs or activities.
results.how_to_find_us: Coach Moe will be wearing a neon yellow pinnie.
results.name: PICK UP GAME 90 mins SAT 1:30 PM Cadman Plaza

group.name: Brooklyn Soccer Club - Adult Soccer lessons and pickup games

venue.address_1: Sony Atrium is located at 550 Madison Avenue (between 55th and 56th)
venue.name: Sony Atrium

results.description: Let's meet and play! All levels of experience welcome. We will set up around 1:30 and start the game at 2pm. If you haven't played before, check out some of the videos posted in the group before coming. We will also go over rules and everything beforehand.
results.name: Saturday Thrones

results.description:
Hey ALL,

If you would like to play for both sessions then you can also sign up for back to back time slots as well.

We will be having TWO 1.5 hr sessions each Saturday.

If you'd like, you can sign up for both and play all 3 hours or you can just sign up for either one.

We will be playing FUTSAL - 8 minute round robin matches with THREE teams of 5 (4 and a sub). Music PROVIDED!

results.description:
Since the days of 1654 the history of the Jewish people can be found in the formation of a place called New Amsterdam, which would inherit its now used name, New York City. It is said that the beginning stockholders, who were apart of creating the now vibrant city, were in fact Jewish. They helped many other Jews who came to this new city seeking refuge. 


Since then the history of the Jewish people have endure severe turmoil and tribulations. However, regardless of the challenges, their journey has led them to one of the most celebrated cities in the world. Join us for a day of touring one of my favorite museums.

I love this museum. Famous for teaching the history of Israel, Eastern Europe and the Middle East, it also showcases some of the most interesting artist of today's generation.  We had a great time before, I say we do it again.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

Participating Live:

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

results.description:
Hey all. This month we're reading Planetfall by Emma Newman.


From Emma Newman, the award-nominated author of Between Two Thorns, comes a novel of how one secret withheld to protect humanity’s future might be its undoing…

Renata Ghali believed in Lee Suh-Mi’s vision of a world far beyond Earth, calling to humanity. A planet promising to reveal the truth about our place in the cosmos, untainted by overpopulation, pollution, and war. Ren believed in that vision enough to give up everything to follow Suh-Mi into the unknown.

More than twenty-two years have passed since Ren and the rest of the faithful braved the starry abyss and established a colony at the base of an enigmatic alien structure where Suh-Mi has since resided, alone. All that time, Ren has worked hard as the colony's 3-D printer engineer, creating the tools necessary for human survival in an alien environment, and harboring a devastating secret.

Ren continues to perpetuate the lie forming the foundation of the colony for the good of her fellow colonists, despite the personal cost. Then a stranger appears, far too young to have been part of the first planetfall, a man who bears a remarkable resemblance to Suh-Mi.

The truth Ren has concealed since planetfall can no longer be hidden. And its revelation might tear the colony apart…

(Y'all know the drill: we eat, catch up, and talk pop culture. We'll also be voting for the next book. Hope to see you there!)

results.description:
Basic Ground Rules for Participation

Please wear either a blue/black or white shirt to make things easy (Preferably bring both in case we need to mix the teams more evenly).


no need to respond at all if you can't/don't want to play

• if you do respond IN, please come unless something really urgent comes up (hangovers or better offers from your cooler friends not accepted for absences!)


• If you suck at Ultimate... you are more than welcome. This is open to ALL skill levels, ages etc. If you're really good, please pretend you suck every once in a while for the benefit of the rest of us! We're just here to run around and have fun. We all want to score and win but if you want to win at all costs, this is not the game for you.

• The trick with this group is making sure we have enough to play, so those who do show up don't waste a trip, so please make the effort this year to be honest with yourself and us about if you can/want to come down so we can make the right call for GAME ON or GAME OFF. If you are a "maybe" please indicate that via the comment section with a brief explanation (ie 80% chance I'll be there...). If you RSVP and are then unable to attend, please update your RSVP as soon as possible.

What is Ultimate Frisbee? In a nutshell <borrowed from Wiki> :

Ultimate is a limited-contact team field sport played with a disc (frisbee). Points are scored by passing the disc to a teammate in the opposing end zone. Other basic rules are that players must not take steps while holding the disc (maintain a pivot), and interceptions and incomplete passes are turnovers.

Closest analogy I could come up with = a mix of basketball and football, but played with a frisbee. You do not need to be an expert frisbee player/thrower etc. - it's all about having fun.

results.description:
This series explores concepts in neurobiology, gender and health from a feminist standpoint, with the goal of encouraging community engagement in neuroscience. The course is very much for non-scientists who want to learn some basics of neuroscience, with the opportunity to discuss topics ranging from cell biology to biomedical and research ethics.
No experience needed; just bring an understanding of the Bluestockings mission, and your curiosity about brains!
Future classes TBD

As a group, RadFem has explored this subject in a number of venues and discussed some of the controversies that surround it.


https://youtu.be/uhIG4TuG4e8

Here is more background info for those interested, courtesy of Kriss and Beth from Feminist Freethinkers of NY:

ARTICLES

·  'Neurosexism' – an overview: Neurosexism: Brains, Gender and Tech

·  'Neurosexism' – now what? (some thoughts on its impacts and what to do next…)

“Brain Study Confirms Gender Stereotypes”: How science communication can fuel modern sexism and Neurosexism: A conversation with Cordelia Fine

·  Just for fun (the writing is amusing) So my mushy head is 'hardwired' for girly things, is it? If this is science, I am Richard Dawkins
-----
VIDEO

· Sex, Brain, and Culture: The Science and Pseudoscience of Gender Difference (OUTSTANDING lecture by Lise ELIOT, at the University of Texas – "Center for Values in Medicine, Science, and Technology")
-----
PODCAST

· "Rationally Speaking" – Episode 30 (Julia GALEF and Massimo PIGLIUCCI talk with Cordelia FINE, author of "Delusions of Gender")
-----
BEYOND – Scholarly links, if you just cannot get enough on the topic! ;)

· Recommendations for sex/gender neuroimaging research: key principles and implications for research design, analysis, and interpretation

· Neurofeminism and feminist neurosciences: a critical review of contemporary brain research
results.name: Feminist Neurobiology, Bluestockings, 1/9

results.description:
This conversation is structured around the questions and answers in Pat Love, Ph.D. and Jon Carlson, Ph.D.'s TV Series "LOVE:  What Everyone Need to Know" shown CUNY TV every Tuesday at 10PM, TV Channel 25-3.   http://www.cuny.tv/show/love/PR1010105

Bring your questions and your collective wisdom.

CUNY TV - CH 25-3.  Tuesdays - 10:00am, 4:00pm, 10:00pm.  Wednesdays 3:00am.

About the CUNY TV series, "Love:  What Everyone Needs to Know."

"According to psychologists, the single greatest predictor of happiness and success in life is a healthy love relationship. Yet, although we concede that knowledge is power, most of us have only a rudimentary understanding of what we’re in for when we go off in search of true love.

LOVE demystifies this all-important predictor of happiness, defining the nature of true love and outlining the commitment it takes to keep it alive. This telecourse is taught by two distinguished doctors: Dr. Pat Love, a licensed Marriage and Family Therapist and relationship consultant, and Dr. Jon Carlson, a university professor and Psychologist. Both instructors are practicing clinicians and have authored books and articles that have attracted national recognition. They challenge students to confront assumptions on the nature of love and to critically analyze the ideals perpetuated by popular culture in order to realize the wisdom it takes to find lasting love."

Suggestions:

A. Listen to understand and suspend judgment.

B. Make one point at a time and allow others respond. Speak from personal experience.

C. Identify the underlying assumptions. Look for new insights.

Note – Meetup nor the participants neither screens participants, nor supervises or controls meetings, and we have no special involvement with any of the individuals who participate. Therefore, we suggest that participants exercise good judgment when attending.

Participants are:

- expected to honor each other's stated boundaries and to respect their privacy
- not obligated to provide information or answer any questions against their will
- encouraged to share only information they feel comfortable with sharing
- expected to maintain confidentiality and not reshare personal information without permission from the owner.

Please be advised that meetup is NOT a forum for dating, proselytizing, therapy, or for employees or independent contractors to introduce, promote, or sell goods and/or services, or for any unlawful activity. Participants voluntarily agree to participate by showing up. Thank you.

About the Moderator:  Yen is a divorced parent, manager, and former educator.  Yen is currently trading about $[masked] dollar.
results.name: RELATIONSHIPS: What Does It Take to Go the Distance? Dr Pat Love on CUNY TV

results.description:
Come Out And Celebrate The University Of The Streets Move To The Bronx This Saturday!!

The University of the Streets plays a vital role in the cultural, artistic, physical and emotional development of todays youth, while also providing an artistic haven for both aspiring and well known musicians.


Executive Director, Saadia Salahuddeen says “The University of the Streets is different from other "venues" in NYC because its original focus centered around the idea of a program, where kids and teenagers in gangs could find an escape and a place to better themselves.” 


Although UOTS has historically served the world-wide population of young adults, and will continue to do so, The Y.E.S. (Youth Encouragement Society) program will specifically target youth 8-19 years old.  

The Y.E.S. program is an outgrowth of UOTS’s rich history of community service in educational/cultural programming, and philanthropy.  Its launch coincides with University of the Streets’ move to new headquarters at 2381 Belmont Avenue in the Bronx.


The non-profit offers  structured classes that begin January 18 and run the gamut from “The History of Hip Hop” , Zumba fitness and Yoga, to Life Drawing, Keyboard Lessons and ESL.  

Visit our website at www.universityofthestreets.org  to register and get more information!

Although UOTS has historically served the world-wide population of young adults, and will continue to do so, The Y.E.S. (Youth Encouragement Society) program will specifically target youth 8-19 years old. 

The Y.E.S. program is an outgrowth of UOTS’s rich history of community service in educational/cultural programming, and philanthropy.  Its launch coincides with University of the Streets’ move to new headquarters at 2381 Belmont Avenue in the Bronx.

The non-profit offers  structured classes that begin January 18 and run the gamut from “The History of Hip Hop” , Zumba fitness and Yoga, to Life Drawing, Keyboard Lessons and ESL. 

Visit our website at www.universityofthestreets.org  to register and get more information!

results.description:
This is my second year attending this valuable program. Under Lee Reiser, ACA level ll instructor, will help you hone your existing skills, learn new ones properly and introduce new people to the world of kayaking. In a beautiful heated pool with all kayaks and gear provided you can train for 2 hours learning bracing, rolling, rescues etc. and in return help the public for 2 hours by setting up and putting equipment away, greeting the public students, assisting instructors etc. All level of kayakers are welcome. The sessions are as follows:
Course 1 Saturday - Nov. 14,21; Dec. 5, 12 (completed)
Course 2 " - Jan. 9, 16, 23, 30
Course 3 " - Feb. 6, 13, 27; March 5
The time for volunteers to practice is from 3 to 4 pm and the time to volunteer is from 4 to 6 pm. Please arrive at least 15 minutes before so you can get ready. Pack a small bag with your change of clothes. The pool is heated but you may want to wear a wet suit, bringing your own PFD, paddle and skirt can add to your comfort level. Pack a small bag with a change of clothes, towel etc and bring a lock for the lockers.
Please fill out the volunteer packet which can be obtained from the Yonkers Club site: http://www.yprc.org
click on the Riverbank link once you are in the site and download the NY community Kayak Program packet. If you commit to at least 1 session you will be provided with a parking pass.

DIRECTIONS- From 138th St. head west and make a left onto 12th Ave., Take the 1st right beneath the West Side Hwy (by the restaurant) then swing right again past the first guard booth. Follow the roadway in and around, curve left and make a hard left U-turn into the parking area. Use the elevator to get to the park on the upper level walk to the pool area. Make sure you have a parking permit in your car window. Please car pool as parking is limited.

FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION - PLEASE SEE NOV. 21, 2015 POSTING FOR RIVERBANK!
results.name: Volunteer, learn new skills and kayak at the NY Community Kayak Program.

results.description:
This conversation is structured around the questions and answers in Pat Love, Ph.D. and Jon Carlson, Ph.D.'s TV Series "LOVE:  What Everyone Need to Know" shown CUNY TV every Tuesday at 10PM, TV Channel 25-3.   http://www.cuny.tv/show/love/PR1010105

Bring your questions and your collective wisdom.

About the CUNY TV series, "Love:  What Everyone Needs to Know."

"According to psychologists, the single greatest predictor of happiness and success in life is a healthy love relationship. Yet, although we concede that knowledge is power, most of us have only a rudimentary understanding of what we’re in for when we go off in search of true love.

LOVE demystifies this all-important predictor of happiness, defining the nature of true love and outlining the commitment it takes to keep it alive. This telecourse is taught by two distinguished doctors: Dr. Pat Love, a licensed Marriage and Family Therapist and relationship consultant, and Dr. Jon Carlson, a university professor and Psychologist. Both instructors are practicing clinicians and have authored books and articles that have attracted national recognition. They challenge students to confront assumptions on the nature of love and to critically analyze the ideals perpetuated by popular culture in order to realize the wisdom it takes to find lasting love."

Suggestions:

A. Listen to understand and suspend judgment.

B. Make one point at a time and allow others respond. Speak from personal experience.

C. Identify the underlying assumptions. Look for new insights.

Note – Meetup nor the participants neither screens participants, nor supervises or controls meetings, and we have no special involvement with any of the individuals who participate. Therefore, we suggest that participants exercise good judgment when attending.

Participants are:

- expected to honor each other's stated boundaries and to respect their privacy
- not obligated to provide information or answer any questions against their will
- encouraged to share only information they feel comfortable with sharing
- expected to maintain confidentiality and not reshare personal information without permission from the owner.

Please be advised that meetup is NOT a forum for dating, proselytizing, therapy, or for employees or independent contractors to introduce, promote, or sell goods and/or services, or for any unlawful activity. Participants voluntarily agree to participate by showing up. Thank you.

About the Moderator:  Yen is a divorced parent, manager, and former educator.  Yen is currently trading at about $[masked] dollar.
results.name: RELATIONSHIPS: "What does it take to go the distance?" - Dr. Pat Love on CUNY TV

Bring a copy of The Real Book (sixth edition). Most of the songs we play are there. If you want to work on a song that's not in the book, bring lead sheets for everyone.

I'll usually let everyone know by Wednesday which room we'll be in on Saturday.

The rooms cost $70 for all three hours. We divide the cost equally.

results.description:
A fun afternoon of scrapbooking. I can host up to 6 people at the Crafty Game Cave nice and cozy.  With streaming Youtube videos all night long to get the creative juices flowing.

As a Stampin Up Demonstrator you are more than welcome to try out products from my stash.  Maybe you will use something you just gotta buy one for yourself ;)

Also on hand are the Cricut Expression (bring your mats & cartridges), a few Big Shot(s) and Martha Stewart scoreboards.  So bring your dies and embossing folders.

* I will have some beverages on hand! (Water, Soda, Juice we can make coffee or tea)  You are more than welcome to bring snacks if you please.  I have a microwave and a fridge at your disposal.  We are also local to many take out/delivery restaurants for food if you feel like ordering  I have some menus for your options.

Great, well cannot wait for some crafty company :)
results.name: Scrapbooking Afternoon Social...Weekend Edition!

results.description:
Coney Island has been one of the most iconic places in Brooklyn. The Brooklyn Museum also just opened an exhibit, featuring photos of Coney Island we will be visiting. So I thought Coney Island/circus/carnival/amusement park theme would be fun January. Since many of us have varied reading interests, we will stick to the same topic but not the same book. If you prefer to just join us for brunch but not participate in the book club, that is fine too.

Below are books with Coney Island as a major theme. Included is both fiction and non-fiction. Also, you can select a Coney Island or Carnival/Circus themed book of your own choosing.

Coney Island Novels:

Dreamland - Kevin Baker
Luna Park - Kevin Baker (Graphic Novel)
The museum of Extraordinary Things - Alice Hoffman
The Electric Michelangelo - Sarah Hall
Church of Marvels - Leslie Parry
Closing Time - Joseph Heller
Requiem for a Dream - Hubert Selby Jr
The Warriors - Sol Yurick

Other Novels:

The Night Circus - Erin Morgenstern
Water for Elephants - Sara Gruen
Geek Love - Katherine Dunn
Something Wicked Comes this Way - Ray Bradbury
Son of the Circus - John Irving
Circus in Winter - Cathy Day

Short Stories/Poems:

Coney Island Wonder Stories, edited by Robert J. Howe and John Ordover - (Science Fiction)
Gates of Illusion Louis Parseanoola
A Coney Island of the Mind Lawrence Ferlinghetti (Poems)

Memoirs

Now and Then: From Coney Island to Here: Joseph Heller
Kid of Coney Island: Fred Thompson and the rise of American Amusements - Woody Register
Non - Fiction

The Lost Tribe of Coney Island: Headhunters, Luna Park, and the Man Who Pulled Off the Spectacle of the Century by Claire Prentice
Coney Island Lost and Found - Charles Denson
Coney Island the People's Playground - Michael Immerso
Topsy: The Startling Story of the Crooked-Tailed Elephant, P. T. Barnum, and the American Wizard, Thomas Edison by Michael Daly

Here is the menu

http://jeatjetbar.com/menu/

results.description:
This meeting is for both fiction and non-fiction writers. Depending on how many people sign up to come and to share their work at this meeting, we will divide the group into two tables. A "fiction writers" table and a "non-fiction writers" table.

Bring a piece to read and discuss, up to 1500 words, or simply bring yourself. If you bring a piece, please make copies for the others. How many copies? Check here the last day and you will find the answer.

All formats welcome: poems, short stories, flash fiction, novellas, novels, articles, blog entries, essays, children books, screen and theatrical plays, etc.


Here is how we will divide the tables if needed:

1) Fiction writers: Genres covered are literary/upscale/art fiction, poetry, all kinds of mysteries, speculative fiction (fantasy, urban fantasy, horror and sci-fi), chick lit, women fiction, romance (all kinds, including historical, regent, sexy and erotica), western.


2) Non-fiction writers: Genres covered are all kids of non-fiction, autobiographies and memoires, academic non-fiction, news articles, blogs, poetry, non-fiction screenplays etc.

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being hosted by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people you see registered on your Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked].

<a href="http://www.newyorksocialnetwork.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/pastapark-0132.jpg"></a>If you are a novice or love art, our Chelsea Art Gallery Tours are a fun and casual way to explore a great part of the city while socializing and making new friends and connections.

With over 300 art galleries in Chelsea, our Gallery Tour  Led by Rafael Risemberg with a Ph.D. in arts education  finds the most innovative art, and leads you on an insightful, entertaining and affordable journey through the contemporary art scene.  Rafael explains the art in ways that makes the experience meaningful to those who don’t know a lot about art as well as those who do.

Our tours take place RAIN, Snow or SHINE, as we’re indoors over 90% of the time. You will be amazed at how much you will learn and enjoy both the art and the people on the tour!

The group will meet at a local cafe prior to the tour.  Following the tour many from the group stay together for a drink or a bite to eat.

Pay $25 when you arrive

DO NOT REGISTER FOR THIS EVENT UNLESS YOU WILL ACTUALLY ATTEND.

Can I come alone?  Yes 99% of the people come to this event on their own to meet new people and check out soe cool art.

What do I wear? Dress for the weather.  Be casual and comfortable.

What to expect: We are piggy backing on a larger tour.   We will have 10-15 from our group.  The age range for our people is 20's -40's ( the larger group is 20's - 60's)

How long does it last? about 2 hours

How do I know who is leading the group?  We meet separate from the main tour at a local cafe.  Our tour host will have a sign at the bar and you will have a chance to have something to eat or drink before we start the tour.  If you are not hungry just socialize.  When we are finished we walk over together to join the main tour.


If there does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?

Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

.  If you only see a few on your Meet Up don’t worry you won’t be alone!  If you want to know exact numbers or have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: NY's #1 Chelsea Art Gallery Best Exhibits Guided Tour: Socialize and Explore!

Join us for a very special event, exclusively create for members of the NYSLM. DREAM LIGHTS OF THE CITY a Photography exhibition by Fernando Espinosa on Saturday, January 9, 2016 at 4:00 PM.

Espinosa uses innovative infrared photography to create haunting aerial images; deeply delicate and darkly menacing, both familiar and unreal, the photographer captures a beautiful and unsettling new dream of New York City. Mr. Espinosa, an Ecuadorean born, will present his work to our members in this private event put together just for the NYSLM.  This is a unique opportunity to meet a renown artist, meet great people and polish your Spanish.

WHERE: One Art Space (23 WARREN STREET)

¡Allá nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
Today we will be focused and immersive in a  specific theme we will work on together as a group.

In today's challenge we design our own mercenary and military characters in any style and genre. Today's grab bag will be filled with the symbol and brief description of it of either one which will help guide your designs yet are open for interpretation in almost any genre, time period, and style. Any reference related to military,guns, mercenaries would greatly help if you happen to have any.

The meetup will be split into three parts: First sketches and warm-up exercises/conceptual discussion, then an hour and a half drawing your chosen idea and design, lastly we'll discuss each others drawings and ideas as a group.

So don't forget to bring your supplies and sketchbook as this meetup is going to be drawing focused!

You can find me at the tables on the second floor of the Cranberry Cafe.

I hope to see you there and having fun participating in this new style of meetup and exercising, challenging, or developing your drawing and conceptual skills with other imaginative artists throughout NYC. Any skill level and any style is welcomed!
results.name: Lets Draw Together! Theme: Mercenary Bands and Military Corps

This is a class in technique although, when you've conquered a song technically, then I will coach musicality and performance. Class size is limited. Fee is $20/per. You may audit the class once (without participating) for $10. Let me know when you sign up if that's your intention.

    People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great coffee and cookies, sandwiches, <a>pizza</a>, etc.

    I've been asked to post this:

Dear Members:  I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey

results.description:
Hi all,


We had an amazing Drum Circle at Casa de Dragón in December! The next date for Earth Drum Circle is coming up on Saturday, January 9th. What a great way to ring in the New Year!!! We look forward to seeing all that can make it! Please reply or RSVP to this MeetUp invite to let us know if you plan on attending the Drum Circle. Also, just F.Y.I. as the Kung Fu class that I am teaching to the disciples from the Free Summer Saturday class runs from 2:00 p.m. to 4:00 p,m (a block from my house in a donated Yoga studio). Thus, we will be moving the start time of Earth Drum circle a half hour later than usual to 4:30 p,m. for the winter months. Lastly, links can be found at the bottom of this invite to video on YouTube and Audio files on DropBox (.WAV and .M4a) of December's Earth Drum Circle. 

DRAGON

P. S. If you need to contact me the day of this event you can reach me at: H: (212)[masked] or Cell: (917) 597-5801.

When: Saturday, January 9th at 4:30 p.m.

Where: Casa de Dragón, 5057 Broadway, Apt. #2, Inwood, NY.

What to Bring: Yourself (feel free to bring friends along), your drum (if drumming), and any other percussion or other instruments (adds to the mix). BTW, If you do not have a drum but want to drum come on up, I have plenty of extra drums here!

Food and Drink for Potluck: Please try to bring some food and or drink to share as we are tying to make the Drum Circles more of a potluck to sustain our drumming energies!!!

Public Transportation to Inwood

The #1 Train:
Take the #1 train to the 215th Street Station. (Don't miss your stop, the next one is in the Bronx) If you get on the train in the fourth car from the front it will put you right at the exit doors when you get off the train. Once down the stairs I am 1 block West of the train station. Just walk from 10th Avenue (where the train stops) to Broadway. (Away from the Department of Sanitation.) Cross to the far side of Broadway and I am the first building on the right. (Just North of the Deli - Between 215th and 216th Streets)

The A Train:
Take the A train to the 207th Street station. Make sure you get on the train at front two cars which will let you exit at 211th Street and Broadway. Walk 4 blocks North on Broadway to 215th Street on the West side of the street. I am the first building just past 215th Street. (Just North of the Deli - Between 215th and 216th Streets)

Download a current Subway Map PDF from the MTA

YouTube Video - 12/12/15
#1: https://youtu.be/DwAJ-VWJn74
#2: https://youtu.be/msJBm0_CRpM
#3: https://youtu.be/dEFuF4OVeVo
#4: https://youtu.be/dtoHhVlYt-Y
#5: https://youtu.be/wQAEm2O-dq8
#6: https://youtu.be/9McrI5KaHCQ

Audio Files on DropBox - 12/12/15
,WAV (CD quality) and .M4a (iTunes)

results.description:
Welcome!

Join us for our half-court co-ed game of basketball.  12 spots will be available for this half-court event.  The format of the games will be similar to our standard run, but we the co-ed aspect will only over half the court.  The other half of the court will be reserved for a women's only game.  Women, if you prefer to play with women only, please RSVP on the "Women's Only" meetup event on this same date.

Other than that, the idea will be basically the same:

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. 

Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we have to be out of the gym by 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later! 

Don't forget:

* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* You will be asked to sign a waiver for 2014 as we're not a litigious group. 

If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers an email.

Here are the basic rules we follow for games:

1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds.  

6. Subs will enter the game no later than 6 points in (once one of the teams reaches 6 points). The sub will start the following game. Teams will regulate themselves but let's make sure everyone plays.

See you on the court! B-)

***NOTE***

In an effort for us to reduce overcrowding and to maintain a more accurate estimate of how many people to expect, please sign up online if you intend to play. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. We ask that you please just do not show up unannounced as you will kindly be asked to turned away. 

Also feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your nails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.


*****NEW*****

Share your Spotify playlists and tracks with us and we'll play them during gametime!

Send an email to [masked]

And please submit good tunes otherwise we'll be Basketball for the Musically Challenged...

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.


What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.


Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.


Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind!
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya
results.how_to_find_us: Studio M. Intersection of 7th Street and Brunswick. Nearest PATH station is Grove St.
results.name: Yogic Breathing & Meditation for Deep Stress Relief

results.description:
et's have a drink, meet good people and play some great games.

The list of games I will bring is down below. I tried to include a little bit of everything. But if you have a favorite game, please feel free to bring it.

We should be easy to find in the bar. The List of Games:

Bananagrams - The anagram game that will drive you BANANAS! Race to build your own crossword grid!

Forbidden Island - Join a team of fearless adventurers on a do-or-die mission to capture four sacred treasures from the ruins of this perilous paradise

Loot - Yo-Ho-Ho and a Barrel of Fun! Set sail for an exciting adventure of strategy and skullduggery in this captivating card game. Storm your opponents' merchant ships and seize valuable treasure. Trivia Pursuit - Bet You know it - When you play it, you don't have to know all the answers to win - it's what you think your friends know that really counts. Bet they'll know it or bet they won't, either way a smart bet can turn your winnings into wedges

Balderdash - the outrageous bluffing game

Pass the Pop Corn - Movie trivia

Scrabble Slam - a high-speed four letter word game, race to change the existing word and get rid of your cards

I will also bring cards, uno, cards game versions of scattergories, battleship, monopoly, and clue for those of us who prefer more traditional, party games

results.description:
This is a 2-part event. Please join us for either one or both - whatever you want, no obligation! Leafletting sounds scary? Just come for dinner!
Hate food? Just come for leafletting!

I'm planning on making this a weekly event, where people can feel free to join for part or all, whenever they can, and hopefully with time it will grow into a fun weekly outreach & social event that people look forward to all week!

5-6pm: Leafletting in subway station
6-9pm: Dinner at an awesome vegan restaurant

Please invite anyone and everyone!

The plan is that each week will be held at a different restaurant and we will leaflet for 1 hour at a subway close to the restaurant. Feel free to comment with your restaurant suggestions. Here are some ideas to get us started:

Peacefood - 1/9
Cinnamon Snail - 1/16
Avant Garden
Marty's Vburger
Seasoned Vegan
By Chloe
Caravan of Dreams
Beyond Sushi
results.name: GOVEG Dinner Club - Peacefood

results.description:
Saturday's sessions are a little slower paced and a good opportunity to work on basic techniques (rolling, ball handling, etc.) and just have fun. The pace may pick up, depending on the group, but new players will be incorporated into the play. (If you don't have experience kayaking w/ a skirt--rolling or doing a wet exit--please attend one of our Intro Sessions first.)

Two free trial sessions are available for newcomers; membership and playing fees are due for everyone else ($175 for full year, all included; membership year begins May 15). See (2015) Club and Facility Fees info for seasonal and per-session options. ACA Membership is required and due separately from club and facility fees (one-time ACA event membership is included for those in free trial sessions). Regulars: please confirm that your ACA membership is up to date or renew now. NYKP Members receive a discount! Newcomers can join ACA for 6 months at $15 for or for full year $30 (use PAC Individuals & Families options and select New York Kayak Polo).
results.how_to_find_us: Pool @ Yanitelli Rec Center. Enter from Montgomery St. & Fairmount Terrace
results.name: Saturday Session (SPU)

results.description:
Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

4:45 - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
5:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on.
5:15 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
6:15 - Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like.

If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Milk and Honey Cafe located at 1119 Newkirk Ave. The closest train station is Newkirk Plaza on the Q line. Walk 3 block down Newkirk Avenue until you reach Westminster Road. We are sitting at the table in the back.

SOME TIPS:

Laptops are welcome. Remember to charge your laptop ahead of time.

Please buy something to support this organic cafe. It would make the owner smile.

Come on time! If you come late, we will have already started.
Bring headphones if you don't want outside noise distraction.

RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.
results.how_to_find_us: http://www.milkandhoneycafeny.com
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Brooklyn

results.description:
How to be unconditionally happy?

A mind that is calm, without anticipation and agitation is the birth right of all individuals. A mind that is in the present moment will be happy.


What can get you to that state?

The rest you gain by reposing in yourself is deeper than the deepest sleep. The deeper your rest, the more dynamic your activity is. By being peaceful and happy you can turn your body into a power-house by generating an inner source of energy.


Meditation is simple and is a practical way to recharge and rejuvenate; empowering you to do more of the things you love.

Come join us for free guided session and experience the power of meditation.


Workshop Contents:

- Understanding the nature of the mind!
- Relaxing Breathing Techniques
- Guided Meditation
- Introduction to the Happiness Course and Sudarshan Kriya
results.how_to_find_us: Studio M. Intersection of 7th Street and Brunswick. Nearest PATH station is Grove St.
results.name: Yogic Breathing for Deep Stress Relief

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in Long Island and New York City, with his concentration in securities law.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.
results.how_to_find_us: The meeting is at 26 2nd Avenue, between 1st St. and 2nd St. You can take the F train and get off at the 2nd Ave. stop (and use the 2nd Ave. exit at that station).
results.name: Bhagavad-gita Class & Kirtan @ 5:30 p.m. on Saturdays at 26 2nd Avenue, NY, NY

group.name: Kirtan Yoga & Bhagavad Gita As It Is Discourses -- NYC

results.description:
Overcoming type 2 diabetes and chronic metabolic syndrome, while enjoying life more fully, are possibilities for you - holistically, naturally, and compassionately to self and others. You can reach your health goals and fall in love with wellness…if you can stand the suspense!

Come:

Learn how Sweet Healing: A Whole Health Journey, a page-turner of a thrilling mystery novel packed with 15 years of expertise and research in healing and nutrition, can teach you, inspire you, and motivate you to sustain yourself on the path like no other book!

Find out why the author of Sweet Healing: A Whole Health Journey writes about the natural healing process in character fiction, where personal growth, plant-sourced unrefined food, and sacred lifestyle practices are parts of our shift from dis-ease to thriving!

Discover the impact Sweet Healing: A Whole Health Journey can make for your healthy enjoyment of life, and for the people you gift Sweet Healing to this winter.

Bring your questions!

“Sweet Healing is a heart-touching and inspiring novel about holistic approaches to healing and preventing metabolic syndrome and diabetes. With vivid story-telling, Michael Bedar helps us understand the deeper meanings of wellness and healing; uplifting and potentially transformational!”


– Dr. Will Tuttle, author of the best-selling book, The World Peace Diet

“Sweet Healing is a story of our time that reveals a reality that more people on Earth are beginning to experience…where the extraordinary becomes the ordinary.”


– Jia Patton, author of Celebrate Life and May All Be Fed: Diet for a New World, with John Robbins   


People who have come to previous book readings on Sweet Healing with its author, Michael Bedar, MA, said they enjoyed experiencing the creativity storytelling style, while delving into important realities in health and life, as well as the positive uplifting energy.

5:30 “Tea Time” with the Author
6:30 Talk, Questions, and Comments
7:30: Book Signing
$30 including copy of Sweet Healing: A Whole Health Journey.
$17 Attendance Only
results.name: Experience a Whole Health Vegan Journey with Author and Filmmaker Michael Bedar

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$29 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 30-44 - 1f/1m spot left

group.name: And That's Why You're Single Events - NYC - Singles 25-55

results.description:
Last time was so much fun, we're going to do it again. We will again be playing a very relaxed casual game of Magic the Gathering. We're going to do this a little earlier and on Saturday so that we can get food/drinks after.

We're going to again play multi-player but this time we'll be playing two-headed giant. In this format you'll be paired up with a partner. Each of you will play separately but will share a combined 40 life total. There will be a containment bubble around each player of 1 player to the left or right for spell effects and attacks. That means that any effect that reads "each player" will only affect those in your containment bubble. You will be assigned a partner randomly at the event. If there's an odd number, one player will get to play two decks.

I'll update the location as it gets closer as well as the after-game food/drinks spot.

Again, everyone is welcome. If you've got an old deck laying around or you just bought your first booster pack yesterday, you're still welcome. We're here to play socially and have fun. The following cards are banned:

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$29 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
