results.description:
I don't know about you guys, but I HATE the cold so very much. Can't stand the winter because of it. However, I figured that while its still freezing outside, I can still set up a get together in the comforts of a warm living room, along with food, soda, and alcohol beverages (feel free to contribute).

I created this group because I want to do a lot of fun stuff with you guys, real talk. When it gets warmer, I want to do some cool stuff (laser tag, bar hopping, film screenings, ppv watching, traveling, camping, comic con etc.). But for now, this is only our 3rd meetup event and I would like to do a few more get togethers, just to meet some more of you before the better events comes up (by that time I would hope to have at least 10-20 of us for things).

Like the last 2 events we set up, it will basically be a game/movie type of night, but mostly created for socializing, laughs, and just getting to know each other (also, this way we will know who we will be hanging with for future events). So far, I have met a few cool people from this website, and I know theres a lot more of you out there so if this sounds like something interesting to you, you're welcomed to join us.
results.name: Cold Out, Stay In Get Together

DESCRIPTION:
Please join us for an evening of refreshments with karaoke, games, grand prized raffles including Canon DSLR camera, wines,free salsa lessons and yoga class and more; featuring with health educations about supplements, demonstration of correct exercise positions , make up artist sharing beauty secret, amateur private chef showing how to use a popular Japanese seasoning for healthy eating.

All the proceeds will go to my close friend Kit's, who is currently struggling with metastatic nasophyreangeal cancer, Cancer Support Fund. The night will start off Kit sharing his experiences and struggles of battling with nasopharyngeal cancer and appreciation to all the supports and loves have been given to... him and his family; followed by Peatrice talks about nasopharyngeal cancer in general to raise awareness, then followed by very talented private party host, Iris, on the usage of a popular Japanese seasoning Shio Koji to make tasty and healthy food. Afterwards we have Dr. Truong will give us a short discussion on whether supplementation are needed to maintain good health, followed by certified personal trainer Andrew shows us how to exercise correctly without getting injured. Lastly, we have a make-up artist teaches us the secrets of beauty.

• Refreshments

• Karaoke

results.description:
Overcoming type 2 diabetes and chronic metabolic syndrome, while enjoying life more fully, are possibilities for you - holistically, naturally, and compassionately to self and others. You can reach your health goals and fall in love with wellness…if you can stand the suspense!

Come:

Learn how Sweet Healing: A Whole Health Journey, a page-turner of a thrilling mystery novel packed with 15 years of expertise and research in healing and nutrition, can teach you, inspire you, and motivate you to sustain yourself on the path like no other book!

Find out why the author of Sweet Healing: A Whole Health Journey writes about the natural healing process in character fiction, where personal growth, plant-sourced unrefined food, and sacred lifestyle practices are parts of our shift from dis-ease to thriving!

Discover the impact Sweet Healing: A Whole Health Journey can make for your healthy enjoyment of life, and for the people you gift Sweet Healing to this winter.

Bring your questions!

“Sweet Healing is a heart-touching and inspiring novel about holistic approaches to healing and preventing metabolic syndrome and diabetes. With vivid story-telling, Michael Bedar helps us understand the deeper meanings of wellness and healing; uplifting and potentially transformational!”

– Dr. Will Tuttle, author of the best-selling book, The World Peace Diet

“Sweet Healing is a story of our time that reveals a reality that more people on Earth are beginning to experience…where the extraordinary becomes the ordinary.”

– Jia Patton, author of Celebrate Life and May All Be Fed: Diet for a New World, with John Robbins People who have come to previous book readings on Sweet Healing with its author, Michael Bedar, MA, said they enjoyed experiencing the creativity storytelling style, while delving into important realities in health and life, as well as the positive uplifting energy.

5:30 “Tea Time” with the Author
6:30 Talk, Meditation, Questions, and Comments
7:45: Book Signing
$30 including copy of Sweet Healing: A Whole Health Journey.
$17 Attendance Only
results.name: Book signing of "Sweet Healing" novel with author + meditative experience

results.description:
Jamaican me hungry : )

CASH ONLY AND FINAL RSVP EVENT. RESERVATION 6.30 PM SHARP 

Continue island hopping with me as we head to Miss Lily's for Jamaican food and music. Beach shack decor, cocktails and reggae enhance Caribbean fare such as jerk chicken and goat curry. Let us eat and relax Jamaican style while Radio Lily plays Caribbean music. 

Menu link is not working so have posted the delivery menu here http://www.misslilys.com/assets/pdf/menus/misslilys-delivery-menu.pdf. We will dine individual style with everyone paying for their own food/drink + tax+ tips. Please carry cash as it makes things easier.

While I figure out the date/time, learn me some Jamaican, will ya ?


Do you know how to say “I will be right back” or “Well done” in Jamaican? Do you have a Jamaican friend you want to communicate with or are you traveling to Jamaica? Jamaican patois (patwah) is another language. Below is a list of 18 Jamaican Patois phrases translated to English.

I Will Be Right Back – Mi Soon Come
To Eat – Nyam
Jamaica – Jamrock, Jamdown, Yard
Jamaican – Yardie, Yard man
Friend – Bredren (male), Sistren (female)
Well Done – Big up, Respect
Excellent – Sell off, Tun up, Wicked
What’s up? – Wah gwaan, Whappen, Whe yu a seh?
Everything is good – Mi deh yah, Everyting criss
See you later – Likkle more, Walk good
I understand – Zeen
Over there – Ova deh
What Are You Up To – Wha Yuh Deh Pon
I Don’t Care – Mi Nuh Biznizz
Jealous – Badmind
Step up your game – Tun Up De Ting
The party was good! – De Party Tun Up
OMG – Jeezum Pees
Don’t mess with me – Nuh romp wid mi
Move Over – Small up yuhself
Mix Up – Pasa Pasa
results.name: Jamaican Dinner@Miss Lily's

results.description:
That's right, you read that right! FREE OPEN BAR HAPPY HOUR at Holland House

Talk about winning! The new year has barely started and Play Big Apple is already bringing you a FREE OPEN BAR skeeball event. I mean who loves you??? ^_^ 

C'mon by Saturday, January 9th to join us for a fun night of skeeball. We will teach anyone who hasn't played before the two types of skeeball (I KNOW RIGHT?! THERE'S MORE THAN ONE WAY TO PLAY?! mind. blown.)

The free open bar* courtesy of our friends at Holland House is from 7pm-8pm but that doesn't mean the party is over after that because we gotcha drink specials right hea ALL NIGHT LONG!


• $16 pitchers of Bud/Bud Light

• $6 Fireball shots

It's going to be a pre-celebration to the beginning of a kickass Winter season so don't miss out, a post New Year farewell to 2015, or it's going to be whatever you want it to be!

Make sure to RSVP so we know you are coming!

*open bar applies to well drinks only
results.how_to_find_us: Look for the Play Big Apple staff in neon by the Skeeball machines in the back!

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE
This is a mix of a Flash Mob, Dance Party, and City Tour all mixed into one incredible night.

With headphones on playing two channels of non-stop party music, we go underground as we hit several iconic NYC subway platforms, terminals and even bars. Unlike your normal subway ride, your Party Tour Guide/MC will not only teach you about the NYC subway system but will have you doing some crazy things to flash mob those unsuspecting passengers and onlookers .

It’s one night you’ll be like, “OMG, did we just do that!?!”

Two channels of music:
Green: Top 40’s/ Dance
Blue: 90’s / 2K / Hip-Hop

Check in Location: Playwright Irish Pub 27 West 35th Street, New York, NY 10001.
Check out: Croton Reservoir Tavern, for Our Swing Dance After-Party! (Free Entry to after-party for all Mobile Party Ticket Holders. Address: 108 West 40th Street, Manhattan, New York.
Check in time: 8:00pm – 9:00pm // Leave at: 9:00 pm
Party ends: ~11pm

Special Notes:
Age Restriction: 21+
100 Limited Tickets

What you need:
Metro Card, Valid ID, Credit Card (Just for security return of headphones)

How it works
Arrive for registration and happy hour drinks. A valid Photo ID & Credit Card will be needed for check-in. In the event you do not return the headphone, you will be charged an additional $100. With the headphones on, we’ll be traveling in the streets and subway. You can adjust the volume and choose between two master mixes with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same music as you. If you need to leave at any point, just hand your headphones into any staff member.
results.name: Underground Party – Subway Tour!

results.description:
All the way from BOSTON, MA, Jan Marie & The Mean Reds return for an encore performance at our Swing Remix on Saturday January 9th, 2016. 

The Mean Reds sound is unique, and combines Jan Marie’s Billie Holiday-esque lag-vocal technique with a growling trumpet and oscillates between tinkling ivories and pounding keys on a Hammond B3 organ. Mixing genres with plentiful ease is their specialty, and their grooves run so deep they can get even the most left-footed of characters tapping their toes on the dancefloor. 

ojanmarie.com/meanreds

DANCE TIMELINE

6:30pm Partnering & Styling Swing Workshop (Adv Basic +)

Build your knowledge of partnering by adding the techniques and styling of these wonderful talents. Fun and playful material. 

Instructors: Evita & Paolo


7:30pm SOLO JAZZ Workshop (Int/ Level) 1 hr (JCC in Manhattan)

World Class teacher and performer Evita Arce will guide you thru a fabulous collection of material for both leaders and followers. This is a Solo Jazz routine that will help you improve your turns and rhythm. These techniques will carry over to your partnering world.

Instructors: Evita Arce


7:30 General Admission Doors Open

7:45 BEGINNER Dance Lesson (FREE with dance admission)

8:30 LIVE MUSIC & SOCIAL DANCING

10:45 Dance Performances, Announcements, Give Aways

11:00 LIVE MUSIC & SOCIAL DANCING

1:00AM END

All Ages

Tickets: $16 early bird (before JAN 07) / $18 Door

*Specialty dance workshops extra*

 www.swingremix.com
results.name: Swing Remix Dance @ the JCC

results.description:
New Moon Healing Sanctuary: New Year New You! with Special Guest Astrologist Rebecca Gordon

All are welcome to come January 9th for the first new moon of 2016! Come join a ceremonial circle to let go, to remove the layers that do not serve, and be happy and free!

“This New Moon is in Capricorn and next to powerful Pluto - It will ask you to claim your power and establish a deep root system where you can feel supported with your work and within your community. We will be connecting to the earth energy of Capricorn and the energy of pure manifestation. New moons are ideal times to imagine and bring forth new ideas from formless into form” –Rebecca Gordon


Astrologist Rebecca will also share some of the highlights of 2016 giving a message to each zodiac sign for the year to come.

Powerful energy portals are opened during new moons where intentions for new creations and development, MAGIC occurs with synchronicity and grace. We will honor this energy, committing to enlightening our NEW visions (perhaps finding a new career or partner) and being open to receiving guidance and healing.

The first new moon of the year is a powerful time to transform old patterns into new and blissful dreams. Let us embrace the winter and clarify our future visions for 2016.

The healing ceremony will include:

• Opening Ceremony
• Shamanic Drum Journey Meditations
• Astrological insight for the upcoming year!
• Satvic music
• Heart Opening Vegan Chocolate
• Community LOVE & more!

When: January 9th 2016

Time: 7-9:30 pm

*Please be respectful and arrive on time as we will open ceremony promptly.

Where: YogaNesh Chelsea
208 W 29th Street NYC

Cost: $25 or two for $40 if one brings a friend.

RSVP for one: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=QYUTUBZLTVQPG

RSVP for two: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=9QNL8KRRT4YTC

Sarah Eve is a culinary shaman, making magic in the kitchen and healing from the heart. She is a certified Usui Reiki master and practicing shaman with a deep love of the healing arts. Sarah Eve began her shamanic studies with Izhak Beery and followed with the late Ipupiara, a Makunaiman of the Ure-e-wau-wau Amazonian tribe. She has completed workshops with Tom Cowan and the 13 Indigenous Grandmothers. The path of healing also led her to work closely with the Santo Daime community, John of God, and crystal energy work in Brazil. Other international trips including Mexico and Central America, Europe, Israel, and Southeast Asia, she encountered sacred spiritual practices and healers in which she is blessed to share and teach. She completed her 200 & 500 hour yoga training with Sri Dharma Mittra. Integrating her experience also as a vegan chef, she uses food as another medicinal tool in achieving whole body health. She assists in creating a safe space in which you can heal you.
www.sarahevecardell.com

Rebecca Gordon (Siri Radha) is an internationally acclaimed astrologer, author and columnist of the stars. Founder of the year round My Path Astrology School, she teaches in person and on-line courses while conducting her private practice in nyc. Her astrological columns have been published in Well & Good, Prevention magazine, Conde Nast and her latest book will be released on Simon & Schuster in May 2016 titled ‘Your Body and the Stars’. She grew up learning astrology with her mother and later studied with Susan Miller of AstrologyZone. Rebecca is also long-time student, teacher and lover of Kundalini Yoga – passionate about the intersection where astrology meets the body. www.mypathastrology.com

All text, images, and products presented are copyright. Copyright © 2015 Sarah Eve Cardell. All rights reserved.
results.name: New Moon Healing Sanctuary: New Year New You! with Astrologist Rebecca Gordon

results.description:
Join us for the opening reception of "Anamorphosis," a multi-media installation by /rive. "Anamorphosis" will be on view at Open Source from January 9-30.

"Anamorphosis" is a spatial and relational exploration of what makes and defines a neighborhood, set in, and inspired by, the area surrounding the Open Source Gallery. The exhibit’s video and photo installations seek to collectively make visible the physical and social lines that demarcate and connect a community. Through site-specific and mobile media projects that encourage residents to reflect upon their neighborhood and share their stories, /rive seeks to highlight the relationships between public space, mobile technology and local or microhistories.

In "Horizon Lines," Annie Berman and Samara Smith uncover the edges that mark the neighborhood’s undefined and immutable borders. By visually exploring lines of demarcation, Berman and Smith investigate the areas where neighborhood life meets neighborhood boundaries. In "Convergence Lines," Samara Smith and A.E. Souzis outline the area’s social connections by mapping photographs sourced from the neighborhood’s residents. To participate in "Convergence Lines" text "START" to (917)[masked]. Visitors to the exhibit and residents will be invited to submit photographs via text throughout the month of January. When the images are collected and exhibited, they will create a more complete portrait of the surrounding communities, offering a glimpse into the many individual narratives that exist within the neighborhood.

/rive is a Brooklyn-based artist collective focused on site-specific, locative projects that meet at the intersection of psychogeography, locative media and documentary narrative. Most projects are set in, and explore, urban public spaces. Inspired by social practice, /rive embraces collaborative and participatory methodologies, blurring the boundaries between maker, subject and audience. Members Annie Berman, Samara Smith and A.E. Souzis have exhibited at the Museum of Modern Art, Queens Museum, Anthology Film Archives, New York Film Festival, Hammer Museum, Art in Odd Places and beyond
results.name: OPENING RECEPTION: /rive's "Anamorphosis"

results.description:
HETEP is an Egyptian word for being calm and content within the self.
Healing Touch Program gathers a community of people who want to communicate love, respect, and compassion through the language of healing touch. They care to keep improving their ‘touch intelligence’ so as to be aware of another’s needs and boundaries. 

A HETEP GATHERING starts with an invocation to the Elements and the various aspects of the Mother Goddess. The space created is sacred and safe for all of us to share our experiences - our thoughts and feelings, our presence, and the rhythms of our breathing as we participate in the expansion of our touch perception.

This event is expanding now to include everyone interested in evolving their 'touch intelligence'. It has been a monthly women's gathering and a wonderful opportunity to share and celebrate our intention, strength, and life experience!

You're invited to join this ongoing class at any time. It is 'by donation', because your healing presence is the most important material you can contribute! So please come and donate your body to the science of healing - we will return it renewed and energized. 

Every gathering starts with an introduction of ourselves in a circle. You will be introduced to this simple healing touch method. We will practice on each other on the floor lined with yoga mats and blankets. You may want to wear comfortable clothes. This program is designed for every body shape and sensory ability - or sensitivity! 

HETEP facilitator, Karuna Ma has been introduced to healing touch very early in life. Since 1998, qualified as a Reiki Master Healer and Seichim Master Teacher. Seichim energy is sometimes called 'Egyptian Kundalini' as it is great at assisting a breakthrough experience for both physical and psychic well-being. Since her training in 2001, Karuna has been working as a massage therapist, energy and sound healer.
results.name: HETEP Healing Touch Program

Our love and relationship expert will guide each single mom on a life-changing and transformative journey to find the love of their life that will complete their family. He will help them overcome any barriers or hurdles that are standing in their way from finding the happiness they deserve.

West Coast Swing is a contemporary form of swing dancing that's becoming very popular & can be danced to any kind of music! 

Dancing is a great way to meet people! This lesson also works as a great ice-breaker. It doesn't matter if you've never danced before or if you're a pro. This is just a fun way to learn some new moves and make new friends.

Join us to mix, mingle and learn West Coast Swing dancing from a professional dance instructor.

Get your ticket here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wcswing/dates/Jan-09-2016_at_0730PM

Here's a video of what to expect: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s86FMNfPgQ0

$15 for first 5 members to buy tickets, $20 after that (only 20 total spots available)

*RSVP won't hold your spot. Must prepay to be confirmed - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wcswing/dates/Jan-09-2016_at_0730PM

*Special Note - Payment includes FREE entry to our Quiet Clubbing Party starting right after at 8:30 PM.  More info/RSVPs here - http://www.meetup.com/NYC-Social/events/227362855/

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$29 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 24-36 - 1M /1F spot left

results.description:
Check our Facebook Page: 

 facebook.com/pages/New-York-Movie-Watchers-Much-More

NOTE: $3.00 will be refunded to you at the end of the event.

Synopsis: While exploring the uncharted wilderness in the 1800s, legendary frontiersman Hugh Glass (Leonardo DiCaprio) sustains injuries from a brutal bear attack. When his hunting team leaves him for dead, Glass must utilize his survival skills to find a way back home to his beloved family. Grief-stricken and fueled by vengeance, Glass treks through the wintry terrain to track down John Fitzgerald (Tom Hardy), the former confidant who betrayed and abandoned him.

Cast: Leonardo DiCaprio, Tom Hardy, Will Poulter.

Director: Alejandro González Iñárritu

Rated: R 


Opens: DECEMBER 25, 2015

Time Running: 2 hr 36 min

Genre: Action/Adventure/Suspense/Thriller

results.name: West Coast Swing Dance Lesson ( includes entry to Quiet Clubbing Party after)

results.description:
NYC native Alex D-L will call a groovy program of contras to David Sidman's Elastic Band! The Elastic Band is David Sidman on guitar and percussion, Ross Harriss on guitar and sax, and Michael Gorin on fiddle.

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York. We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common: we love to contra and English country dance! Contra dance is a high energy American folk dance accompanied by live string music and taught by a caller. No partner or experience required. All dances are taught in advance and the figures are easy to learn.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle. We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up. Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years. COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue. Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00. Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45. Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30. Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost: $15 for general public; $12 members and for full time students with ID. Be sure to tell the people at the door if this is your first time dancing with us. They will give you a free pass to return as our guest!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY Join us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!
results.name: Contra Dance with Alex Deis-Lauby and David Sidman's Elastic Band!

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our <a href="http://andthatswhyyouresingle.com/">main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
I was just up on the High Line on Thursday night (1/7) and it was quite pleasant. Saturday is supposed to be even warmer. 

Join a bunch of singles from multiple meetup groups as we casually stroll along the entire length of the High Line at night. This is usually a VERY popular event. See the photos from one of last years' walks (Yes all of those people were with my group). 

What's the High Line you ask? The High Line is an elevated rail line transformed into a public park that spans 24 blocks on Manhattan’s West Side.  

We'll meet at 7:30 PM on the corner of Ganesvoort and Washington streets under the start of the High Line and we'll get to know each other while we wait for everyone to arrive. 

The walk will start at EXACTLY 7:50 PM.  If you are late, you will miss us. Do not be late.

Afterwards we can walk to Times Square to check out the pretty lights and stuff. It will be a lot of fun for sure. 

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing under the start of the High Line and then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your Date Walk organizer. 

What to expect? Date Walks are very casual and easy-to-attend / non-awkward + the host, Beau is always there to make introductions. It’s really easy to meet people. 

Closest Subway: A, C, E and L 

Pace: The pace of this walk will be super casual.

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date.

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 


Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer

results.description:
Club 412's "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party

"Club 412" has three rooms of music, great sound, beautiful hard wood floors and a cash bar. The "Club" is known for it's friendly staff and patrons. Come out and join us and be welcomed into the "family"!

Our event will kick off at with the 8pm Pre-Party Dance Lesson in your choice of rooms: Hustle, Latin and Ballroom. Then the DJ's take over and "get our groove on" till 1am. It's really fun to roam from room to room to see what everybody's doing and enjoy the different music.

Hey you NEWBIES to dancing, come on down! The Pre-Party Class is your launch pad to an evening of FUN. It's a great opportunity to meet new people and expand your dancing skills.

For you EXPERIENCED DANCERS, there will be plenty of partners of all levels! People from Manhattan, Long Island, New Jersey and Connecticut all flock to this event. There will be over 150 people, READY TO DANCE the night away.

Club 412 is located at 412 8th Ave, at 31st St., 4th floor
(1 block South of Penn Station/MSG)
$15 Admission includes choice of free class 8-9p. Print this page & get $2 discount

*To enter building, Press 4 then 'CALL' on the intercom*
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be in the Mixed Ballroom Room dancing and greeting.

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor, on W40th between 7th & 8th ave.

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE
This is a mix of a Flash Mob, Dance Party, and City Tour all mixed into one incredible night.

With headphones on playing two channels of non-stop party music, we go underground as we hit several iconic NYC subway platforms, terminals and even bars. Unlike your normal subway ride, your Party Tour Guide/MC will not only teach you about the NYC subway system but will have you doing some crazy things to flash mob those unsuspecting passengers and onlookers .

It’s one night you’ll be like, “OMG, did we just do that!?!”

Two channels of music:
Green: Top 40’s/ Dance
Blue: 90’s / 2K / Hip-Hop

Check in Location: Playwright Irish Pub 27 West 35th Street, New York, NY 10001.
Check out: Croton Reservoir Tavern, for Our Swing Dance After-Party! (Free Entry to after-party for all Mobile Party Ticket Holders. Address: 108 West 40th Street, Manhattan, New York.
Check in time: 8:00pm – 9:00pm // Leave at: 9:00 pm
Party ends: ~11pm

Special Notes:
Age Restriction: 21+
100 Limited Tickets

What you need:
Metro Card, Valid ID, Credit Card (Just for security return of headphones)

How it works
Arrive for registration and happy hour drinks. A valid Photo ID & Credit Card will be needed for check-in. In the event you do not return the headphone, you will be charged an additional $100. With the headphones on, we’ll be traveling in the streets and subway. You can adjust the volume and choose between two master mixes with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same music as you. If you need to leave at any point, just hand your headphones into any staff member.
results.name: Underground Party – Subway Tour!

Doors open at 8:00.  Comedy begins at 9:00. We will reserve tables for our group.  FREE soft drinks and snacks, BYOB.  Don't think you have to be Jewish just because it's at a temple.  Ask anyone who came last year; we had a blast!  Buy your tickets now online for just $30.  There will be no tickets available at the door.


You must pay to RSVP.  If you don't have a PayPal account, don't worry.  You can pay thru PayPal with your regular credit card.  If you have any problems, send me an email.

results.description:
Julianne Clancy is a Senior Copy Writer for Penguin / Random House. She writes and oversees copy for the back covers of books and other promotional materials. She is also an expert on horror literature, holding a masters on the subject from Dublin College. Ms Clancy also writes and edits on the subject of food.

This is the monthly General Meeting of the Science Fiction Association of Bergen County, so the focus will be more on publishing and horror than on food.

There are pre meeting discussions on science fiction / fantasy / horror starting at 6:15 / 6:30 PM.

The Association also runs book groups, movie nights, television gatherings and other events each month. A list of activities can be found here:

https://sites.google.com/site/sfassnofbergencounty/home/discussions-and-other-activities

Hope to see you there.

Phil De Parto
results.name: Meet Book Copy Writer / Horror Expert Julianne Clancy

results.description:
COME JOIN US AT OUR RETRO NIGHT AS WE TRAVEL THRU PAST DECADES AND BACK TO THE PRESENT IN OUR VERY OWN  MUSICAL TIME MACHINE!

TREAT YOURSELF AND FRIENDS TO AN EXCITING EVENING FILLED WITH COCKTAILS, CONVERSATIONS, DINING AND DANCING AT THIS GREAT VENUE, THE NORTH STREET TAVERN.

JUST 35 MIN. FROM DANBURY AND PEEKSKILL, 30 MIN. FROM NORWALK AND 40 MIN FROM NYC.

12 0THER SINGLE GROUPS WILL BE JOINING US!

HAVE A FUN AND EXCITING EVENING WHILE MEETING SINGLES FROM ALL OVER CT & NY IN THIS WARM, COMFORTABLE SETTING.

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE SHOWS THE ATTENDEES THAT  HAVE R.S.V.P.'d. IN THIS GROUP AND A COUNT FROM ALL THE OTHER 12.

BRING A FRIEND

BRING SOMEONE YOU KNOW, A FRIEND, A NEIGHBOR, A CO-WORKER, OR GRAB AN EX RELATIONSHIP (ONE WITHOUT A RESTRAINING ORDER) AND GET DOWN TO ONE OF THE BEST SOCIAL MIXERS AROUND!

IF YOU HAVEN'T R.S.V.P.'d YET, PLEASE DO SO NOW TO KEEP AN ACCURATE COUNT!

PLEASE DRESS TO IMPRESS OR CASUALLY NEAT!

HAVE A BITE

GET THERE EARLY AND ENJOY A BITE TO EAT OFF THEIR DELICIOUS MENU

THE MUSIC

DJ/RADIO PERSONALITY MATT ZAKO WILL BE SPINNING TOP 40 AND RETRO TUNES  STARTING AROUND 9 PM. WE'LL HAVE ALL YOUR FAVORITE DANCE SONGS PLAYING SO THERE'S SOMETHING FOR EVERYONE'S MUSICAL TASTE!

PARKING

THERE'S PLENTY OF PARKING AVAILABLE IN THE BACK AND ACROSS THE STREET.

COVER CHARGE

THERE WILL BE A $5 COVER CHARGE AT THE DOOR FOR THIS EVENT REGARDLESS WHETHER YOU'RE DINING OR JUST AT THE BAR.

PLEASE PAY AS YOU ARRIVE AND EXACT CHANGE WILL BE APPRECIATED, THANK YOU.


NORTH STREET TAVERN

Welcome to the newly renovated North Street Tavern, right off of exit 25 on the Hutchinson River Parkway.

The North Street Tavern situated on the Maple Moor Golf Course has great food, a large bar, a outdoor patio and dining room, all overlooking the golf course.

The North Street Tavern serves up Westchester Counties finest brick oven pizza and exciting dishes in a unique ambiance. The authentic <a>menu</a> and friendly atmosphere creates a truly enjoyable dining experience for all.

DIRECTIONS

~From CONNECTICUT~

Get on 95 S. to 287 W. (Exit 21) then take the Hutchinson River Parkway S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

You can also get on the Merit Parkway which turns into the Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off exit 25.

From Danbury, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

~From NEW YORK~

NORTH STREET TAVERN

Welcome to the newly renovated North Street Tavern, right off of exit 25 on the Hutchinson River Parkway.

The North Street Tavern situated on the Maple Moor Golf Course has great food, a large bar, a outdoor patio and dining room, all overlooking the golf course.

The North Street Tavern serves up Westchester Counties finest brick oven pizza and exciting dishes in a unique ambiance. The authentic <a>menu</a> and friendly atmosphere creates a truly enjoyable dining experience for all.

DIRECTIONS

~From CONNECTICUT~

Get on 95 S. to 287 W. (Exit 21) then take the Hutchinson River Parkway S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

You can also get on the Merit Parkway which turns into the Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off exit 25.

From Danbury, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

~From NEW YORK~

From Points North, take 684 S. to Hutchinson River Pkwy. and get off at Exit 25, at the end of the ramp take a right and the Golf Course will be on the right.

From Tappan Zee & The Saw Mill Pkwy, take 287 E. then take the Hutchinson River Pkwy. S. (Exit 9S), get off at Exit 25 and take a right at the bottom of the ramp, the Golf Course will be on your right.

Just 35 min. from Brewster, 30 min. from Norwalk, 35 min. from Peekskill, and 40 min. form NYC.

Bar on premises (affordable drinks)

results.name: Dance Social this Saturday!

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Beautiful Turf Field - Friendly but competitive game. 

RSVP's open 6 Days before the Meetup at 8:00pm - Trying something new.


Main goal is the have fun, play hard, and have a good time. 

Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side; rotating new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Games will be 40-45 minute halves; switching sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $4.00 for the night - Payment will be taken at Half-Time. Please have cash available to pay. If you do not have cash, please go to the ATM prior the game. All players will receive a 1-time exception.
results.how_to_find_us: Park is right off of Kent Ave + N 10th St. - (L) Bedford Ave, or (G) Nassau Ave

The Copa is located in the heart of the fast-growing village of Port Chester.

So expect a lively mix of members from

Westchester, Putnam and Western CT including  Greenwich and Stamford.

There is Free Parking behind the Copa at the Abendroth Ave municipal parking lot. And you can enter the Copa from the Abendroth Ave entrance.


ALL ARE WELCOME, FEEL FREE TO INVITE FRIENDS!


And as always, please take care of the wait staff, thanks.

Looking forward to seeing everyone!

venue.name: Ethical Brew at The Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County

results.description:
Ethical Brew is proud to present Live In Concert:
Hannah & Maggie / Rob Lytle

A portion of this performance will be donated Young Women's Leadership Network (YWLN)

For More Information & Tickets: www.ethicalbrew.org

Tickets $20 Adults $15 Students in advance $25 at the door.

Two great folk acts on one great bill! Bright-eyed young stars on the folks scene, HANNAH & MAGGIE will take your breath away with their astounding harmonies reminiscent of Simon & Garfunkel with a dash of the Indigo Girls thrown in to create their own distinctive sound. ROB LYTLE's original Americana folk-pop tunes infused with both humor and pathos reflecting the human condition, are bound to strike a chord with anyone fortunate enough to be listening.

Hannah & Maggie


Bolstered by a rapidly growing fan base, the folk-pop-harmony driven duo, Hannah & Maggie have set out to make their distinctive mark on the northeast regional folk scene. While this award-winning pair consisting of Hannah Hickock and Maggie Kraus, has been favorably described as a female Simon & Garfunkel as well as likened to The Indigo Girls, they have an undeniable originality and sound all their own.
With two studio albums and a few barnstorming national tours under their belt, Hannah & Maggie show no signs of stopping. Last year, they released their third CD, In The Company of Strangers, were one of the "100 Women We Love" in GO Magazine, performed/interviewed live on WFUV-FM with John Platt, sang with Ben Taylor (Son of James Taylor & Carly Simon), and wrote some new tunes coming out in the near future. Their live shows are toe-tapping, knee-slapping spectacles of crystal-clear harmonies and heartfelt acoustic arrangements that leave you wanting more.

https://youtu.be/DMGhwtrAOTs


Here's the buzz on Hannah & Maggie ...

"An ethereal blend of two voices ... so exquisite, it's almost unbearable."
-- Richard Cuccaro, Acoustic Live NYC

"Hannah & Maggie produce acoustic songs embellished with the occasional mandolin, clarinet and trumpet, marked by sweet, effortless sounding harmonies."
-- Mary Dickie, IN Toronto Magazine

"They have definitely honed their voices to showcase the perfect harmonization .. you instantly notice how well their voices mesh together."
-- JP's Music Blog

Hannah and Maggie have a sound both familiar and inviting, with voices that harmonize together perfectly ... the duo has developed a sound of flowing and intertwined instrumental lines, sharp lyrics and beautiful harmonies that stay true to their folk roots."
-- Jessica Liley, Curve Magazine

For more about Hannah & Maggie: www.hannahandmaggie.com


ROB LYTLE



About Rob Lytle

After a nearly 14 year break from performing, the past four years have been a whirlwind musical rebirth for Rob with a busy touring schedule, an appearance as a finalist in the prestigious Kerrville Folk Festival "New Folk" competition, multiple juried showcase appearances at the Northeast, Southeast, and Southwest Folk Alliance Conferences, and the upcoming global release of his new CD (a hypocrite of heart and hope). His 2011 CD -- You. Must. Stop. -- reached the top 25 for folk and roots radio in both Europe and the US and was praised by Maverick magazine as "one of those all-too-rare albums where every track is a standout.".

https://youtu.be/tMaUzO3AJg8


Folks are talking about Rob:

"Rob's voice is strongly reminiscent of Johnathan Edwards and so is the music... beautiful songs, beautiful melodies, somewhere between folk. country and pop"
-- Fred Schmale, Real Roots Cafe

"If you are a fan of classic country music, then Rob Lytle is your man. Country. Americana-Folk with pop and 70s California rock influences, often compared to Jackson Browne, Don Maclean and Steve Goodman, but with muh more twang than those mentioned above."
-- Mr. Blue Boogie

"(Rob Lytle) has once again become a staple of Northeast cafes and clubs ... mood and meaning play out over finely crafted doses of American roots"
-- The Alternate Root
For more about Rob: www.roblytle.com
results.name: Ethical Brew presents Live in Concert: Hannah & Maggie / Rob Lytle

group.name: The Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County

results.description:
ALL LEVELS ARE WELCOME

(If you are a beginner and wish to join the party, please come for a brief rating session before joining the party.  This is a social tennis group, rather than an instructional session.)

Also check out my website:  www.tennis-buffs.com

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time. I would like to stagger players. You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left. Thank you for your understanding.

Saturdays, starts 8pm

Cost $40

Includes tennis, balls and food

9 Indoor air-conditioned hard courts

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends! Binghamton Racquet Club is centrally located for tennis players in the Tri-State area, only 5 minutes from the GWB, a good location for players from Rockland County, NYC, Westchester, Hoboken, Jersey City and other areas in NJ.

It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator
www.tennis-buffs.com
[masked]

results.name: Saturday Tennis Social at Binghamton Racquet Club

venue.name: Ethical Brew at The Ethical Culture Society of Bergen County

results.description:
Ethical Brew is proud to present Live In Concert:
Hannah & Maggie / Rob Lytle

A portion of this performance will be donated ""

For More Information & Tickets: www.ethicalbrew.org

 Two great folk acts on one great bill! Bright-eyed young stars on the folks scene, HANNAH & MAGGIE will take your breath away with their astounding harmonies reminiscent of Simon & Garfunkel with a dash of the Indigo Girls thrown in to create their own distinctive sound. ROB LYTLE's original Americana folk-pop tunes infused with both humor and pathos reflecting the human condition, are bound to strike a chord with anyone fortunate enough to be listening. 

Hannah & Maggie

Bolstered by a rapidly growing fan base, the folk-pop-harmony driven duo, Hannah & Maggie have set out to make their distinctive mark on the northeast regional folk scene. While this award-winning pair consisting of Hannah Hickock and Maggie Kraus, has been favorably described as a female Simon & Garfunkel as well as likened to The Indigo Girls, they have an undeniable originality and sound all their own.
With two studio albums and a few barnstorming national tours under their belt, Hannah & Maggie show no signs of stopping. Last year, they released their third CD, In The Company of Strangers, were one of the "100 Women We Love" in GO Magazine, performed/interviewed live on WFUV-FM with John Platt, sang with Ben Taylor (Son of James Taylor & Carly Simon), and wrote some new tunes coming out in the near future. Their live shows are toe-tapping, knee-slapping spectacles of crystal-clear harmonies and heartfelt acoustic arrangements that leave you wanting more.

https://youtu.be/DMGhwtrAOTs

Here's the buzz on Hannah & Maggie ...

"An ethereal blend of two voices ... so exquisite, it's almost unbearable."
-- Richard Cuccaro, Acoustic Live NYC

"Hannah & Maggie produce acoustic songs embellished with the occasional mandolin, clarinet and trumpet, marked by sweet, effortless sounding harmonies."
-- Mary Dickie, IN Toronto Magazine

"They have definitely honed their voices to showcase the perfect harmonization .. you instantly notice how well their voices mesh together."
-- JP's Music Blog

Hannah and Maggie have a sound both familiar and inviting, with voices that harmonize together perfectly ... the duo has developed a sound of flowing and intertwined instrumental lines, sharp lyrics and beautiful harmonies that stay true to their folk roots."
-- Jessica Liley, Curve Magazine

For more about Hannah & Maggie: www.hannahandmaggie.com 

Rob Lytle

About Rob Lytle

After a nearly 14 year break from performing, the past four years have been a whirlwind musical rebirth for Rob with a busy touring schedule, an appearance as a finalist in the prestigious Kerrville Folk Festival "New Folk" competition, multiple juried showcase appearances at the Northeast, Southeast, and Southwest Folk Alliance Conferences, and the upcoming global release of his new CD (a hypocrite of heart and hope). His 2011 CD -- You. Must. Stop. -- reached the top 25 for folk and roots radio in both Europe and the US and was praised by Maverick magazine as "one of those all-too-rare albums where every track is a standout.".

https://youtu.be/tMaUzO3AJg8

Folks are talking about Rob:

"Rob's voice is strongly reminiscent of Johnathan Edwards and so is the music... beautiful songs, beautiful melodies, somewhere between folk. country and pop"
-- Fred Schmale, Real Roots Cafe

"If you are a fan of classic country music, then Rob Lytle is your man. Country. Americana-Folk with pop and 70s California rock influences, often compared to Jackson Browne, Don Maclean and Steve Goodman, but with muh more twang than those mentioned above."
-- Mr. Blue Boogie

"(Rob Lytle) has once again become a staple of Northeast cafes and clubs ... mood and meaning play out over finely crafted doses of American roots"
-- The Alternate Root
For more about Rob: www.roblytle.com
results.name: Ethical Brew presents Live in Concert: Hannah & Maggie / Rob Lytle

group.name: Ethical Brew Concert Series in Teaneck NJ Meetup

results.description:
We're starting the year off with our most popular Meetup! And for this one, we're taking you back... way back to the 90s, 80s, and beyond!!


These parties have been written up in the NY Post, Daily News & featured on TV. If you've been to this Meetup before, then you already know how much fun it is. If not, come see what you've been missing!  


Tickets are just $10 for 1st 10 members w/ discount code "quiet" - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/quiet15/dates/Jan-09-2016_at_0900PM

How does it work?

You'll get a special wireless headset that will allow you to tune into one of 3 DJ's spinning at the same time.

DJ 1 – 80s Pop, 90s Hip Hop/Dance
DJ 2 – 70s Disco/Funk, 60s Motown
DJ 3 – Swing & Big Band 

What's included?

• $5 Shots, $6 Wines all night long 

• $4 Beer Specials until 11pm 

• 3 DJs spinning a mix of different music

• 2 bars & 2 floors of dance music

• 1 Quiet Events Headset Rental to party

• FREE Prizes & Giveaways for everybody

• FREE Shot for all this month's Birthdays

Are there Ice Breakers?

Everyone will receive half a playing card at the door 
Find other half & bring it to the bar for a FREE shot

How do we mingle?

It’s super social!  Just lower the volume or take the headphones off.  No loud music to talk over.

What does it cost?

First 10 tix are $10 w/ discount code "quiet"at this link - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/quiet15/dates/Jan-09-2016_at_0900PM

$15 after that online , $20 at the door w/ RSVP, $25 w/o


Check out this video from a recent party - 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HmFLSpLOXvo

Is this event private?

The entire venue will be 100% private for our party.  Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code or age restriction?

No sweats, hats, etc  Jeans ok.  Dress stylish. This event is not age or ethnic specific.

Can I come alone?

Most come on their own.  If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet other members.  So come alone or bring a friend or two - either way you will feel comfortable and have a great time.

Why does your RSVP say +99? 

This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  200+ members will be attending - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/quiet15/dates/Jan-09-2016_at_0900PM
results.how_to_find_us: Private event for Meetup members & their guests

results.name: Quiet Clubbing Old School Party! $4 Drinks, 3 DJs, 2 floors, 1 fun night!

results.description:
We're starting the year off with our most popular Meetup! And for this one, we're taking you back... way back to the 90s, 80s, and beyond!! 

These parties have been written up in the NY Post, Daily News & featured on TV. If you've been to this Meetup before, then you already know how much fun it is. If not, come see what you've been missing!  

Tickets are just $10 for 1st 10 members w/ discount code "quiet" - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/quiet15/dates/Jan-09-2016_at_0900PM

How does it work?

You'll get a special wireless headset that will allow you to tune into one of 3 DJ's spinning at the same time.

DJ 1 – 80s Pop, 90s Hip Hop/Dance 
DJ 2 – 70s Disco/Funk, 60s Motown 
DJ 3 – Swing & Big Band 

What's included?

• $5 Shots, $6 Wines all night long 

• $4 Beer Specials until 11pm 

• 3 DJs spinning a mix of different music

• 2 bars & 2 floors of dance music

• 1 Quiet Events Headset Rental to party

• FREE Prizes & Giveaways for everybody

• FREE Shot for all this month's Birthdays

Are there Ice Breakers?

Everyone will receive half a playing card at the door 
Find other half & bring it to the bar for a FREE shot

How do we mingle?

It’s super social!  Just lower the volume or take the headphones off.  No loud music to talk over.

What does it cost?

First 10 tix are $10 w/ discount code "quiet"at this link - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/quiet15/dates/Jan-09-2016_at_0900PM

$15 after that online , $20 at the door w/ RSVP, $25 w/o 

Check out this video from a recent party - 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HmFLSpLOXvo

Is this event private?

The entire venue will be 100% private for our party.  Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code or age restriction?

No sweats, hats, etc  Jeans ok.  Dress stylish. This event is not age or ethnic specific.

Can I come alone?

Most come on their own.  If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet other members.  So come alone or bring a friend or two - either way you will feel comfortable and have a great time.

Why does your RSVP say +99? 

This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  200+ members will be attending - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/quiet15/dates/Jan-09-2016_at_0900PM

results.description:
We're starting the year off with our most popular Meetup! And for this one, we're taking you back... way back to the 90s, 80s, and beyond!! 

These parties have been written up in the NY Post, Daily News & featured on TV. If you've been to this Meetup before, then you already know how much fun it is. If not, come see what you've been missing!  

Tickets are just $10 for 1st 10 members w/ discount code "quiet" - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/quiet15/dates/Jan-09-2016_at_0900PM

How does it work?

You'll get a special wireless headset that will allow you to tune into one of 3 DJ's spinning at the same time.

DJ 1 – 80s Pop, 90s Hip Hop/Dance 
DJ 2 – 70s Disco/Funk, 60s Motown 
DJ 3 – Swing & Big Band 

What's included?

• $5 Shots, $6 Wines all night long 

• $4 Beer Specials until 11pm 

• 3 DJs spinning a mix of different music

• 2 bars & 2 floors of dance music

• 1 Quiet Events Headset Rental to party

• FREE Prizes & Giveaways for everybody

• FREE Shot for all this month's Birthdays

Are there Ice Breakers?

Everyone will receive half a playing card at the door 
Find other half & bring it to the bar for a FREE shot

How do we mingle?

It’s super social!  Just lower the volume or take the headphones off.  No loud music to talk over.

What does it cost?

First 10 tix are $10 w/ discount code "quiet"at this link - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/quiet15/dates/Jan-09-2016_at_0900PM

$15 after that online , $20 at the door w/ RSVP, $25 w/o 

Check out this video from a recent party - 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HmFLSpLOXvo

Is this event private?

The entire venue will be 100% private for our party.  Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code or age restriction?

No sweats, hats, etc  Jeans ok.  Dress stylish. This event is not age or ethnic specific.

Can I come alone?

Most come on their own.  If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet other members.  So come alone or bring a friend or two - either way you will feel comfortable and have a great time.

Why does your RSVP say +99? 

This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  200+ members will be attending - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/quiet15/dates/Jan-09-2016_at_0900PM

results.name: Quiet Clubbing Old School Party! $4 Drinks, 3 DJs, 2 floors, 1 fun night!

results.description:
Directed by: James Crump

In the 1960s and ’70s, a group of NYC-based artists abandoned the constraints of gallery spaces and the demands of the marketplace, moving to the expanse of the American Southwest to engage in a radical reconceptualization of their artistic practice. Turning to nature, acclaimed artists like Michael Heizer (Double Negative) and Robert Smithson (Spiral Jetty) challenged accepted notions of scale and exhibition by producing monumental creations out of the earth itself. TROUBLEMAKERS reveals their breathtaking work and their fascinating process. Official selection: New York Film Festival, DOC NYC
NR, 72 Minutes
USA
results.name: Troublemakers: The Story Of Land Art

group.name: New York Every Night (and Day) Social Events and Adventures

venue.name: Jalopy Theatre and School of Music

results.description:
SQUARE & BIG CIRCLE SQUARE DANCES
LIVE CALLER & LIVE BAND

Dave Harvey, caller
with
Wild Hog Plus (Aaron Lewis, Lindsay McCaw, Max Johnson & Tom Bailey)

You'll dance squares from the southern mountains to red-hot, lightning-fast fiddle tunes.  Come join the party as you "roll the barrel", "rip 'n' snort" and "ride the waves" all night long.  This is a public event, so Meetup members join the larger throng.  We get 50-90 dancers at each event.  

The Fabulous Jalopy Theater has become the center for traditional music and dance in the city, and those loyal to our event and to the space return time after time to join us for dancing.  However, all dances are taught just before you dance them, so no experience is necessary.  The crowd is exceptionally friendly and ready to welcome any newcomers, so there's no need to bring a partner - anyone and everyone can find one there.  Jalopy is a music venue, so they have a full bar, and next door the Jalopy Tavern offers a full menu for those who want to show up early for dinner, and you can grab at drink with us if you hang around after.

Instruction for the dance isn't necessary, but if you are a beginner, want to refine your step, or want to add some flair to your dancing, show up early - at 8:30 - and learn all you'll need to know...and then some.  But this isn't a dance class, it's a DANCE PARTY!  You can show up at any time and join in.

8:30 - 9:00 PM:             INSTRUCTION
9:00 PM - Midnight:    SQUARE DANCE

More info on the following websites: NYCBarnDance.com and Jalopy.biz

$15 door / $13 (+2 service fee)

We have sold out shows on many occasions, so purchase  
ADVANCE TICKETS!  They will be available soon at Jalopy.biz.


JALOPY in RED HOOK 
315 Columbia St. 
Btwn. Hamilton & Woodhull 
G/F to Carroll St. 
Walk west to Columbia St.

results.description:
We're starting the year off with our most popular Meetup! And for this one, we're taking you back... way back to the 90s, 80s, and beyond!! 

These parties have been written up in the NY Post, Daily News & featured on TV. If you've been to this Meetup before, then you already know how much fun it is. If not, come see what you've been missing!  

Tickets are just $10 for 1st 10 members w/ discount code "quiet" - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/quiet15/dates/Jan-09-2016_at_0900PM

How does it work?

You'll get a special wireless headset that will allow you to tune into one of 3 DJ's spinning at the same time.

DJ 1 – 80s Pop, 90s Hip Hop/Dance 
DJ 2 – 70s Disco/Funk, 60s Motown 
DJ 3 – Swing & Big Band 

What's included?

• $5 Shots, $6 Wines all night long 

• $4 Beer Specials until 11pm 

• 3 DJs spinning a mix of different music

• 2 bars & 2 floors of dance music

• 1 Quiet Events Headset Rental to party

• FREE Prizes & Giveaways for everybody

• FREE Shot for all this month's Birthdays

Are there Ice Breakers?

Everyone will receive half a playing card at the door 
Find other half & bring it to the bar for a FREE shot

How do we mingle?

It’s super social!  Just lower the volume or take the headphones off.  No loud music to talk over.

What does it cost?

First 10 tix are $10 w/ discount code "quiet"at this link - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/quiet15/dates/Jan-09-2016_at_0900PM

$15 after that online , $20 at the door w/ RSVP, $25 w/o 

Check out this video from a recent party - 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HmFLSpLOXvo

Is this event private?

The entire venue will be 100% private for our party.  Members can invite guests to join us.

Is there a dress code or age restriction?

No sweats, hats, etc  Jeans ok.  Dress stylish. This event is not age or ethnic specific.

Can I come alone?

Most come on their own.  If you don't know anyone, the ice breakers will help you meet other members.  So come alone or bring a friend or two - either way you will feel comfortable and have a great time.

results.name: Quiet Clubbing Old School Party! $4 Drinks, 3 DJs, 2 floors, 1 fun night!

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE


We're heading back to Croton for another big bash, that will have everyone ready to dance! This party is serving as the after-party meet up spot, for our subway party earlier in the day, meaning these two parties will become one, to really rock the night!  Come out, dress up, and get ready to boogy down to that Quiet Sound.

3 DJs Spinning Live:
Green DJ: 60s Motown and 70s Funk and Disco
Red DJ: Electro-Swing and Top 40
Blue DJ: 80s and 90s

What the night includes:
Quiet Events Headphones
Glow in the Dark Gear
3 Live DJs battling for your attention

Special Notes:
This party is indoors
Age Restriction: 21+
All Tickets Are Limited, So Get Them ASAP!

HOW IT WORKS

***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJs with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.
results.name: Quiet Clubbing Bash @ Croton!

group.name: !Quiet Events - Silent Disco - Quiet Clubbing and more Group

results.description:
Best dang comedy show in the city, baby. 

Come to Chelsea in Manhattan, hang out, have some brews, and enjoy a hilarious show (with pizza after, hey-o!)

There's no door charge and you don't have to buy a drink. Meet new people, or bring your own pals, it's a great time from start to finish. 

Here's what people are saying about standup.NYC:

"I was blown away at the talent." 

"Great time and solid pizza, but be sure to ask for it at the end of the show, Dan and Danny will hook you up." 

"Laid back vibe, perfect for seeing some funny people, hanging out with friends, and only spending as much money as you want to drink"
results.name: Hang out, Watch Comedy, Eat Pizza (All Free)

group.name: Free comedy, pizza, and hanging out in Chelsea, Manhattan

results.name: Jan 9th - Bhangra In The City @ Providence NYC - Featuring Open Bar & No Cover

results.description:
Bring in the New Year with a heavy dose of socially conscious art! We're going back to Brooklyn for a night of POETRY, HIP HOP, and FREESTYLE SPOKEN WORD at BRIC. The genre has seen transformation since it's heyday in the late 90s and early 2000s. Experience it's current iteration that tackles key social issues from police brutality, sexual and racial identity, and equality.  

FREE 

(Except for the overpriced alcohol and coffee drinks. Win some, lose some) 

If you're looking to perform get there early to sign up. 


Use the hashtag #openmicbric when recording on Versey.  


We still have to confirm if you can video record the event. Bring your equipment with the understanding you may not be able to record until further notice.  


With this open mic starting at 9:30pm on a Saturday it's. Going. To. Be. Lit. Best believe we're going to after party it up in one of the nearby lounges in the Fort-Greene area. Come with! 


For more info:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/spoken-word-open-mic-tickets-20066781283
results.name: Spoken Word Open Mic

When you get there say you are on "MIKE K" guest list to get in. All Ladies are FREE on Mike K list and gentleman are reduced ($20)!

Text Mike at[masked] if you have any questions. Text me at[masked] for free drinks at my table all night.

results.description:
Iron Monkey comes to the Nitehawk as part of January's LEGENDS OF 90's KUNG FU series!

Here's the breakdown:

In a desperate and unjust land, where government corruption rules the day, only one man has the courage to challenge the system and fight back. They call him “Iron Monkey.” Under the shadow of night, in the silence before dawn, he fights to give hope to the poor and the oppressed. Although no one knows his name and no one knows where he comes from, his heroism has made him a living legend to the people and a wanted man to the powers that be. 


Starring: Rongguang Yu, Donnie Yen, Jean Wang, Sze-Man Tsang, Shun-Yee Yuen, James Wong 


We'll meet upstairs around 11:45pm. The film starts at midnite (12:15 am)and will be presented in 35mm! 

For more info & to buy tix visit:

http://www.nitehawkcinema.com/movie/iron-monkey/


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UVLYge4JiG4

results.description:
Docks- Boozy Brunch and Jazz Band
Sunday, January 10th
633 3rd Avenue @ 40th Street
11:30 meet at the bar, 12:15-2:15pm seating
$50-Entrée, Unlimited Coffee, Juice, tax & tip
Unlimited Blood Mary’s/ Mimosas at the table Please go to our website to pay in advance for this event. All of our events are prepaid and we average 20-30 people per event. I guarantee headcount and pay in advance so there are no surprises to the restaurant. RSVP on here is nice, but it is not a guarantee of your reservation. You must prepay through the link below or contact me to be assured to have a seat.

http://www.thesinglegourmet.net/event/docks-brunch

Our first event in 2016 after a long vacation to Spain should involve a lot of jazz, a great atmosphere, a great menu and a lot of drinks, so when I heard that Docks, would offer us a jazz brunch with unlimited mimosas and Bloody Mary’s, I booked it. Choose an entrée such as eggs benedict with Canadian bacon, Irish smoked salmon, Dock’s crab cake benedict, asparagus & mushroom omelet, New England omelet with Maine jumbo lump crab meat, banana foster French toast, Maine lobster hash bowl, Scottish smoked salmon platter and other brunch items. We had 42 dine here on July 4th to a spectacular dinner event so let’s return to what one member calls, “a fantastic jazz brunch.” Zagat rated for their “reliable fish, professional servers and a high-octane social scene.” Please note: the only drinks included in this meal and that are unlimited at the table, include coffee, juices, mimosas and Bloody Mary’s! All other drinks are pay as you go, (i.e. wine, beer, soft drinks, cocktails are not included). Let’s kick off 2016 on a fun note!

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

group.name: NYC PICKUP SOCCER (MANHATTAN CO-ED SOCCER GROUP)

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.
