results.description:
Pool session and course review for next Sunday's cert dives.

Print and bring your completed Academics.

SDI DRY SUIT DIVER

The SDI Dry Suit Diver Course will open up a whole new world of diving to you. Many of the diving environments around the world are better experienced in a dry suit. Why? These areas have an abundance of marine life waiting to be seen and photographed – they just happen to be a little colder! Dry suits are also used in tropical water during the cooler months.This course allows the student to develop the knowledge and skills to properly use a dry suit. It will discuss the types of dry suits, accessories, maintenance and how to make basic repairs.

SDI Dry Suit Diver minimum requirements:

Satisfactorily complete the SDI Dry Suit Diver Knowledge Quests.

Complete all open water requirements efficiently

Demonstrate mature and sound judgment concerning dive planning and execution

Course Cost: $229

 Includes: eLearning materials and use of drysuit

How to take this course:

• Pre-registration required. Sign up here and Now or at the Dive Center.

• Complete the dry suit online with: eLearning 


• Then we dive: Open Water Execution 

1. Two dives are required with complete briefs and debriefs by the instructor 

2. Dive plan must include surface interval, maximum no-decompression time, etc. to be figured out and logged 

Required Equipment:

1. Basic open water scuba equipment. 

2. Dry suit with inflator hose, included 


FORMS

If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store. Print out and complete 

theSDI General Liability Waiver 

the SDI Medical Info Waiver* and 

the Student Information forms, which must be reviewed by the instructor before you can begin the pool sessions. 

* If you have answered YES to any of the medical questions; Please print out and have your MD complete the following Physician Sign-Off Form
results.name: Drysuit Class starts

results.description:
RSVP required


What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must:
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

6. If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store. 
</a>Please print out, complete and bring the following three forms to the pool;

<a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/sdi_forms_03_general_liability_release.pdf">SDI General Liability Waiver Fill in ALL the blanks the  "Instructors": F. Ventura & C.K. Scharf, the "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA",  the  Agency is" SDI" and Others": (fill in at pool), then, Sign and date at bottom

SDI Medical Info Waiver "Instructor": F. Ventura,  "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA ,"City of" Paramus "state of" N.J.

Student Information Form</a>

If you have answered YES to any of the medical question; Please print out and have your MD complete the following <a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/SDI_Physician_Sign_Off_2013.pdf">Physician Sign-Off Form

Why it's a good idea for Divers to own their own SCUBA gear?

RSVP Now

Please RSVP for all pool sessions. RSVPs are required so that we have sufficient staffing for each session. Students who do not RSVP may not get on the roster.No shows are subject to a $29 rescheduling fee.

results.name: SCUBA Lessons at the Pool

results.description:
Drysuit Madness continues.

You get to experience the comfort of drysuit diving in a fun and informative setting with our Dive Professionals. Come prepared with your SCUBA certification card, swimsuit or light clothing beneath the undergarment (No Denim). Bring your regular dive equipment (regulator, BCD, mask, snorkel, open heel fins, weights (plus a little extra), cylinder) and a small towel, or for just $10 use ours. After you go through a short briefing, we'll fit you with everything you need to dive dry, warm and comfortable. You'll go in the water with a dive leader (no need to be drysuit certified) who will show you the basics on how to use a drysuit. Isn't it funny how hungry we are at the end of a dive. We'll have snacks for every diver.

$10 If you need rental gear Pay Now!


$5 for Air Cylinder Pay Now

Premium members FREE

Become A Premium Member

No other entrance fees

We're making Diving dry Affordable

results.name: Test Dive a Drysuit at the Pool

results.description:
Book to discuss:  Open House by Elizabeth Berg. (Oprah Book Club selection)

You can easily find its E-book and Audio book versions in New York Public Library. 

descriptions from Amazon.com:

"Samantha's husband has left her, and after a spree of overcharging at Tiffany's, she settles down to reconstruct a life for herself and her eleven-year-old son. Her eccentric mother tries to help by fixing her up with dates, but a more pressing problem is money. To meet her mortgage payments, Sam decides to take in boarders. The first is an older woman who offers sage advice and sorely needed comfort; the second, a maladjusted student, is not quite so helpful. A new friend, King, an untraditional man, suggests that Samantha get out, get going, get work. But her real work is this: In order to emerge from grief and the past, she has to learn how to make her own happiness. In order to really see people, she has to look within her heart. And in order to know who she is, she has to remember—and reclaim—the person she used to be, long before she became someone else in an effort to save her marriage. 

Open House is a love story about what can blossom between a man and a woman, and within a woman herself."
results.name: Club Meeting 3

results.description:
Please read this message fully. This week's game is scheduled for 8:30AM however the forecast says it will rain until 2PM tomorrow. I will post a message in the message board by 7:00AM to advise if the 8:30AM start time will proceed as planned or delayed to the start time of 1 or 2PM. So you will need to the messages at 7AM or noon! If it continues raining into the afternoon then we will cancel. If you plan on playing the morning and it gets delayed but you can't make the afternoon time then update your RSVP! If everyone updates accordingly then we will know if we have enough people for an afternoon game.

We're playing at our normal home address, namely the soccer field at Dyker for the foreseeable future. The artificial field should have good traction if it's wet and is easier to run in during snow and ice. All you need is a pair of cleats, gloves, and a change of socks if it's wet or snowing.

Come join us for some fun but please SHOW UP ON TIME!! If you show up after we started a game then you will sit out the whole first game and there's no guarantee we play 3 games in total like in the old days. I guess we're not spring chickens anymore.

***************

 
Attendance will be strictly enforced. No-shows will be marked and posted on the subsequent meetup. First time offenders will be given the benefit of doubt, second time offenders will be warned (consider your name in this email and the number of times you no-showed as warning) and those who miss a third time will be banned,permanently! Those that show up without RSVP to circumvent this will be warned as well. We need to know how many people will show up in order to decide if we have enough people for a game that week.

All new members are allowed to play for free the first three games. If you decide to continue with us then please remit the membership fee. Our season starts on 9/1 and the $10 is good for all games for the year

results.description:
For summer we have a single 10:00 am Sunday contemporary worship service popular with young families Children are welcome.  Free temporary parking passes available from any usher.


The Church-in-the-Gardens is an exciting, stimulating, and challenging place to grow your faith. We invite “seekers” new to exploring faithful living, dedicated followers of Christ, people filled with a new enthusiasm and a desire to serve and grow, people who’ve “fallen away” from “organized religion” but are giving it a second look, and everyone else in-between, to join us! We need, and welcome, everyone’s gift. There is a place for you in our fellowship. A spirit of inclusion, and sharing, abound in our congregation.

results.description:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

results.description:
Did you forget to sing? Perhaps after Third Grade, when the peer pressure set in. Perhaps someone picked out the "Gifted and Talented" - and it wasn't you. Or maybe the Nuns made you sing "God Bless America" and someone laughed. Or you were one of the "Blue Birds" - you moved your mouth but didn't make any sound. Or did you sing beautifully in that Elementary School play? Was it the Middle School chorus, where the boys were thrown out and it ended up a Girls Club that made a sound in three parts, so beautiful nothing to this day has extinguished that feeling? Perhaps you were one of the guys who made harmony in the reverb of the Boys Room, or in the audience at the concert, or the sports stadium, or in the shower?

Or maybe you played an instrument that kept your mouth busy, and you never did get the chance to sing? Was it the race of competition for excellence in something, something else, that left you no time?

Was is the implicit warning, between the lines of the praises of privilege, that you should not express yourself? Did you forget that feeling of camaraderie and being a part of something bigger than yourself? Did you forget that amazement you felt at yourself being able to memorize a large piece and give it your all - weeks and months of practice that lead to a performance, or several, that made you feel powerful, hopeful, inspired and you had drawn upon that experience to guide your life? You had that moment, lifted by the magic of the "ordered progression though time and space," that made life so rich, so romantic, so filled with spirit.

And then did you forget?

Forget that feeling, that high, that experience of joy and sadness, playing the part, being a messenger, a vessel. You forgot that there are scientific studies praising the participation in music and art, the health benefits, the raised white blood cell count, the relaxation response, the breathing, the healing power of sound, or just the old saying, "singing is good for you."

Now you have another chance.

Don't miss it.
results.name: Did You Forget to Sing?

venue.name: New York Zen Center for Contemplative Care

results.description:
The heart of our work at New York Zen Center for Contemplative Care is based on the practice of meditation, contemplation, and Zen precepts. To care for the world, we care for ourselves. In caring for ourselves, we care for the whole world.

Meditation has been clinically proven to benefit one’s health and well-being. This often is the initial motivation to begin practice. The promise of a continuous meditation practice is freedom from suffering caused by the many layers of conditioning we foster, in our attempt to maintain a fixed sense of self. The practice of meditation allows us to experience the ease and joy of being: we are fresh and new in each moment.

Meditation is a practice that we do everyday; we gather together as community in support of one another. Our community is made up of Jewish, Catholic, Episcopal, Tibetan and Zen Buddhists and those who don’t identify with any particular tradition.

All are welcome, from those curious about meditation to those who have been meditating for decades. Chairs and cushions are available.
results.name: Let's meet up for Zazen and a Dharma talk!

results.description:
Please register here:  https://workshopbrainstorm.eventbrite.com

Do you have something you'd like to share? Would you like to lead a workshop? Come to this free session to cook up ideas for workshops! What could you offer? What workshops would you like STEMteachersNYC to offer for you?


For both experienced and new leaders, leading workshops is a powerful form of professional development that benefits the leader as well as the participants. Join us for writing and discussion as you work out workshop details while getting feedback and coaching from others. We are building a library of past and potential workshops to enhance our ability to provide dynamic workshop offerings that meet the diverse needs and interests of our members. PIZZA FOR ALL AT 1:00 PM.

We invite you to participate in this workshop for many reasons:

· It’s always more fun to work in the company of others, and common interests lead to collaboration and co-leadership.

· The proposed workshops will form the backbone of our upcoming workshop schedule.

· Workshop quality is improved with the ideas and input from others.

· We’re all busy teachers, and this workshop provides a time to develop and refine a workshop description, a workshop agenda, and supporting materials.

Think about what works well in your classroom that you could share with others. To get you thinking, here are some workshop examples:

· Pedagogical approaches to specific science content (chemical bonding, Newton’s third law, accelerated motion . . .)

· General pedagogical approaches (Standards based grading, using whiteboards, developing student metacognitive skills, Using video analysis, tools for a flipped classroom . . .)

· Make-and-take workshops featuring low-cost materials (A kit for teaching color and light, inertial mass balance, accelerated motion apparatus, electric circuit kits, low cost circular motion apparatus . . .)

· Use of a particular tool or technology (Data analysis with Logger Pro, the Arduino interface, MakeSense! sensors, programming in vPython, 3D printing. . .)

Most of our workshops are immersive – leaders invite participants to work thorough materials, activities, or techniques as students would – other workshop formats might involve field trips, panel discussions, show-and-tell sessions, or whatever you might imagine!

Please register here:  https://workshopbrainstorm.eventbrite.com

Platform with Gonzalo Cruz, Executive Director of Don Bosco Workers, Inc.,  who will describe the work of this organization including its mission, history, needs and goals.

Don Bosco Workers, Inc., located in Port Chester, NY, is  a formidable voice in the advocacy for workers rights, in particular the cause to end the exploitation of Latino immigrant workers.  Their centralized hiring site provides an organized process for matching worker skills to employer needs and replaced the informal and hazardous outdoor hiring corners in Port Chester.  It has hosted nearly 800 workers since 2006, and has a current active member ship of 150 men and women. In addition, it negotiates wage contracts and provides wage recovery services and advocacy for victims of wage fraud.  Gonzalo is himself a Mexican immigrant and a former undocumented day laborer.

Regular Ethical Education for Children classes today.
results.name: The Challenges of Day Laborers

results.description:
Uncover the power of a quieter mind and ensure the renewal of a healthier you through movement, breath, and meditation. I welcome each student to come escape the bustle of the city to experience above and find their inner guru in my  class!

WELCOME 2016! 

As we welcome 2016, let's plant the seed and watch it grow together!  While the air is (finally) crisping and the wind is whispering coming of the snowy tides, it's a perfect opportunity to recuperate, hibernate, and seek introspection.  Come slow and quiet down with us in a weekly cozy practice to balance the Vata (movement/air) dosha and learn how you can best take care of yourself in order to blossom in the Spring...  


Since March 2013, this donation based Meet Up group has aimed to provide a light-hearted and non-competitive space.  One can expect clear instructions, demonstration, gentle hands-on assistance, and achieve greater flexibility, strength, balance, focus, and sense of ease with regular attendance.  

Extra mats and blocks are limited, kindly bring yours if you have them.


*To offset Meetup Organizer's fees, a suggested donation between $7-10 will be greatly appreciated*

Thank you and please do post any questions.  I hope to see you soon! 

Jennifer ( 500 Hour Yoga Alliance Registered  Teacher)

results.description:
*** THIS EVENT IS A GO!  RAIN AND WIND SHOULD LET UP BY NOONISH SO WE SHOULD BE INSIDE JULIANA'S ENJOYING OUR PIZZA AT THAT TIME.  PLEASE BE AT JULIANA'S AT 10:45AM SO WE ARE FIRST IN LINE AS A GROUP TO BE SEATED.  THEY DO NOT TAKE RESERVATIONS - FIRST IN LINE GET SEATED. 



AFTER JULIANA'S WE SHALL SEE HOW THE LINE IS AT GRIMALDI'S TO BE SEATED OR IF IT IS NOT RAINING WE CAN ORDER TAKE OUT AND EAT ON PARK BENCHES ALONG THE WATER UNDER BROOKLYN BRIDGE PARK.   THEN WE CONTINUE TO WILLIAMSBURG AND BROOKLYN BREWERY*** 

General Subway instructions...Brooklyn bound R train to COURT ST station which is about 10mins walk to Juliana's and Grimaldi's near the foot of the Manhattan Bridge on the Brooklyn side.  To go to Williamsburg (Brooklyn Brewery) walk to COURT ST station picking up Manhattan bound R to UNION SQUARE/14 ST Station in Manhattan then transfer for the L train which we take to BEDFORD AVE Station for Williamsburg, Brooklyn. Then walk to Brooklyn Brewery and Motorino's Pizza after.


Mama Mia! We live in a city with the best pizza in the world so why not join me in a ICONIC BROOKLYN PIZZA CRAWL with a few interesting stops along the way!!!  We shall sample pizzas (likely share a pie into 16 slices rather than the usual 8 slices so we can pace ourselves) from each pizzeria stop and move to the next amazing pizzeria. 

Warning - I love pizza and I will be returning from being in Asia for a month on Jan 1 - so I will be like a crack addict seeking his first hit in a month - my crack is pizza.  Come and share the happiness!

*** Carpool spreadsheet is ready. Passengers who requested carpools have been assigned to drivers. Passengers please contact drivers asap or Will Fong or you risk to be removed from the carpool and replaced with another passenger. Carpool cost is $5 to drivers.

Currently we still have space for Brooklyn passengers.

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1TNNdIWFmanXEp3Z9hGgEnUCiFcx6X675g8AJ3P2WBvA/edit?usp=sharing

STOP #1 - DUMBO Area - 10:45am - Juliana's Pizza - 19 Old Fulton St, Brooklyn, NY 11201

http://www.julianaspizza.com/

STOP #1a - 12noon - Grimaldi's Pizza - Under the Brooklyn Bridge - 1 Front Street, Brooklyn, NY 11201

http://www.grimaldis-pizza.com/home

STOP #1b - Stroll of Brooklyn Bridge Park.  Brooklyn Bridge Park, an 85‐acre sustainable waterfront park stretching 1.3 miles along Brooklyn’s East River shoreline with amazing views of lower Manhattan, the bridges, and surrounding areas.

http://www.brooklynbridgepark.org/


STOP #2 - Williamsburg Area- 3pm - Brooklyn Brewery Tour (Free Tour) & Tasting Room - 79 North 11th Street in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, 11249 between Berry Street and Wythe Avenue.

http://brooklynbrewery.com/visit/visiting-the-brooklyn-brewery#the-brewery-link

STOP #2a - East River State Park - 90 Kent Avenue
Brooklyn, NY 11211.  East River State Park is a seven-acre waterfront park located along the East River in the Williamsburg neighborhood of Brooklyn. It offers visitors a stunning view of the Manhattan skyline, a delightful play area, and the green space provides many opportunities for recreation and relaxation. - See more at: http://nysparks.com/parks/155/details.aspx#sthash.RGwoo5Ui.dpuf


STOP #3 - Motorino's - 139 Broadway Brooklyn, NY 11211

http://motorinopizza.com/new_york/williamsburg



Possible Alternate or Additional Stop - Roberta's - 261 Moore St, Brooklyn, NY 11206

http://robertaspizza.com/


Carpools will be set up as we have drivers attend.  A Carpool Spreadsheet will be created closer to event date.  Carpool costs for passengers originating in NYC - $5.  Passengers originating from NJ - $10. 

If we do not have enough vehicles then we will just have to rely on the MTA subway system!

Updates and changes to itinerary may follow.


Hope you to see you on this foodie crawl!  Be there or be Sicilian square!

Cheers!

Will

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Quietly, peacefully mend and meld mind and spirit as prescribed by the  Master Messengers throughout the Ages —  Jesus, Siddhārtha Gautama, Mohammad, Confucius, Handsome Lake, Lao Tzu, White Buffalo Calf Woman, The Peacemaker, Zoroaster, Mahavira, Mani, to name a few.

We do not defend, or offend, any particular religion or belief system, or anthropomorphize any deity.  

Instead, we aim to personify the Mind-Spirit connection through the words of the Masters, and make it our way of life in order to:

  • Build and maintain excellent character, as is our birthright.

  • Embody active compassion as a celebration of life and living.

  • Clarify and awaken the God within as both a journey and a destination.

  • Reunite the positive (Spirit) with the powerful (Mind) in us all to actualize our awesome potential.

That's the goal of our 11:00 a.m. Sunday Gathering.

At 12:00 p.m., leave refreshed, renewed, and re-energized, and in control of what comes next.

Speaking of what comes next, we sometimes commune afterward  by way of food, drink, and conversation.  It would be great if you joined us!

Consider it.

We look forward to your company. 


Respectfully,


Rev. Alexander

results.description:
http://nysec.org/sites/default/files/styles/medium/public/images/adlerchuman.jpg?itok=LkgJq0cQ Dr. Joseph Chuman

Pat Debrovner presides 

Do you believe in reincarnation? Neither do we. Nonetheless, Ethical Culture founder Felix Adler will take the stage in ceremonial hall at this platform - in the body of Leader Joseph Chuman, who will bring us up to date on what Adler has been thinking since his death in 1933. Leader Anne Klaeysen will conduct this no holds barred interview.

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.

results.description:
Found a cool workshop where we can learn to weave and make our own wall hangings! In this workshop we will review the tools and function of a lap loom, shuttle and warping the loom. Basic techniques that will be covered are the tabby (plain weave), slit tapestry, soumak, rya knot and pile loop. All materials for weaving and learning techniques are included, but we can bring fibers (yarns or string) and objects that we would like to incorporate in their tapestries.

For more information and to sign up: https://goo.gl/FHO5wX

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
